story:
Hey friends! 

I am so excited to finally tell you about this project. What started out as a solo record, has turned into a band. The new members are incredibly talented and solid guys. I could not be more stoked to have them on board!

We are officially releasing the first single “REVIVAL FIRE” today! It will be streaming for FREE on our website. We are also launching pre-orders of the upcoming EP that is scheduled for release summer 2016. You will be able access a download of the single “Revival Fire”. The tracks are being mixed by long time friend, Joel Bruyere from Thousand Foot Krtuch and we are stoked about how they are sounding!

The Story

This project is the result of a 15+ year journey that began with feeling the pull between two different worlds. Mainstream rock and worship. This project is the first taste of that new sound.

The Band

Born and raised in Ontario Canada, Josh began pursuing music at a young age and stepped into the industry in his late teens. Numerous collaborations have led to a #1 hit on radio & songs on television and movie soundtracks. He has multiple nominations and won Juno’s, Dove and Gospel Music Awards. He has toured across Canada and the US with  Manafest, Thousand Foot Krutch, Drew Brown and Sky Terminal. He is now residing in Redding, California with his wife and three children.

The rest of guys have come from around the globe, landing in Redding, California. They all met each other serving on the Bethel worship team . The band members are: Gian Peck (Drums/Australia), Taylor Clarke (Keys & Programming/United States) and Cristiano Rede (Bass/Brazil). 

What We Need & What You Get

 As this project has grown, our families have partnered together to make this happen. We are independent, no label support, no marketing or promotional machines. Years of work have already gone into bringing these songs to life, and as we preparing to launch the EP we are needing help.  

So we are reaching out to ask for YOUR support!

This IndieGoGo campaign has been launched to fund the completion of this EP. There are some awesome perks packages and will be trying to add new things along the way. If there is something you would like to see, reach out and let’s see if we can make it happen.

Where is all the funds going?

We have set a goal of $5,000.

This will help to cover production, mixing, mastering, duplication, packaging, artwork, photos, digital distribution, radio, publishing, administration fee’s and all the other extended costs that come with launching a brand new project.

The Impact

Although this is our first independent project, we are not new to the music industry and recording studio albums. By supporting us, you will be helping to cover the costs so that we can fully complete and release this project. Our hope is that this music will connect with your heart.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially there are other ways in which your support would be felt. If you believe in what we are doing, then please help us get the word out about this project. Listen to what we are creating, see if it speaks to you and then share it with others who will catch the vision.

Thank you so much for your support.

We’re excited to see this record get released!

Josh MacIntosh, Gian Peck, Taylor Clarke, Cristiano Rede

www.Joshmacintosh.com

story:
Homespun is a multi-venue music festival that takes place over a four day period in July in the Medway Towns usually in around 7 or 8 venues. It began in 2013 and has had three successful years. This year it will run from 20th to 23rd July.

The aim is to celebrate the best of Medway music together with some interesting acts from other parts of the country.

The festival is run by a small band of volunteers with the assistance of the wider music community in Medway. Most gigs are free and the cost of the bands is covered by the venues, mainly pubs. For the small number of larger gigs we sell tickets to cover the cost of venue hire, sound equipment and artists. In 2015 we broke even for the first time.

The ethos of Homespun is to be a grass roots community led festival. We want to keep that feel. We don’t want to suddenly have a big bang and fall on our faces, and neither do we want to change the balance away from local artists.

But we would like the ability to grow the festival organically, gradually reach more people, and attract some more interesting and better known bands from outside the area.

We narrowly missed out on booking a couple of exciting acts last year simply because the financial risk was a bit too eye watering. No one gets paid for being a Homespun organiser and that will remain the case, but we’d rather avoid putting large amounts of our own money at risk.

The money we raise will help us to

-  Book more interesting and/or well-known bands

-  Be able to use better sound and lighting equipment

-  Do more publicity and promotion to attract more people and in turn to spread to more venues.

We don’t need massive amounts of money to do this, we are still aiming to run a tight ship and break even wherever we can. Any money not used will roll over to next year.

story:
Love and the Zealous sprouted from the boredom of two young guys--Richard Love and Marcus Leemann--two misfits going nowhere in a small Texas town. A friendship formed: they spent hours whiling away, singing and strumming the guitar. Their musical roots evolved from the artists their parents enjoyed:  Otis Redding, Marvin Gaye, Al Green, Etta James, Sam Cooke, The Allman Brothers, Lynyrd Skynyrd, The Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, Led Zeppelin, to name a few.

    Soon, ink began to hit paper and lyrics emerged. These two free spirited old souls were raised under the wide-open Texas skies and learned to lean upon their unique perspectives borne of hardships and heartaches and emerged with a compelling sound all their own. Their passion, dedication and perseverance have led them to where they are today; a band on the road to being recognized and seeing their name in lights. Share the Love, and the light will shine. 

    Come February 2016, Love and the Zealous will be leaving Texas and heading to California to hang with the fine folks at Jam In The Van and get started on recording their first full length album, turning a dream into reality. 

    Please, check out our videos and songs below. Love and the Zealous needs your help--donations can be monetary (grab a perk!), or even just taking the time to spread the word about this project would mean the world!

LTZ Facebook

LTZ YouTube

LTZ Bandcamp

story:
About me:

My name is Patrick Lawlor my stage name is Padraig Lalor. I grew up in Belfast at the height of the troubles in the 1970s and 80s. I gained a scholarship to Ruskin College, Oxford in 1989 and went on to study Law, Philosophy and Politics.

My Music:

Whilst in Oxford I met other musicians and in 1994 set up the Traditional Irish Band Henry Marten's Ghost. The band is still going today and has recorded 5 albums to date. We do over 100 gigs a year and you can find out more about us here.

Henry Marten's Ghost

I have always been interested in writing my own songs chronicling the stories of Ireland, north and south, ancient and modern. My first solo album Ismay's Dream was released in 2012.  It featured songs and stories from those who worked and sailed died and survived on the Titanic. 

The album has had great reviews and radio play. The songs still feature in my concerts today. See the video gallery for tracks.

My Campaign:

This is my second solo album and this time I wanted to write about my life rather than the lives of "heroes and villains". I wanted to tell the stories of my family, our history and how it felt to grow up in troubled Belfast. It was an exciting but very dangerous time to grow up and we don't hear too many songs that deal with staying alive and finding something to celebrate amidst the madness.

I'm really lucky to have met so many musicians along the way who have all helped with the making of the record and I'm really proud to have worked with such a fine crew. The musicians who have contributed include Fyfe Dangerfield and Grieg Stewart from the indie band Guillemots, award-winning folk musician Tim Edey, Rag Foundation member Danny Kilbride. Others include  singer-songwriter Sarah Passmore, Gill O' Shea and Anthony "Wal" Coughlan. 

The New Album:

The album is being produced by Grieg Stewart and has been mixed by him and Oxford based Minus Toke. It features songs I have written about growing up in Northern Ireland and the impact of children growing up in conflict. One song "Light up your Hearts" co written by Fyfe Dangerfield is about the ongoing peace in Ireland and shows what can be done. Others include immigration and exile. The theme of the album is a narrative on growing up around conflict and political turmoil.  Listen to samples of new album here: New Album Samples


What I Need:

Having got to the mixing stage I now need to push to the final hurdles of having the album mastered and pressed. I need your help in getting this album released. We've done all the behind the scenes work and now we need to get it distributed. 

I have a distribution contract with Proper Records and have my own label Black Horse Productions. To achieve this I need to raise around £2,000.

Costs:

Mastering: £650.00

Pressing: £700.00

Artwork: £350.00

Press/Media: £300.00

story:
Cross the Divide's Full-Length Album: FEARLESS!

New England's fastest growing rock act - Cross the Divide - needs YOU. Since 2014, the band has been showing the world that rock isn't dead, and that it is a force to be reckoned with.  We, (Zac, Chase, and Jake) have spent countless hours working to create a catalog of genre driving original songs to compile a full-length album to put us on the map.

We have gathered contacts, learned the ins-and-outs of the music industry, and have worked hard to truly position ourselves for industry success. Many challenges lie ahead, but the biggest and most imminent is this: funding. For this, WE NEED YOU!

What We Need & What You'll Get!

We are looking to raise $15k. If we reach our goal, here's a basic breakdown of where your contributions will go:

  • $6,000 - RECORDINGS.
    Top quality music needs top quality production. We want to make sure this CD is nothing short of incredible.
  • $2,500 - PUBLICITY
    We are working with a top notch PR firm to get this music out to the world!
  • $1,000 - MUSIC VIDEO
    What is a CD release without an awesome new music video!? (Our 3rd!)
  • $2,000 - CDs and Distribution
    This covers manufacturing the physical CDs, and distribution.
  • $2,500 - MERCH and Hidden Costs
    Assuming this release goes right, we'll need to tour, and we'll need to get more tees, stickers, posters, etc made up. This portion will also cover any potential extra costs that were unforeseen.
  • $1,000 - FEES (or approx 8-10% of funds raised)
    Rasing money costs money. That's just the truth of it. A cut goes to indiegogo and credit card processing.

What will you get? Check out all of our "perks". We have some cool and unique options available for you! On top of whatever perk level you select, you will have OUR UNDYING GRATITUDE. Seriously.

The Impact

If you've read this far, here's some more insight into the band. Our music isn't just that. We make music with a purpose. We have chosen to devote our lives to making music that helps those around us. We hear all the time from people who say that our music has given them hope, stopped suicides, reignited their faith, and much more. Your donation isn't just buying music, it's changing lives.

The truth is: you're changing our lives too. Your donation tells us that you believe in us and what we do; and that means the world to us.

Risks & Challenges

We WILL make this CD a reality one way or another. If we do not reach our goal, it may take extra time to complete, or it will not get proper marketing, but the music will reach your ears.
The biggest risks here are just the success levels. The closer we get to our goal, the better chance we have of really making this CD be everything we want it to be, and expanding the reach of our music to the point that we can devote ourselves to it more fully.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute and we totally understand; but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways you can:

  • Tell other people about this!
  • Direct people to our social media pages.
  • While you're at it, ask other folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please make use of the the Indiegogo share tools!

That's it! Thank you all so much. We love each and every one of you.

story:
Akwaaba!

MusicXChange™ Ghana  is a nonprofit project that links music and healthcare in a creative, innovative and sustainable way...


At MusicXChange, we believe that music is a powerful vehicle for change, and we utilize a grassroots, bottom-up participatory approach.


Our project aims to:

  • Encourage the use of Music Therapy in Ghana

  • Promote traditional Ghanaian music to a worldwide audience

  • Empower local musicians and doctors to support their careers

Music Therapy at the
HopeXChange Medical Center

At MusicXChange, we are working in close collaboration with local musicians, doctors and administrators to develop a sustainable music therapy program for Ghana at the HopeXChange Medical Center in Kumasi.

Music is an essential component of life in Ghana. and clinical research indicates that is also highly therapeutic, but the clinical practice of music therapy has only a small presence in Ghana, a country with scarce healthcare resources. 


The HopeXChange Medical Center is an independently funded and operated teaching hospital recently built in Kumasi by the NPO HopeXChange, Inc. 
For more information, visit www.hopexchangemedicalcenter.org


The MusicXChange™ Ghana album

The MusicXChange Ghana Album is a unique and diverse compilation of sounds and songs from Ghana, and is aimed at documenting and  preserving Ghana's immense musical heritage, mostly based on oral tradition  and therefore 

All songs are live performances, recorded in a field setting, between May and June 2014 in various villages and cities in Ghana. The album was mixed and mastered in Boston, MA.  Enjoy a preview at www.musicxchangeghana.org/album

About MusicXChange™ Ghana

MusicXChange, Inc. is an international non-profit organization that supports positive change through the power of music.  Our organization is a recognized 501(c)(3) tax-exempt public charity under U.S. law.
For more informations visit our website at www.musicxchangeghana.org


How can you help?

  • Help by donating

Donate whatever amount you can and receive a perk in appreciation of your contribution! We will issue U.S. charitable tax receipts for donations in accordance with U.S. tax law

  • Help by sharing

Share this campaign with your family, friends and colleagues via email and social media!

Do you need more information?

Visit our website http://musicxchangeghana.org

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, and SoundCloud

Subscribe to our newsletter 

Email us: info@musicxchangeghana.org

story:
Short Summary

Hello Im Cash... some of you might know me and some of you might not, Im an international DJ, born and raised in NYC... Finally been recording my 1st album!  Its a rock n roll album with a bit of and electro/hip hop twist, like my dj style... 
This song is really fun and something a lot of people can relate to. Ive played it several times out at Electric Room and constantly get people shazaam'ing it (even though its not out yet) so I think thats a very good sign!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Looking for $5,000 to make a wild and radical music video directed by Michele Civetta (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michele_Civetta) who has made videos for Lou Reed, Edward Sharpe & the Magnetic Zeros, Sean Lennon, Ladytron, amongst many other musicians and brands. 
  • Want a cameo? want a signed copy of my album or single or perhaps a night out drinking with me? Let me know, always happy to help!
  • If I don't reach my entire funding goal I'll go shake my ass at a strip club and hopefully be able to put up the rest. Regardless Im making the video ;)

The Impact

  • This will be my first music video and is crucial to launching my music career as a singer (rocker).
  • As a DJ iv'e played all around the world, playing nightclubs and film festivals for the last 10 years, sundance Cannes Toronto, you name it.
  • This is going to be a real down and dirty nitty gritty New York music video, keeping it real to my roots, cause after all I am a native New Yorker.

The Concept

A parody of a high powered banker and his quest to power amidst a glutinous lifestyle. To be photographed in a luxury NYC mansion. Imagine the end of daze parties of Wolf of Wall Street come to life!

Risks & Challenges

  • Not many risks, got a great imaginative team together to do the actual video production.
  • I'll strip at Chip&Dales, Im serious, I need to make this video.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • IF YOU CAN'T HELP, NO STRESS! Just spread the Cash Love
  • Share this campaign on your Facebook twitter or email it to your friends.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello Im Cash... some of you might know me and some of you might not, Im an international DJ, born and raised in NYC... Finally been recording my 1st album!  Its a rock n roll album with a bit of and electro/hip hop twist, like my dj style... This song is really fun and something a lot of people can relate to. Ive played it several times out at Electric Room and constantly get people shazaam'ing it (even though its not out yet) so I think thats a very good sign!   What We Need & What You Get  Looking for $5,000 to make a wild and radical music video directed by Michele Civetta (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michele_Civetta) who has made videos for Lou Reed, Edward Sharpe & the Magnetic Zeros, Sean Lennon, Ladytron, amongst many other musicians and brands.  Want a cameo? want a signed copy of my album or single or perhaps a night out drinking with me? Let me know, always happy to help! If I don't reach my entire funding goal I'll go shake my ass at a strip club and hopefully be able to put up the rest. Regardless Im making the video ;)    The Impact  This will be my first music video and is crucial to launching my music career as a singer (rocker). As a DJ iv'e played all around the world, playing nightclubs and film festivals for the last 10 years, sundance Cannes Toronto, you name it. This is going to be a real down and dirty nitty gritty New York music video, keeping it real to my roots, cause after all I am a native New Yorker. 

The Concept
A parody of a high powered banker and his quest to power amidst a glutinous lifestyle. To be photographed in a luxury NYC mansion. Imagine the end of daze parties of Wolf of Wall Street come to life!

   Risks & Challenges  Not many risks, got a great imaginative team together to do the actual video production. I'll strip at Chip&Dales, Im serious, I need to make this video.    Other Ways You Can Help  IF YOU CAN'T HELP, NO STRESS! Just spread the Cash Love
Share this campaign on your Facebook twitter or email it to your friends.   And that's all there is to it.

story:
I wrote most of this pitch before my song "Ballad of the Bowling Green Massacre" hit Facebook and hit a nerve. As of this writing, the song has over 108,000 views on Facebook and over 1300 on YouTube, and the response has been overwhelmingly positive. So, without abandoning my original project, I've decided to piggyback this one onto it.

"Ballad of the Bowling Green Massacre and Other Alternative Folk Songs' (working title) is in the works. Songs are being written, and studio time booked. A studio version of BOTBBM has already been recorded (and is available on CD Baby and other platforms). I've adjusted my original fundraising goal and the perks associated with the fundraising levels. This record can - and must! - be done quickly. It can also be done relatively inexpensively. It'll cost about $5000 from pre-production through packaging and duplication.

If you're unfamiliar with the song referenced above, it's a satirical take on just one of the fictions to emerge recently from the current administration in the White House. It's a folk song in the style of The Kingston Trio, The Limelighters, Phil Ochs, and others of that genre. You can see the original live Facebook iPhone post here: 

 

 

 

So, this campaign is now a "twofer." You don't have to support both. You can indicate your support for one or the other, or both, when choosing a perk. So, really, there are two funding goals: $5000 for "...Bowling Green..." and $19,485 for "Only Love."

Here's the original pitch I wrote well before the Bowling Green incident occurred:

Hi. I'm Noah Budin. Many of you reading this already know me and my music. You're here because you like my music and would love to have more of it in a format that would allow you to have a physical copy in your CD player or bytes on a digital device. That's why I'm here, too. (If you'd like to hear some of my songs, click here http://www.noahbudin.com/music.html and see what I have posted on my Music page on my website.)

People often ask me what kind of music I play and write. I used to struggle with that answer because, while I'm an old folk singer at heart, I draw from so many musical influences. But, lately, I've started describing the songs I write, and the ones I choose to play, as "message music." Not "hit you over the head message music." Just songs with words that I think are useful and important. For me, it all starts with a lyrical idea about something meaningful to me, my acoustic guitar, and a strong melody. When I have those three things lined up, I usually end up with a song that I'm passionate about playing and sharing, and that people enjoy listening to.

The climate is right for another Noah Budin CD. My new record - tentatively titled Only Love -   will only be realized with your help.

The goal is high: $19,485 (REVISED: $24,485 to include the second project). That's not an arbitrary number. I've done a lot of research and pricing, and to do this project the way I believe it should be done, the way I think it deserves to be done, will take that amount of money. This figure includes pre-production, studio time, musician and producer's fees, post-production (mixing, mastering, etc.), artwork, duplication, and eco-friendly packaging. A full prospectus and detailed cost breakdown is available upon request.

Like every fundraising campaign, I'm offering perks. I don't have many. The real perk will be the new music with its messages of hope, healing, peace, and love, recorded with the best musicians available, in a professional studio, in a diverse and multicultural atmosphere of love and respect, so that we may be able to put just a little more comfort and inspiration into the world. That, of course, may a perk for me. If you look on the right side of the screen (or wherever it shows up on your device) you'll see the physical perks I'm offering: CDs, songbooks, concerts, etc. If there's anything you'd like but don't see, contact me and we'll talk. Oh, and you can contribute in any amount you want, not just the ones listed. You'll get the perks associated with the level just under the amount you gave (e.g. If you donate $75 you'll get the $50 perks) until you get to the next level.

Here's another thing about my CDs: I don't make any money from them. And I certainly don't make any money directly from this fundraising campaign. One hundred percent of this money goes directly into making the CD. But, historically, my CDs alone are not a substantial income generator, nor do I really expect them to be. Commercially, they're great calling cards. They're a great way to get people familiar with my music, which, hopefully, leads to more live performances, which is what I really love.

And, really, I just want people to have my music. Also, so far, I only seem to record one album every ten years. So, if you do the math ... the price tag really isn't that bad.

I craft my songs very carefully. I labor over the selection process. I do not put any filler on my albums. Every song serves a purpose.

There are several fundraising platforms. I chose Indiegogo because, unlike other platforms, they let you keep whatever part of the goal you've raised at the end of the campaign, even if you haven't reached your goal. So, what happens if I don't raise the entire amount? I take what I get and go to work. I do the best I can with what I have. I may have to scale back and/or it may make the entire process take longer. But, at some point, I will have a viable product. And so will you. Once the funds are raised and I know what I'm working with, I'll set a timetable and publish a projected release date.

That's about it. Thanks for reading. I hope you'll consider giving in any amount. But, even if you can't, you can still help. Please share this campaign on social media and in any other way you can think of. These kinds of campaigns rely on wide exposure. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks again. And remember: Music brings us together, and together we can be strong.

P.S. Starting at the $100 level, all perks are negotiable. If you'd like to contribute, but don't want or need the items or services offered, message me - we can work it out! I'm happy to work with you and meet your needs. Thanks!

story:
Cari universi,

il mio intento è quello di creare un album di pura poesia, dalla musica alle parole, alla sonorità stessa che possa rilasciare nell'ascoltatore il piacere in sé di esistere e la voglia di vivere.

Il tuo contributo è fondamentale per poter creare liberamente senza schemi e vincoli, un album d'autore e non d'attore schiavo di schemi specifici da dover mantenere. La stessa musica indipendente italiana rischia ormai di essere una condanna, per questo me ne dissocio definendo non musica indipendente, ma musica d'autore; pura e semplice libertà, in cui l'ascoltatore può sentirsi richiamato dalla Coscienza attraverso il semplice ascolto.

Sono un musicista indipendente italiano dal 2008 in circolazione, ho pubblicato tre album come Margaret Lee, uno con il nome Vuoto Pneumatico, uno in collaborazione con Friedrich Cané (del movimento dei cieli) ed infine svariate collaborazioni per documentari o spettacoli teatrali firmandoli col nome Giacomo Marighelli. Ho usato il termine indipendente per questioni di facile comprensione, ma da ora in avanti me ne distacco; se amate le definizioni, parliamone come "musica d'autore". Grazie a questa campagna, qualunque sarà la cifra raggiunta,  l'album potrà essere mixato e masterizzato, stampato sottoforma di compact-disc e permette la realizzazione di almeno un videoclip musicale della compagnia "Lanovantuno" di Milano.

Puoi contribuire con una semplice offerta di 2€, fino a contribuire con cifre più consistenti; io ti sono grato ad ogni modo, ricambiando con doni che ritengo preziosi, dall'album stesso, oggetti unici per i sostenitori come voi, a trattamenti individuali con la campana tibetana tenuti privatamente a Ferrara (Italia).

L'album parla d'Amore, con la a maiuscola. Ogni canzone è una storia singola a sé, ma che può essere vista come un insieme di storie; due persone che si amano e assieme generano Coscienza tra l'umanità. Innanzitutto prendendo loro coscienza, sviluppandosi ed evolvendosi. Storie d'amore anche dolorose, ma che evolvono sempre verso l'aspetto positivo di ciò che si è realmente.

Il titolo dell'opera è IL CERCHIO DELLA VITA per rispecchiare la realtà quotidiana della vita stessa. L'intento è di portare in musica la Bellezza in sé dell'Amore, ovvero di ciò che siamo noi esseri umani naturalmente.

Ti chiedo inoltre di condividere questa campagna sui tuoi social, di parlarne, di generare anche tu con la semplice condivisione musica d'autore e non d'attore.

#ILCERCHIODELLAVITA #THECIRCLEOFLIFE


GUARDA IL PRIMO VIDEOCLIP:

story:
Mein Name ist Jörg Siegwarth. Ich bin Musik- und Konzertfotograf und Herausgeber des neuen Magazin The Viewer.

Zusammen mit meinem Team, Julia Appelt und Lennart Adam, arbeiten wir an der Veröffentlichung der ersten Ausgabe.
The Viewer ist das Musikmagazin, daß dem semiprofessionellem Musikbereich und seinen Fans eine Plattform gibt.
________________________
The Viewer is a magazine, concentrating on the semi professionell music scene and their fanbases.
__________________________
Wir sind der Meinung, daß eben diese Bands und Musiker besonders hervorgehoben werden und ihnen eine zusätzliche Bühne gegeben werden sollte.
Wir suchen die Perlen der Branche und präsentieren sie in einem professionellem Rahmen, damit der Musikfan neue Eindrücke erhält.
Es wird The Viewer nur als eine Printausgabe geben.
Wöchentlich gibt es Berichte in Form eines Vlogs unserer Webseite.
_____________________________
In our opinion these bands and fans have to be more in focus. We are looking for the outstanding ones  in the music scene and are giving them a platform to be presented well.
_______________________________

Für die Finanzierung der Printausgabe benötigen wir Eure Unterstützung. 
We need your help to finance the print issues.


Wir benötigen noch 2500 Euro, um die erste Auflage drucken lassen zu können. Sollten wir mehr einnehmen, werden die folgenden Ausgaben damit finanziert.

_____________________
We need 2500€ (app. 2800US$)  to get it printed.
__________________________

Die erste Ausgabe ist bereits inhaltlich fertig gestellt. Letzte Artikel werden gerade geschrieben und letzte Fotos retuschiert.
__________________________
The first issue is ready to get printed. Some last articles have to be written, but after all we have started to work on 2nd issue as well also.
____________________________
Wir interviewen bereits Musiker für die zweite Ausgabe und besprechen diese in regelmäßigen Redaktionsmeetings. 

Im Zuge dieser Kampagne könnt ihr hier sofort Euer eigenes Exemplar der ersten Ausgabe vergünstigt vorbestellen (s. Perks). Ihr spart 9% im Vergleich zum Einzelpreis.

___________________________
You can pre-order your issue as well using the perks.

Die Einzelausgabe wird €6,50,- kosten. 


-------------------
Für den Fall der Fälle, daß wir nicht unser Funding-Ziel erreichen, wird die erreichte Summe trotzdem in die Produktion der Printausgabe gesteckt. Jeder der ein Exemplar vorbestellt hat, wird auch eines erhalten.
-------------------
Wir von The Viewer lieben Musik.
_______________
The team of The Viewer loves music.

Die semiprofessionelle Musikszene wird seit Jahren unterschätzt. Sie ist die treibende Kraft für alles Neue. 
_________________
We want to give the semi professionell musicians a home, because that's where the creativity is still fresh.


Musiker experimentieren noch vermehrt, sie probieren aus, entwickeln sich zu echten Highlights und gehen doch in der schieren Masse der Bands unter. 
Diese Bands und Musiker verdienen mehr Aufmerksamkeit, weil sie auch unser aller Leben bereichern.
Wir von The Viewer suchen diese Bands und Musiker und bieten ihnen und dem Musikfan die Plattform, damit beide Seiten zusammenkommen. Es ist eine Win/Win Situation.
Musik gehört zum Leben dazu.
Durch meine Arbeit als Musikfotograf habe ich viele Einblick in diese Szene.
Julia Appelt ist DJ und Lennart Adam gelernter Journalist.
Wir sind das Kompetenz-Team, wenn es um die Veröffentlichung für ein Magazin wie The Viewer geht.
-----------------------
Trotz allem Engagement und Motivation...natürlich bleibt ein Risiko. Ein neues Magazin zu etablieren ist in der heutigen Zeit riskant und benötigt einen langen Atem.
Wir sind uns dessen vollkommen bewußt und arbeiten hart daran The Viewer einem breiten Publikum zugänglich zu machen. 
Wir starten bewußt mit einer kleinen Auflage und organisieren den gesamten Ablauf und Vertrieb im Team.
The Viewer soll 4x pro Jahr, jeweils pro Quartal, erscheinen.
So können wir Nachhaltigkeit erzielen und kommende Hürden gezielter bearbeiten.
Das Ziel ist klar formuliert: Ein Musikmagazin etablieren, daß für Musiker und Fans gleichermaßen von Nutzen ist.
Die Unterstützung aus der Musikszene und bei den Fans ist bereits enorm. 
Innerhalb von 4 Wochen können wir einen steten Zuwachs bei Facebook erreichen (die Seite existiert erst seit 4 Wochen). Die Reichweite ist organisch erzeugt.
 


Unsere Reichweite bei Facebook beträgt z.Z. 3584 und ist stetig wachends. 

 
Auch, wenn Du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, hilft es uns enorm, wenn Du über Deinen Facebookaccount für diese Kampagne und unsere Webseite werben könntest.
 
 Vielen Dank.

 Auch, wenn Du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, hilft es uns enorm, wenn Du über Deinen Facebookaccount für diese Kampagne und unsere Webseite werben könntest.  Vielen Dank.

story:
T H E   P R O J  E C T

Hi, my name is Andy Feller. I’ve been writing songs since I was 12. I started playing guitar a little bit before that, been playing music for a while now.

Nothing else brings me as much joy as playing music, the writing process and hashing out songs.

Up to this point, everything I have done as far as recording has been demo type quality so I’m super excited to  finally have some legit recordings going. I have been in studio with Josh Niles, he has a really awesome, cozy spot here in Nashville. Josh is such a good dude and has helped me a lot getting everything focused on what we are trying to go for. It’s been so cool seeing these songs finally start to come to life. 

We’re doing 5 original songs, and we also brought some awesome talent in.

Will Chapman from Colony House came in and tracked the drums on the EP. He brought a lot of cool energy. He’s a really good guy and I’m stoked about the drum parts he laid down!

The dude himself Adrian Walther tore it up in the studio as well. We hashed out some really cool synth parts, I'm excited about those elements of the album for sure!

Of course I did some tracking as well which was super cool. Lots of singing to say the least! We used a ton of different guitars and amps to really dial in some rad tones. 

At this point the project is unfortunately on pause due to lack of funding. We have just about everything tracked, but all the songs are still needing to be mixed and then mastered. Studio time must be booked and until then it will continue to be pushed back.

T H E   I N V I T A T I O N

I invite you to be a part of this process with me! It is not only an honor and a joy to involve others in this process, but it is also essential. Here is how you can be a part:

Your contributions will be going towards studio hours, mixing, mastering, & physical merchandise production.

In return, you’ll receive the incentive package of your choice as a special thank you! 

Please remember that if you want to help but don't really care about the rewards you can always enter ANY dollar amount on the pledge page, even as little as $1! Every little bit helps and every single pledge is appreciated!

Your contribution is VERY important to me, if I have any money that comes in over the goal it will not be wasted. I'm asking for the lowest possible amount I need to complete this EP. Any additional funds I make will go towards getting this music farther like filming a music video, booking show dates, advertising & PR. I promise to put your money to good use. 

T H E   I M P A C T 

It's difficult to express how much this EP would help.

I've had these these songs and ideas in my head for a long time time now and it would be amazing to have the opportunity to get them released.

A well-recorded EP would create so many opportunities for me. I've recorded demos, and have clips on my phone, but nothing I've done up to this point will even compare to what I will be releasing. This project is also critical to my music's ability to be spread and with your help this dream will become a reality.

H E L P   S P R E A D   T H E   W O R D

Please share this Indiegogo link on your social media page with friends! If you believe in me, ask your friends to believe in me too! (share links are at the top right of this page)

I'm stoked to announce the band name of this project as FOXKEEPER!!!

Follow on Instagram &Twitter:  @foxkeepermusic        Facebook.com/FOXKEEPER

Use the hashtag: #FOXKEEPER

Head to www.foxkeeper.com and hit subscribe!

R I S K S   A N D   C H A L L E N G E S

One of the bigger challenges of this project is getting the rewards to you.  I'll work hard to get them shipped to you as quickly as possible but as you know, there’s always the possibility that things go a little slower than expected, which could cause a delay. I promise to do my best, and I'll keep you in the loop with updates.

I am SO grateful for your support!

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. I can't wait to share this music with you. 

- Andy // FOXKEEPER 

<3

story:
A bit of background

Hello! I’m Stef Conner, a musician with a passion for contemporary vocal music, folksong and the soundscape of the ancient world. I love to create imaginative concert programmes that combine the very old and the very new, through compelling themes that override our compulsion to separate music into different styles.

I think it's important for professional musicians like me to provide opportunities for a broad range of people not only to listen to, but also to participate in making unusual music, including innovative modern, as well as specialist early music, because participating in the creation of an art form helps us all to better appreciate its value and its beauty. To that end, I am fundraising to support an exciting collaboration between my community singing group, Timeline Choir, the composer Kerry Andrew and her pioneering vocal trio, Juice.

I founded Timeline Choir in 2014 to provide imaginative, inspiring choral singing opportunities for people with a range of ability levels, from beginners to experienced musicians. In contrast with the many amateur choirs that rely on popular standard repertoire, I want to establish Timeline Choir as a group that not only encourages beginners to take up singing, but also inspires them to perform cutting-edge new music, push boundaries and challenge preconceptions, bringing experienced and inexperienced singers together in ambitious yet inclusive projects. Members of the choir are not required to read music, but are encouraged pay close attention to how they use their voices, work hard and be open-minded. The choir rehearses weekly in two locations, Cambridge and Surrey, and I travel between the two places to conduct both choirs.

READ MORE:

www.stefconner.com

www.timelinesongs.org


Timeline Choir, 2014

Why Bard-Song?

This November, Kerry Andrew, Juice and Timeline Choir will collaborate to produce a vibrant Shakespeare-inspired concert of vocal music, in honour of the 400th anniversary of Shakespeare’s death. We will give two concerts – one for each Timeline Choir location, in Cambridge and Surrey. Our eclectic programme evokes the boisterous atmosphere of a Globe performance, in which people from all levels of Elizabethan society – from the richest to the poorest – came together to be captivated by drama. Kerry is composing a piece for Timeline Choir and Juice to perform together, incorporating renaissance texts, folksong and Elizabethan popular songs into her edgy, experimental style, to animate themes and imagery explored in Shakespeare's plays.


The commission capitalizes on Kerry’s knack for combining the cutting-edge and virtuosic with the fun-to-learn and easy-to-execute, allowing mixed ability groups to put on ambitious, high quality performances. Her work will be woven into a programme of contemporary Shakespeare settings, Elizabethan songs and arrangements of folksongs that reflect on Shakespearean themes, all injected with a shot of Juice’s experimental flair.

As well as contemporary settings, we will sing renaissance compositions by Robert Johnson, which were included in the earliest performances of Shakespeare’s plays, and Thomas Ravenscroft, who, unusually, drew his inspiration from the popular songs of the day and the sounds of the street, such as the cries of markets traders, children’s game songs and tunes for making merry. We’re singing the Elizabethan pieces in Original Pronunciation (Shakespeare’s accent), so you’ll hear all the fabulous rhymes, puns and peculiarities that get lost when the music is sung in Modern English. Ravenscroft also had a particular fondness for bird-related rounds, madrigals and part-songs, which, coupled with the prevalence of metaphor-laden references to birds in Shakespeare’s work, inspired the title ‘British Bard-Song!’. Te-wit te-woo!

READ MORE:

www.juicevocalensemble.net

www.kerryandrew.net

Juice are: Kerry Andrew, Sarah Dacey and Anna Snow

What are we singing?

The programme includes:

Thomas Ravenscroft, Robert Johnson, Orlando Gough, Vaughan Williams, Kerry Andrew, Sarah Dacey/Anna Snow, Stef Conner (me), James MacMillan and Wilfrid Mellers, as well as lots of Shakespeare readings with musical accompaniment...

Concert dates and times:

Saturday 19th November 2016

7:30pm (pre-concert workshop at 5:30pm)

Emmanuel United Reformed Church, Trumpington Street, Cambridge CB2 1RR

Saturday 26th November 2016

7:30pm (pre-concert workshop at 5:30pm)

St Martin’s Church, Dorking, Surrey RH4 1DW

More than just a concert...

Both performances will be preceded by workshops, providing opportunities for a wide range of people to participate. I love to incorporate imaginative participation opportunities into all of Timeline Choir’s concerts, blurring the boundaries between performers and audience, and facilitating total immersion in the music. Audience members who are willing will have several opportunities to get involved in the music making. (Don’t worry, no-one will be forced to sing!)

We will also film and record the concerts to make keepsakes for the choir members and their family and friends. Using the recordings online will be a huge help to us, boosting the profile of the choir, showing off the members' talent and hard work, and encouraging new members to get involved.

This project is so much more than a pair of concerts to us: it is an opportunity to make an exciting impact on our local music scenes, our first chance to commission new work from a brilliantly creative composer and to work with a world-renowned ensemble, and, most importantly, a chance to raise the bar higher than ever before in terms of Timeline Choir’s artistic ambitiousness.

What We Need

We have already raised a large portion of the budget (£3800) ourselves through social fundraising, donations, choir members’ subscriptions, CD sales and grants and we expect to raise £3000 from merchandise and ticket sales. We need a further £2000 to make the project a big success. Here’s where the money’s going (in brief):

Total budget: £8800

£1000 venue hire

£4300 performer fees

£1500 new music commission fees

£500 travel expenses

£200 programme and sheet music printing

£1300 advertising

In addition to the above, the choir members, participating musicians and I have pooled our resources to come up with a whopping £4500-worth of in-kind contributions to the project, including marketing art work, programme design, musical arrangements, costume design, social media, interval drinks, box office, leafleting, staging, fundraising... and a new composition by me. We work hard to make amazing things happen!

What You Get

Supporting us is an awesome thing to do and we appreciate every penny so SO much. We also want to make sure you receive amazing, unique perks in return, so you can keep something special to remind you of our mutual awesomeness! We’re all in this together and every little tiny bit of support is precious and crucial.

We’re offering unique, one-off rewards like reserved front-row seats with interval drinks, video links for those of you who can’t attend the concerts, signed CDs (new and old), signed programmes and art work, guest list passes to future concerts... and even the chance to hear your name in an Elizabethan madrigal! We’re also offering creative sponsorship packages including names, messages and logos in our programmes, and on our Youtube videos and website, in combination with the gifts above. There’s something for everyone, so please take a look at the list!

Most importantly of all, the music will be beautiful, imaginative and very, very atmospheric. We’re super proud of the programme already and know that you will be proud to have played a part in making it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every financial contribution, no matter how small, helps us to bring this project to life and means the world to us! Not everyone has cash to spare, but there are lots of other ways to get involved and help out, all of which also make a HUGE difference.

Please like and share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter (and any other social media you use), tell your friends, check out our website, join our mailing list... aaaand, if you’re Cambridge or Surrey-based, come along to a Timeline Choir rehearsal and sing with us! You’re more than welcome! :)

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools above...

story:
We are "The City Limits" and "The Super Groupers", and we are two groups (nine guys) from Oahu who will be touring in the ending of July with the intent of expanding the horizons of Hawaii's Hip Hop scene.  It has always been a struggle for Hawaii Hip Hop artists to spread the music to the masses especially with the constraints of travelling across water to make it out.  We truly believe that what Hawaii has to offer to the culture is something that needs to be heard across the states and eventually internationally.  

We humbly ask for your assistance in helping us make this dream a reality as we prepare for this upcoming tour.  The donations of money will help supplement our travel and lodging throughout this hot summer tour.   Listed in our fundraiser are some incentives and services which you would receive for different amounts of monetary donations.  You can be a part of this movement and help The City Limits and Super Groupers make this Hawaii Hip Hop music spread throughout the mainland and beyond.  

We greatly appreciate all the support from all our fans, friends, and family.  We do ask is that you spread the word and help us attain our monetary goal.  Mahalo for your time... ALOHA!

story:
Short Summary

Making music in Nashville is a dream come true for Malachi and Isaiah Coble. A dream that God has put into the hearts of their family legacy for years.  We are so hopeful and inspired by this enormous opportunity and with your help the world will soon be introduced to I M Coble, our music and our story.

We feel extremely blessed to have the chance to share this journey as a family.   Having the opportunity to travel to Nashville to work with Abram Dean and Daniel Ross, two of the music industry's top new songwriting and music producer teams, is a dream come true for us.  And what makes this all so cool is that we will be filming our journey as a documentary.  Filming a documentary of our journey to Nashville will be an opportunity for us to create content that will tell our story and the making of our music from a multimedia prospective.  Your contribution will help with the making of our music, filming by a professional team and the post production.  When the project is done, we will submit to film festivals and do screenings in conjunction with live performances.  We will be working with Bill Herndon, M2M Studios a production/marketing and branding company that specializes in the development and launching of new artists and multimedia content.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $25,000, which will fund the following:

·  8 professional produced songs (The music will be produced by credited Songwriters and Music Producers based in Nashville)

·  Filming our Journey (Documentary Style).  A professional video production team headed by Producer/Director Bill Herndon, will produce, film, and edit the documentary

·  Website

·  Documentary Screening and Performance Showcase 

We are super excited about the perks we will be providing.  All of the perks will have the I M Coble personality.

The Impact

Making it in today's entertainment industry is a challenge because of the cost associated with creating professional sounding music, the marketing and branding of your music. However the biggest challenge is knowing the right people that have the relationships and the experience to help navigate the treacherous waters of the entertainment industry. Working with 7 Sails and M2M Studios has given us the opportunity to work with a team of experts that have had success in the entertainment industry and that also have the relationships to help launch I M Coble.  In Nashville we will not only get great sounding music we also will be producing a docu-series (documentary style) that will be used as a marketing tool to share our music and our story in an organic manner, which will help build our social media. The docu-series will be launched online and in conjunction with a strong social media strategy.  Our goal is to create music and a documentary that will inspire and empower in all aspects of life (Love, Family, Friends, Hardship).


Risks & Challenges

With any project comes risks and challenges. However with the guidance of entertainment industry expert Bill Herndon (M2M Studios) and Jody Orellana (7 Sails Management) we feel confident that their years of experience working in the music industry and TV/Film will help us achieve our creative goals.  We are also so blessed as a family to have two great parents who really believe in the dream, to the point that they are also putting in their own money to help make our dreams come true for I M Coble.  We are a resourceful and determined family and we will face any challenge head-on. And with your help we will get to Nashville and record a great album and documentary.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help us in a big way by sharing our story and the campaign link with your friends and families!  You can use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

However with the guidance of entertainment industry expert Bill Herndon (M2M Studios) and Jody Orellana (7 Sails Management) we feel confident that their years of experience working in the music industry and TV/Film will help us achieve our creative goals.  We are also so blessed as a family to have two great parents who really believe in the dream, to the point that they are also putting in their own money to help make our dreams come true for I M Coble.  We are a resourceful and determined family and we will face any challenge head-on. And with your help we will get to Nashville and record a great album and documentary.
   Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help us in a big way by sharing our story and the campaign link with your friends and families!  You can use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

story:
25 Years of Hip-Hop Without Ego

I started rapping in 1992, and in 1998 I started playing instruments and producing my own music.  In the 24 (25 when I release the CD in January) years since, I have sacrificed and worked very hard to follow my dreams.  There have been times were it was very tough.  From the early days of being heckled at shows, to at times being unable to pay rent, and even being homeless.   Those times have been absolutely worth it, as music has saved my life (after my mom passed away), and enhanced my life.  It has given me purpose every day, and I've had countless amazing experiences because of the incredible fans that have truly understood my music!

I continue to follow those dreams today because it is my passion and purpose in life, and 2017 could be the year that I'm able to become a professional musician, with your help.  The money I raise from this campaign will allow me to re-record some vocals in a professional studio and give the album the best production quality possible. and then get CDs manufactured.  I'll be able to send the CD, which contains 25 career defining songs, to music publications, newspapers, and radio stations.  The more I raise from this campaign, the more publications I'll be able to reach, increasing the likelihood of getting the exposure I need to make a living from my music.  

You'll get warm and fuzzy feelings from helping me achieve my dreams, as well as a CD that contains 25 songs, and album artwork for all 12 of my albums.

Tracklist:

  1. Do What You Love
  2. Playing a Little Basketball
  3. Chillin' at the Papa
  4. Extra
  5. Love, Funk and Soul
  6. U Inspire Me
  7. Prime Time Players
  8. Open Mic
  9. Time To Make It Happen
  10. No Ego
  11. Wonder
  12. With Love We Find Hope
  13. A Little About Me
  14. We're All Superheroes
  15. I Don't Need
  16. Weightliftin' Jam
  17. Wisdom In My Writing
  18. Time
  19. Birthday Song
  20. Go With The Flow
  21. I Can Feel The Love
  22. Starting Over
  23. Wonder Years
  24. Low Stress Diet
  25. Inventor

The official release date for the album will be January 19th, 2017, my 38th birthday.  Supporting the campaign is a great birthday present for me, but you'll also get the album before anyone else!  You'll likely get the CD before Thanksgiving!  

Thank you for all you have done for me, and thank you in advance if you help make my dreams come true full time in 2017!

With love,
Mission Man

Find Out More About Me

If you want to find out more, here are some good links:
Website: missionman.net
Facebook: facebook.com/missionman
YouTube: youtube.com/user/missionman1979
Great article about my career: woub.org/2016/09/30/25-years-of-hip-hop-without-ego-mission-man/
25 Album Design Contest: www.facebook.com/events/165925180477943/

story:
COMFORT IN CHAOS (19+) is an immersive, multi-sensory music journey that combines high art, hypnotic theatrical performances, futuristic projection mapped visuals, mesmeric tactile environments and a 360 surround sound experience forming the synopsis of a supernatural macrocosm of weird.

Inspired by the narratives of the latest sonic projects by CHELSEA GRIMM [“Busshead”] and SO LOKI [“V”], COMFORT IN CHAOS is a collaborative production that is bringing together Vancouver's emerging creative underground. 

    Set inside a transformed secret location, this three-hour multi-dimensional live show will induce you into a trippy ass dream state - [something out of Kubrick's iconic “Eyes Wide Shut” infused with  the captivatingly cultish “Yeezus” experience]. In the spirit of all Hallow’s eve, guests are invited to partake in an obscure ritualistic masquerade presented by OWAKE records.

††

Your contribution to this collaborative project is pushing us to make movements that matter to us. We are not in it for the money or notoriety. We want to make art, we want to eat, we want to struggle for reasons that make sense, we want to live. We want to put Vancouver on the map, we want to cultivate creativity, we want to take this thing around the world because we have something to say. LONG LIVE THE V.

CONTRIBUTION GOES TOWARDS

  1. Building custom set/stage pieces, installation materials, costumes & wardrobe
  2. Renting sound, tech equipment, and purchasing software (tech heavy show)
  3. Hiring staff including (security, bartenders, lighting and visual technicians etc...)
  4. Craft (feed our peoples)
  5. Venue Rental

COLLABORATORS:

  • So Loki
  • Chelsea Grimm
  • Chromedestroyer
  • Skyharbour Studios
  • ShapeShifterStudio
  • Daly Co. & Yew Woodshop
  • SPACE
  • Lucas Hrubizna
  • Skimchi
  • EA Stewart

story:
Introduction

The Old Parish Churchyard in Irvine Scotland contains many historical graves, from friends of Robert Burns, one of the possible inventors of the screw propellor, a resurrectionist (graverobber), the family of a UK Prime Minister to the founder of the Glasgow Herald newspaper. There are also many other individuals with interesting and noteworthy stories of their own. 


The local authority has labelled some of the headstones as unsafe and may have to remove even more of them, so we thought it was time to make a searchable online record of the remaining headstones before any more history is lost.

We have already taken photographs of the main part of the churchyard and created a clickable map to allow these to be viewed through the IrvineScotland.info website. However to complete the work we need help. We need to put time into transcribing all the headstones to make them completely searchable. There is also a second part of the churchyard which needs to be recorded and if we gain enough funding there is work that can be done to save the headstones themselves. We'd like to have the time to improve the clickable map, adding zoom functions and improving the rough and ready version currently in place. And we would love to have the time to research the context of the headstones to reveal the full stories and history they represent.

About Us

My name is Fred Moody, I'm a web developer by training although I've spent a large portion of the last decade running a brewery. I was recently made redundant, and with spare time on my hands I started looking into the history of my home town, Irvine Scotland. Although I've brought up two sons in the town, I am not originally from Irvine and with work taking up much of my time while I have lived here I knew little of it's history.

I found that for a "New Town" it has hundreds of years of history. Visiting the Irvine Old Parish Churchyard to see some of the fascinating headstones there, I found many of the headstones have been marked by the Local Authority as unsafe and potentially ready to be removed, destroying a site of historical significance.

Since I now operate my own web development company, which donates 10% of its time to charitable activity, I decided that to record this history before it's lost we have to act now.  I have spent time throughout the dreich Scottish summer taking multiple pictures of each of the stones in the main churchyard and adding them to a clickable map. However the scope of this project is outside of what can be achieved in the very limited time available and spending all the time the company dedicates to charities on this one activity takes away from what we can do for other charitable projects. 

What we want to do

With contributions from you, we intend to. . .

  • Transcribe the remaining text from each and every headstone that has been added to the map.
  • Photograph the remaining headstones in the second part of the churchyard.
  • We will improve the mapping system used on the website to power the clickable map.
  • We will research the history of the headstones, putting information about the individuals interred and putting them into context with the history of the town and area.
  • We will support efforts to preserve the churchyard.
  • We will digitally record other historic sites around Irvine to promote the town and it's history to the world.

What you get

This project is mainly to record and document the history of the town, so no major rewards can be offered for your help, however what we can promise you is that:

  • You will be listed on the website as a contributor (unless you would rather remain anonymous).
  • You will receive updates about the project, with access to images and progress before it is released to the general public.
  • We will release a video recorded in the Old Parish Churchyard, thanking each contributor.
  • A warm and fuzzy feeling inside, knowing that you've helped a project to record a historic place before it is permanently lost.

What We Need

Any contribution helps and allows us to work on our goals to complete this project, even if you can only offer a small amount it all adds up and will help us to do a little more to get this project complete. The more we get, the more we can do. We have endless ideas, many historic places exist in Irvine that are yet to be accurately documented and if this project is successful then documenting and bringing historic churchyards online from across Ayrshire will allow people descended from Ayrshire folk to search and locate their ancestors and the strange and wonderful characters that make our history so vibrant.

The Impact

If we don't act now to record these headstones before they are damaged by time, or removed by the local authority for health and safety reasons, then they (and the nuggets of information they contain) will be lost. The glimpses into the history of the town and it's effects on the rest of the world, from literature to engineering, will be lost forever.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this project we would love it if you shared it with others who may be able to. Please share it on your Facebook, twitter and any other social media platforms you use. Every single person who hears about this project is an extra opportunity to raise the money we need to get this work done before it's too late.

Thank you for reading and thank you for contributing or sharing.

story:
Who We Are & Why We Need Your Help


Hello friends,

We're 3 Piece Meal - an experimental indie rock trio that dabbles in the art of bringing people together via progressive guitar riffs, groovy bass lines, funky beats, and thought provoking lyrics. But behind all that, we're 3 college students who aspire to live life making music, and using it to connect with and hopefully inspire, other people.

The band consists of Akiba Davis from Maine, Diego Baraona from El Salvador, and Asir Arif from Bangladesh. We met in Clark University about 7 months ago, and instantly hit it off. We've played over 40 shows since, most of them local. We've been working on our debut album for the past 5 months. We were initially expecting funding from our college, but we did not end up receiving that. We are already 70% of the way done with the recording process, and are going to need a helping hand in order to produce and distribute the album to you!

If you can help us complete our debut album, you will definitely be helping us kickstart our careers. You will most importantly play a huge role in supporting young, independent musicians who do music for the purposes of bringing people together, strengthening the indie music scene, and spreading important messages about multiple social and philosophical issues.


What's So Cool About This Album?

This 9-track debut album that we're releasing is in fact a concept album about contemplating social and political revolution. The songs tend to raise awareness about various, important issues of war for profit, sexism, climate change, corporate capitalism, and more. A lot of people are already aware of many issues, but constantly find themselves in a runt when it comes to actually doing something. A lot of the album talks about how it is definitely hard to do our part and give back sometimes, but it's certainly far from impossible. In fact, we can still do a lot without having to make major sacrifices. Ultimately however, even though we aim to create art that makes people think, we're excited to see what you take away from our music, and how you use it!

Check out this unmixed instrumental preview of our album! This is pretty raw and we're still recording vocals, but this will definitely give you a glimpse into the album's sound so far!



What We Need - What You Get!


We need to raise at least 3000 US dollars to successfully finish and market our album. Here's where all the money will go to:

- Album Production - mixing and mastering ($1000)

- Album sleeve/poster design - 4 panel wallet  ($600)

- Equipment - software plugins, acoustic panels, accessories ($200)

- Printing 200 CDs - ($400)

- Social media promotion/advertisement/putting album up online - ($400)

- Additional miscellaneous costs - ($100)

The album is being produced by Rakat Zami and the album design/art is being done by Tilok Adnan from LINE. They're friends of ours who have agreed to give us a great deal on their services! Also, big shout out to Jon McClees for helping us with video and photography all this time!


We Have Many Unique & Amazing Perks!


- If you donate $7, you get a free download link to the entire digital copy of the album, along with a PDF of the album sleeve design, and a personal thank you within the physical album (Yup, your name inside the album just for 7 bucks)!

- If you donate $14, and you live in Worcester or Boston MA (near our current hometown), YOU GET EVERYTHING FROM THE FIRST PERK, and we PERSONALLY deliver a physical copy of the album within a 4 panel wallet right to your door!

- If you donate $14, and you don't live in Worcester or Boston MA, YOU GET EVERYTHING FROM THE FIRST PERK, and we'll still be shipping you the physical copy of the album within the 4 panel wallet, and give you an extra handwritten and signed thank you note! (We're very sorry we can't travel much further to deliver the album personally)

- If you donate $40,  YOU GET EVERYTHING FROM THE FIRST PERK, and we'll personally deliver you a signed copy of the album (4 Panel wallet), along with a large poster and 3 free passes to ANY future 3 Piece Meal shows! If you don't live in Worcester or Boston, we'll still be shipping you all of these items, and an additional handwritten thank you note!

- If you donate $100, YOU GET EVERYTHING FROM THE FIRST PERK, and we'll come play a free show at your house/backyard/restaurant/school (you name it!) anywhere in New England and New York! If you want us to come play anywhere else, we'd definitely be happy to if you help us cover a little bit of the travel expenses! (Just gas really).


The Impact


By donating to our campaign, you help spread a powerful and relevant message. In order to address the social issues discussed in our album, we need to get this album out and inspire discussion. Not only will our music make aware the listener, but it will also give them something to walk away with and talk about.

You also enable us to kickstart our careers and continue making music which not only lyrically important and relevant, but also musically unique. Coming from three different countries and three different musical backgrounds - we not only bring racial and cultural diversity onto the stage, but also a lot of musical versatility. We aim to strengthen, and bring something new and original to the Indie scene with our music - and you'll be directly helping us fulfill that purpose.

By helping us get this album out, you'll also be assisting us move ahead in planning future shows/tours and events (and we'd definitely love to work and play with/for you!). Again, we're very grateful to you for even taking the time to read through all this!


Risks & Challenges


We're done recording everything for the album, and are currently recording vocals. There really aren't any risks right now. We were able to record for free in our college studio. All we need to do is raise enough money to pay our producer,  our designer, the printing company, and an online distributer, and then have a bit more to promote the album! So the only challenge is raising enough money to finish the album quick and get it out to you folks!

Check out some of our demos (some projects we've accomplished so far!)



Other Ways You Can Help


Thank you again for taking the time to read through our campaign and consider donating. We highly appreciate it. Don't worry at all if you can't donate, there are many other things you can do to help us out a lot!

- You can share and spread the word about this campaign, the band, and the album.

- You can like us on Facebook and follow us on Soundcloud and Instagram to show us your support.

- You can share our music and videos online, or to your friends.

- If you're an agent, represent a venue, host shows (or have friends who do), we'd love to get in touch with you to play some cool shows and promote our music and message!

- You can stay updated with our events (through Facebook) and come to a future show!

- You can continue the discourse and dialogues required to promote important discussion about all the social and political issues that we as a community must address and overcome. Feel free to reach out to us for such discussion as well - we love to talk!

- And last but not least, if you represent an agency, or are a publicist, photographer, videographer, web designer, writer, sound engineer, journalist, organizer, venue owner or advisor and want to work with us, definitely let us know! We'd love to get more people involved!

You also enable us to kickstart our careers and continue making music which not only lyrically important and relevant, but also musically unique. Coming from three different countries and three different musical backgrounds - we not only bring racial and cultural diversity onto the stage, but also a lot of musical versatility. We aim to strengthen, and bring something new and original to the Indie scene with our music - and you'll be directly helping us fulfill that purpose.


By helping us get this album out, you'll also be assisting us move ahead in planning future shows/tours and events (and we'd definitely love to work and play with/for you!). Again, we're very grateful to you for even taking the time to read through all this!

    Risks & Challenges 
We're done recording everything for the album, and are currently recording vocals. There really aren't any risks right now. We were able to record for free in our college studio. All we need to do is raise enough money to pay our producer,  our designer, the printing company, and an online distributer, and then have a bit more to promote the album! So the only challenge is raising enough money to finish the album quick and get it out to you folks!Check out some of our demos (some projects we've accomplished so far!)
    



Other Ways You Can Help 
Thank you again for taking the time to read through our campaign and consider donating. We highly appreciate it. Don't worry at all if you can't donate, there are many other things you can do to help us out a lot!- You can share and spread the word about this campaign, the band, and the album.
- You can like us on Facebook and follow us on Soundcloud and Instagram to show us your support.
- You can share our music and videos online, or to your friends.- If you're an agent, represent a venue, host shows (or have friends who do), we'd love to get in touch with you to play some cool shows and promote our music and message!- You can stay updated with our events (through Facebook) and come to a future show!- You can continue the discourse and dialogues required to promote important discussion about all the social and political issues that we as a community must address and overcome. Feel free to reach out to us for such discussion as well - we love to talk!- And last but not least, if you represent an agency, or are a publicist, photographer, videographer, web designer, writer, sound engineer, journalist, organizer, venue owner or advisor and want to work with us, definitely let us know! We'd love to get more people involved!

story:
Virgin Mary Pistol Grip was formed in Omaha, NE. Since releasing our debut full length album in 2013, we’ve had amazing opportunities to further our passion of music. We’ve shared the stage with great local, regional and touring bands. We’ve collaborated with local non-profits. We were nominated as an OEAA New Artist of the Year. And now, here is another great opportunity for us to continue to do what we love.

We make and play music because we NEED to. It’s our passion. Although we have been working hard writing, playing and promoting, our songs need things we can't do alone. To take our music to the next level, we need your help and the help from great industry professionals. Our debut album was recorded and produced solely out of our own pocket. This time we’re asking you, our fans, friends, and family, to invest in us. We aren't looking for a shortcut or a handout. We look at this as an opportunity. With your help, we can join forces and do something we couldn't do by ourselves.

Los Angeles producer and Nebraska native, Bob Marlette, has returned ‘home’ to produce our new EP, Secret Codes. Bob has worked with unbelievable talent like Alice Cooper, Black Sabbath, Tracy Chapman, Filter, Seether, Shinedown and Rob Zombie. Working with Bob has been an amazing and educational experience. He has not only taught us about music and the industry, but he pushed us to be our best. The tracks were recorded at Omaha’s own world class studio, Make Believe Studios. Six days were spent in the studio recording songs that we can’t wait to share with you! We are grateful to be working with Bob and Make Believe Studios.

The ultimate goal of all of this is to share our music with the world. We need your help so that we can get our songs mixed, the EP pressed, printed, and ready to be distributed. Please help us in this opportunity for us to continue to pursue our passion for music.

We want all of our friends and fans to be a part of this amazing experience!! During this campaign we will give you sneak peeks from the recording process and share with you our progress. Check out the pre-orders and limited edition perks available for purchase on the right side of this page. If you can't contribute financially, we understand. Please share our project page with your friends - it’s easy to do with the Indiegogo share tools above! You never know what they might be able to do, or who they might be friends with. Share our music with your friends and bring them the next time we play in your area. We appreciate your generosity and support. We have the best fans on the planet!

Don’t forget to use #VMPGSecretCodes

Heart,

Virgin Mary Pistol Grip

story:
Hello Everybody!

It's Brett. I am a pianist and keyboardist and am starting my own solo recording project. I have been playing with many different artists over the last few years. Primarily you've seen me playing with Marcus Miller. I am ready now to make my own musical statement as an artist and need your help to see the vision through. I am so excited to share my new music with you. It is something I believe in wholeheartedly and feel that it is important to share with all of you. This campaign will help me achieve this goal of creating the music and getting the album out to you. Being an independent artist is tough nowadays and you really need a great support system to achieve your artistic goals. I need your help and I'm so pumped for you to be a part of this journey with me!

I'm in need of $10,000 to help me in this endeavor. This is not the total budget that I need, however it would put a huge dent in the costs of this recording. The money received  will be going straight into the recording process for example: studio time, production costs, and other guest musician costs. There is a lot of time, effort, and collaboration that goes into making a recording. I want to give you the BEST possible product and in order to do so... I need money. There are some pretty fantastic perks and incentives a part of this campaign that I think all of you will be interested in. There are small donation perks as well as very big donation perks! Any donation makes a difference and means so much to me. So please find a perk that speaks to you the most and please DONATE! 

The music I am working on is so exciting. It is young and fresh and HONEST! I am putting my whole heart and spirit into all of the writing and playing. The vibe of the recording includes Indie Rock elements, Electronic/Minimalist elements, with some chocolate on it!! haha. I think you will all be able to grab on to a piece of this music and I truly believe it will speak to your soul.

So please share and spread the word about my campaign. Put it on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and all your social media outlets. Tell everybody you know!!  Not only am I excited to complete this project, I am so looking forward to having you all a part of the process and the journey!

Thanks so much,

-Brett

story:
Who is AY?

Alex Yaitanes (AY) has been driven to tell his story of his struggles through his teen years to his redemption through his music and art. Music was a way out for him to not only help himself, but to spread a positive message to the youth. Growing up in Stoughton, MA, Alex faced many challenges and had bad influences around him that lead him down a road of trouble. Little did he know that that same struggle would turn into a blessing of life lessons that could change other peoples lives in a positive way.  Making music and telling his story became a way to escape his old life and start a new one. Going to Michigan and filming a music video for his new song "Living Life Like We 20" would be a giant step in making his dream come true by showing the world who he is and what he can do. By contributing to AY's UMich music video campaign, Alex will get a shot at changing his life. 

What We Need:


In order to make this video come to life in Michigan the production needs an estimated $1,000 in funds that will go to:

  • Paying for a camera man to film the video in early September ($600)
  • Hiring security for the event ($200)
  • Renting out the production equipment and programs ($200)

The Impact

This project is important to AY and to the entire AY production crew because it gives Alex the chance to not only fulfill his dream of being part of something bigger than himself but will be a jumping off point for the rest of his career and new life.


So far Alex (AY) has filmed 2 music videos and released over 10 songs and is in the process of releasing his first album.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute money, there are other ways to help the AY with music campaign:

  • Follow WhoisAY on soundcloud to be the first to hear AY's new music and get the initial viewing of his new album releasing in the fall
  • Share this campaign on IndieGoGo with your friends
  • Go to WhoisAY.com to take a look at AY's new website and purchase some merchandise
