story:
Short Summary

M3, also known as Mobile Music Media, was founded in January 2016 and is currently owned by Samuel Terrasson and Seydouba Kourouma, current students at Syracuse University and Flaggler College. Although we are students in college, the M3 campaign deserves the extensive time, energy, and revenue that it requires for the final product, and we will fall nothing short of those requirements. 

Pitch deck:

 

http://slidebean.s3.amazonaws.com/export/M3-OM5...

Please use the link below if the URL above doesn't work. 

https://app.slidebean.com/p/6mjoByU6W2/M3-Desig...

Team:

Samuel Terrasson, CoCeo and Founder

Manages operations, finances, development, planning, documents, company resources, and direction.

Seydouba Kourouma, CoCeo and Founder

Manages development, public relations, company details, company creativity and  direction, marketing,  budgets, targets markets, and advertisement.

The Problem:

The world's population of smartphone users lack a creative social media application that provides music for a low cost available for listening and sharing. Music is a universal language within our society today and social media has never been more prevalent in our daily lives. There simply isn't a mobile app out there that can correctly link music with media the way M3 can. 

Solution: 

Imagine any type of media that you would like to share  from your phone. A thought, message, or picture in specific. Instead of uploading that picture with words or emojis, think of some song of music that captures the true vibe and profundity of that media content. Instantly, your personal music has been added to your social media profile like never before. Other users can now see your media/music and enjoy the media like they would on another media platform while also saving the music they see if they would like to do so. If a user on another social media site would attempt to link their music with their media like so, the result would be multiple tabs with ads playing instead of the original music playing with the users media content. M3 directly links music with the media, creating a very special and exciting concept that we would like to share with you. Music encapsulates a multitude of emotions and feelings which can now be embedded within your photos, thoughts, and almost any medium through which you utilize social media.

The Three M's-

M3 will be available on mobile smart phones, Android and iPhone.

M3 is a creative social media platform that optimizes user activity of sharing common media content with the combination of music.
M3 is a music application with a strong foundation of music available for users to listen to and share.

The Quest-

We plan to network and spread the world's love and passion for music with social media content through a dynamic mobile application.

The Result-

M3, The smartphone application that gives social media its first and best musical soundtrack. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $16,000 for our first round of funding. This amount of money will sufficiently get a prototype of the application on peoples phones. Since this start up is a mobile app, there isn't anything tangible that big investors can put their hands around and say they want to invest a large amount. In the future, we will be seeking funding from bigger players for upwards of $100,000. However, until we have a prototype of the app that one could try out on their phone, we cannot  seek professional investing for vast amounts. Thus, we have decided to self-fund and reach out to friends and family.

We don't know exactly how long this will take but we hope that it is as soon as possible. We are ready to begin development of the app with our first music API license and AWI server space moments after we reach our amount. M3 is currently listed as an app concept on freelancer and upwork, two websites to hire app developers, with more than 50 highly professional developers nearly begging to develop the app. In order to develop M3 for the best possible quality product, we contacted many developers. Our favorite developer, requires $9,000 for the creation of the app, $6,000 for the Soundcloud API music licence and $750 for the software space from microsoft. We expect the grand total to be $16,000. Awards and investments can be noted in the perks section. In addition, the M3 team has a market strategy that they are ready to implement and begin as soon as the process starts. 

 

The Impact

 M3 is going to connect and network millions of people through the common love of music all through their smartphone. M3 links social media features from the top media platforms in 2016 while also maintaining a strong fundamental presence of music- creating the only music app that truly connects people. Our app is precisely what the media world is lacking music wise and what the music world is lacking media wise within app markets. In the short term, the impact of the revenue that is earned is simply more hard work available for us because these are just the starting stages. In the long term, M3 is a movement to share music through your media like never before as your money will lead the way to an eventually successful, iconic, and innovative smartphone application. 

 

Risks & Challenges

As of today, our biggest step is obtaining funding. We have talked to a couple connections we have in the entrepreneurship world and most have them have said that they can definitely see the app getting funded but for the advanced and larger round after we have an app out there. Once M3 has a prototype available, we will start to market the app and expand it to our first 50,000 users. We expect to reach out to professional investors once we can include a prototype in our investment meeting instead of just words of what an iPhone app would be like. This is why we need your help. We have a road map for the companies actions for the first year of the applications launch but we need to get the app in motion. When more risks arrive, the M3 team feels passionately about the cause while persevering and come out on top of our challenges. As of today, we are waiting on one person that believes in our goal. We have high hopes for M3 - an app that will be much more than an awesome and interactive social media music app . M3 will be the ultimate networking application for music in the 21st century.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please, if you can't contribute, just send this link to anyone that you know that might be interested or anyone you know who might be interested. You would be surprised to see how many people fall under the category of smartphone users who actively use social media and listen to music but don't have an app that links the two in a beautiful way. Any kind of future networking of this campaign  would be greatly appreciated and we would be very grateful for your help. Use the Indiegogo share tools or just tell your friends, family, and strangers! 

If you are interested please place further inquiries at samterrasson@gmail.com or M3douba@gmail.com

Thanks for your time.

-The M3 Team-

story:
#LUXRising

A New Orchestra For A New World

Dear friends, family, colleagues and fans,

I'm excited to announce the launch of LUX and our debut concert at the SOUTH NEXT FESTIVAL June 17th 2016. BUY TICKETS

A New Audience

LUX is a bold new orchestra designed to bring symphonic music to a new generation of listeners.

I have created LUX with this vision in mind; to build a new audience experience.

We will be taking unprecedented steps in creating new performance aesthetics that feature high energy programs, light-shows, projections, amplification, social media interaction and a general upheaval of all established performance standards – all while performing some of the greatest music ever conceived, as well as some original music composed specifically for us.

We need you as a visionary partner.

LUX Manifesto

We are bold, dramatic, unruly visionaries. We are disrupters who will change the way audiences think about and experience symphonic music. There will be no black ties. There will be no stuffy speeches, and there will be no conventional performance etiquette. It will be electrifying. It will be dramatic. It will be spectacular.

Merging the worlds of high-energy performance and symphonic music, we will offer an unparalleled musical experience; a spectacle of light and rising-star musicians performing the world’s most dramatic music in revolutionary style. We are the new classical.

If you subscribe to this, you are one of us.

Musicians with a big vision.

LUX is the product of years of experience, thousands of ideas and endless observations of music in contemporary society. LUX is the orchestra for the new world.

Check Us Out:
www.luxorch.com
Like us on Facebook
Follow us on Twitter
See us on Instagram
Watch us on YouTube



//Be Part of the MOVEMENT//

Starting an orchestra is a major undertaking. Starting an orchestra that wants to change everything is even bigger.

Everything costs money. Here's where it goes.

  • Rehearsal space, instrument & lighting rentals, promotional materials, music rental fees, digital media and branding development
  • Video production
  • Musicians fees (we're talking about 50+ musicians!)
  • Lighting design
  • Program creation and development

...the list is endless.

You are the most important.


Johnell, viola

We Need You.

We need to raise $10,000 to make our next concert possible. You can help! Aside from knowing that you've changed the world in a positive way, we'll give you cool stuff to show our appreciation for your support!


LUX = Love.


Jonathan, viola

Our Impact

Every single one of us has been touched by music.  All music shares one common thread; the human experience. We want to share this with the world because WE are the human experience.

We will take our stories and transform them into musical scapes that inspire and connect people.


Kristina, cello

Challenges

This is a giant leap for symphonic music. It goes against all established norms and traditions, and that is what gives it life. We will make this happen because the world wants it, because we believe in our collective vision and we trust in our skills.

And because you stand with us.


Brent, conductor/composer

Want to help us in other ways?

Tell your friends about us. Share us on Facebook, Twitter and other social platforms. Come to our concerts to experience and connect. Send us your ideas, your thoughts, your dreams. Together we create the world we want.

With Love & Hope

Brent Chancellor & LUX
story_txt:
#LUXRisingA New Orchestra For A New World
 
Dear friends, family, colleagues and fans,
I'm excited to announce the launch of LUX and our debut concert at the SOUTH NEXT FESTIVAL June 17th 2016. BUY TICKETS



A New Audience

LUX is a bold new orchestra designed to bring symphonic music to a new generation of listeners.
I have created LUX with this vision in mind; to build a new audience experience. 
We will be taking unprecedented steps in creating new performance aesthetics that feature high energy programs, light-shows, projections, amplification, social media interaction and a
general upheaval of all established performance standards – all while performing some of the greatest music ever conceived, as well as some original music composed specifically for us.
We need you as a visionary partner.






LUX Manifesto


We are bold, dramatic, unruly visionaries. We are disrupters who will change the way
audiences think about and experience symphonic music. There will be no black
ties. There will be no stuffy speeches, and there will be no conventional
performance etiquette. It will be electrifying. It will be dramatic. It will be spectacular.
Merging the worlds of high-energy performance and symphonic music, we will
offer an unparalleled musical experience; a spectacle of light and rising-star
musicians performing the world’s most dramatic music in revolutionary style.
We are the new classical.
If you subscribe to this, you are one of us.Musicians with a big vision.

LUX
is the product of years of experience, thousands of ideas and endless observations
of music in contemporary society. LUX is the orchestra for the new world.



Check Us Out:www.luxorch.com
Like us on Facebook
Follow us on TwitterSee us on Instagram
Watch us on YouTube





   //Be Part of the MOVEMENT//



Starting
an orchestra is a major undertaking. Starting an orchestra that wants to change everything is even bigger. 
Everything costs money. Here's where it goes.



Rehearsal space,
     instrument & lighting rentals, promotional materials, music rental fees, digital media and branding development

Video production
Musicians fees (we're talking about 50+ musicians!)
Lighting design

Program creation and development

...the list is endless.


You are the most important.


Johnell, viola

We Need You.We need to raise $10,000 to make our next concert possible. You can help! Aside from knowing that you've changed the world in a positive way, we'll give you cool stuff to show our appreciation for your support!

LUX = Love.




Jonathan, viola    Our Impact
Every single one of us has been touched by music.  All music shares one common thread; the human
experience. We want to share this with the world because WE are the human experience.

We will take our stories and transform them into musical scapes
that inspire and connect people.




Kristina, cello    Challenges  This is a giant leap for symphonic music. It goes against all established norms and traditions, and that is what gives it life. We will make this happen because the world wants it, because we believe in our collective vision and we trust in our skills. 
And because you stand with us.



Brent, conductor/composer
    Want to help us in other ways? Tell your friends about us. Share us on Facebook, Twitter and other social platforms. Come to our concerts to experience and connect. Send us your ideas, your thoughts, your dreams. Together we create the world we want.
With Love & Hope
Brent Chancellor & LUX

story:
Short Summary

Your ongoing support of my music as singer/songwriter has enabled me to do so much over the years and I love you for it. The one thing that is missing is an album and this is where I need that one final helping hand. After thousands of lonely hours, most things are in place. Recording is done, mixing and mastering is done and the artwork is done. The manufacturing of the actual CD is the only thing left. You can help me produce my brand new "PreFuture" album just by making a small financial contribution.  

Making and playing music is a passion for me and something that I will keep on doing, regardless. But getting the music out to you guys is something that requires resources I just don't have without asking for help. So don´t hesitate to donate, to contribute, to a part of the PreFuture.

What We Need & What You Get

Total goal: $1000 - This will pay for the completion of the album and pay for the manufacturing of the CDs. 

All backers will receive a never heard and unreleased song that won´t feature on the album itself. Backers above a certain level will receive a digital downloadable CD or an actual CD, depending on what you want. Everyone will be rewarded regardless of what level you pledged. Check out the other perks, there is something for everyone. 

Please consider sharing this campaign in your social media posts.

The Impact

The first songs were written in the 90´s and almost 20 years down the line, the songs have been tweeked and finetuned to reach as close to perfection as I can make it. Make dreams come true with whatever your contribution contains.

Risks & Challenges

There really aren´t any risks in this venture because there is something for everyone. The challenge is sorted by sharing this :-)

story:
LILY - Begrav Mig Under ett Fjäll

Lily is a punk-infused folk trio from Umeå. We sing mostly about bicycles, mountains and death. We have been playing together since 2010 and are now about to release our first full length album.

The album Begrav Mig Under ett Fjäll was recorded about one year ago. But to be able to print the records we need your help with the money. The record will be vinyl bundled with a Cd by Crush & Create Records. It will also feature an extensive insert with all lyrics in Swedish and English, lots of artwork and lots of photos by Hanna LT. The LP will be out in the autumn of 2017.

We are:

Violin and vocals: Una

Guitar and Vocals: Ane V

Ukulele, Mandolin and Vocals: Jorunn

Production and recording: Eken i Ljudkross Studio

Artwork: Hanna LT, (http://hannalt.blogspot.se)

Released by Crush & Create Records (www.crushandcreate.se)

 

What We Need 

To able to print the record we need 1500 Euro from you. This is half of the money that we need in total. The rest of the money will come from Crush and Create Records, our own pockets, playing shows and selling merch. 

What we will do with the money

All the money will go to paying the printing costs of the record.

We have everything ready to send to the “printing company”, but only need the last money to be able to print it. After we have sent it, it will take about 3 months for the record to be finished.

What we want to give you

As a thank you for the donation you do to our record-release, we would like to give you gifts. You can see to the right what perks-levels we have. Besides the gifts you will be able to pre-order the record which we will send to you as soon as they come from the factory! 

 

Sure, you will be able to sing a long at our release party!

 

 

What happens if we don't get all the money

The record will be printed anyway, but it will take a lot longer time before we can make it happen with less money. And by helping us out financially we poor artists don't have to put up all our own money to make this happen.

To keep the integrity of the project, we have no sponsors etc. All costs are payed by what we get from this campaign, and the rest is from our own pockets.

So we thank you so much for even the smallest donation you can spare us!

story:
After 9 years of playing music together as both Traffic Jam and Heroes Turn Human, we have evolved creatively and decided to work on our final album together under a new name, Aquamarine.  With college approaching or already underway for all of us, we will be going our separate ways after this year, and so we want to leave a final and lasting piece of work to document our current sound.  This name change more accurately reflects our current musical direction as we have embraced our earliest influences in classic rock.  

Although we are now a three-piece band, this album will showcase many different layers and instruments that have not been present on our past albums, drawing on influences such as Pink Floyd, The Doors, and The Beatles.   We have begun writing the album and are very excited to share these new and different songs with you all.  We hope you can be a part of this project and help us fund the recording process.  

Thanks!

Tyler, Aaron, Ben

story:
Hi! My name is Jessa Young. I grew up in Northern Utah in a family of 11 musicians, and moved to the Aspen, CO area to attend the Aspen Music School after graduating from Utah State University with a B.A. in music. Living at over 8,000 feet in the Rockies for over 12 years is where I first blossomed as a composer, singer/songwriter and music educator and formed a strong network in my community. I currently reside in the greater Seattle area where I teach, perform and tour regionally and nationally. Music has always been the life blood and expression of my passion, both personally and in my work!

At an early age, I experienced great personal trauma. In my early 20's I began getting in touch with that trauma again, and I made a commitment to do whatever it takes to heal. My journey of personal transformation, supported by grace and by countless people who've helped me along the way has left me with me a deep desire to give back to the world what has been given to me.

We live in troubled times. There is a great need for transformation on a global scale. And most of us are looking for a silver lining. We are struggling for resolution personally and within our infrastructures, and are deeply saddened and  angered by much of what is happening. We are also living in a time where we are waking up to the realization that we must be the change we wish to see in the world or it will not happen. Leonard Cohen said in a song, that .."we are all cracked, but that is how the light gets in." Through my own experiences, and in witnessing others transform their lives I know now that this is indeed a key to resolving our problems on a larger scale.

In my own healing journey, I have been deeply inspired by spending time in the natural world; I am in awe of it's elemental beauty and healing powers. Much of the music I create comes from deep and direct contact with nature. And from these experiences, I've developed a passionate love for our planet. The music and videography of BEYOND ELSEWHERE reflects this love & passion; it is being created to uplift and inspire others, and to remind us that we need to preserve and protect what we love, before we lose it forever.

Water is the life blood of our planet. And clean, healthy water is a foundation to the health and well being of all of us. Uncontaminated water is also on the verge of disappearing. For this reason, I am donating 10% of the proceeds of this fundraising campaign to organizations that are committed to restoring, preserving and protecting our precious water.

I am working with an incredible team of top notch musicians, producers and videograhers. The music for BEYOND ELSEWHERE is being created for documentaries and mainstream films which support the evolution of humankind, and environmental awareness. It is very important that I have the funds to pay the people I'm working with so that the production of this project will be cutting edge, and reach as many people as possible on a global scale. I have already put countless hours of voluntary time and money into the project; in honing my craft, in creating the music, and in taking online courses to learn how to market this music on a global scale. But in order to fully launch Beyond Elsewhere, pay for it's production and get it out there into the world where it can make a difference in people's lives, and for the planet, I need your help. If you feel called to contribute, know that my deep gratitude, like a beautiful clear creek that flows from a remote desert canyon will flow from my heart to yours.

Lastly, I'd like to share a poem with you that I wrote while recently spending 9 days in the heart of Dark Canyon, a remote wilderness in the Southern Utah desert:

SHINING, SHINING, SHINING

The path climbs
steeply up through
broken shards of
rock, fragile
desert flowers
like memories,
have grown
from the crumbling dust,
and reach for the sun.

Like the visions
that my heart holds,
like the dreams
that I have been
afraid to live,
they cling fiercely
to all the broken pieces
keeping me
whole and one
with their roots.

As I climb
higher and higher
on the ledge
to meet the sun
I barely know I am now.
But I know I must
continue to reach
for the light, though these
shadows threaten
to engulf me.

A song, a song rises
out of the dust; I
play on my flute
this time, for the
desert and all
her children; rocks,
stones, trees, birds,
flowers. And vast,
open sky.

I play for the sun who's
setting fast behind
this great wall of
stone. And trust
that I, no less a
child of this
vast, lonely land
will rise up like
the moon herself,
shining, shining, shining.

(Poem by Jessa Young; April 2017)
Photo: Paula Watkins

story:
Here's the deal

  • Thanks for taking the time to read about this exciting CROWDFUNDING project.
  • We know we have a big fanbase of friends, family and those who have come to see out gigs. Our fans are spread across the world. People are always asking how they can get our music so we figured it was time to do it properly and create our first Album.
  • We are bursting with incredible songs (you can listen here http://hyperurl.co/rws9cg) that people may have heard at gigs, some have never been heard. It's time we committed these to Vinyl for posterity. Time is precious and we are getting old (er).
  • Crowdfunding this project will give you something special to keep forever but also give us the opportunity to take a massive step up in getting Brad's music out there to the music industry and the wider world.
  • So please give what you can, nothing will be wasted. In fact knowing us, it will all cost more than we raise!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The breakdown is roughly £6,000 studio, producer, engineer, £3000 to design and press the Vinyl (including photography) and allow £1000 expenses for any distribution and fees to Indiegogo.
  • We've already invested £4000 of our own hard earned gig money to start the album. 4 tracks in the bag so we need you guys to help us finish it.
  • You can see the perks here on the page - we've tried to keep it simple! £15 gets you the download (you can play on ITunes or similar), £25 gets you the Vinyl album. £40 gets you a signed album. £250 (plus any travel outside London) gets you a personalised living room acoustic gig (20 minute set). £750 gets you a full party set (Venue hire not included).
  • If we don't reach our goal of £10,000 to finish the album we'll simply use it to record what we can, little by little.  Money will go in the Band account.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just haven't go the £££ to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Just spread the word people!
    • By word of mouth, email, Share on twitter, Facebook and Instagram!or whatever you can.

    And that's all there is to it.

     

    FAQs

     

    When will the album come out?
    We have not announced a release date but we plan to finish and deliver for CHRISTMAS 2017

    When will my stuff ship?
    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to everyone at least 24 hours prior to official release.
     

    How do I pay for the international shipping?
    After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by £10.
     

    I forgot to pay £10 for the international shipping!
    No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!
     

    I placed an order and have a question.
    If you've placed an order you can file a support ticket. If you have not placed an order please tweet @NOCOWARDSOUL or email us at NoCowardSoulmusic@gmail.com and we'll do our best to respond asap.

     

    Thank you so much for your support

    - Brad, Egg, Martin, Jon and Jules

story:
The Story of the Space Wizard

Music is healing.

When I was eleven years old and learned to play my first instrument, I instantly recognized that I was tapping into one of the most powerful forces in the universe. What I discovered was a new language—something that freed me in opening the gates to my heart.

It all started with the electric guitar, but soon I found myself trying to learn and master a broad range of sound. My journey through the cosmos has shown me the magic Celtic harp, piano, and—the most mysterious expression of them all—electronic music.

Planes of Consciousness is an album that I feel best represents the many facets of who I really am. It marks a major change of focus from fast, trance music to funky, organic glitch-hop and downtempo with vocals. What I created is a unique blend of healing beats and rhythms that invites dancing and celebration.

And, who doesn't want to dance and celebrate?

The years of experience that are hiding behind Planes of Consciousness are fun to recount. It’s not often that I give myself a chance to look back at where I’ve been. Let’s see…

I have released two full-length albums and two EPs under the Planewalker name, as well as four full-length albums and over ten EPs and singles under my collaborative side projects: Chaos Control and Mister Chill’R.  

In the last several years, I have had the great privilege of remixing songs by and sharing the stage with some of the most recognized electronic music producers in the world, including Phutureprimitive, The Polish Ambassador, Kalya Scintilla, Desert Dwellers, Ott, Rabbit in the Moon, Bluetech, Random Rab, Bird of Prey, Kaminanda and Govinda.

Currently, I tour and perform across the United States both as an electronic music artist (Planewalker) and as a Celtic harpist with my father, Michael Martin Murphey, as one of his band members. I recently performed with the Kansas City Orchestra for a crowd of over 7,000 people at the 10th Annual Symphony in the Flint Hills. I definitely could not have done all this had it not been for the support of my friends, family, and loyal fans.

 

My Vision and Why I Need Your Help

It’s taken me decades to get to where I am today, but I’m finally to the point where a successful crowdfunding campaign is possible.

My vision for Planes of Consciousness goes far beyond the music itself.

What I see:

*  A full stage show, with fire performances (by me!) and belly dancing (thankfully, not by me!)

*  Vinyl albums. I promise, they’re not just for hipsters.

*  Album flash drives. These days, even grandma knows what these are.

*  Only the finest t-shirts, sweatshirts, and tank tops featuring my album art.

To kick off the project, I have organized an album release party on July 21 at Taos Mesa Brewing that features the debut performance of our full stage show with my dance troupe along with performances by five other talented music producers and DJs including Ecometric, Adem Joel, Kanizzle, Tasstik and Trillwax. This show is being produced to high standards, and will cost over $2,000 on its own to promote and execute. High quality flyers, a large sound system, several high-powered video projectors, an intelligent lighting system, and the cost of bringing other talented performers in from far away and paying them to perform isn't going to be cheap!

What's in It for YOU:

I think one of the greatest gifts of finding success in life is being able to share more fully with others. 

Even if I don't meet my goal, I will be offering my backers a fantastic assortment of the products that I've listed above, as well as my professional services as a music producer and DJ. For those who are musicians themselves, there is potential to book time with me in my amazing studio. I have a vocal booth, a broad array of digital and physical instruments, and the passion and knowledge to help you achieve YOUR OWN MUSICAL DREAMS.

Beyond the perks, I'm offering you a chance to experience the magic of healing through music in a way you have never experienced before! This is extremely exciting for me, and I look forward with great anticipation to completing this project and seeing my vision realized with your support.

Thank you!
story_txt:
The Story of the Space Wizard
Music is healing.
When I was eleven years old and learned to play my first instrument, I instantly recognized that I was tapping into one of the most powerful forces in the universe. What I discovered was a new language—something that freed me in opening the gates to my heart.
It all started with the electric guitar, but soon I found myself trying to learn and master a broad range of sound. My journey through the cosmos has shown me the magic Celtic harp, piano, and—the most mysterious expression of them all—electronic music.
Planes of Consciousness is an album that I feel best represents the many facets of who I really am. It marks a major change of focus from fast, trance music to funky, organic glitch-hop and downtempo with vocals. What I created is a unique blend of healing beats and rhythms that invites dancing and celebration.
And, who doesn't want to dance and celebrate?
The years of experience that are hiding behind Planes of Consciousness are fun to recount. It’s not often that I give myself a chance to look back at where I’ve been. Let’s see…
I have released two full-length albums and two EPs under the Planewalker name, as well as four full-length albums and over ten EPs and singles under my collaborative side projects: Chaos Control and Mister Chill’R.  
In the last several years, I have had the great privilege of remixing songs by and sharing the stage with some of the most recognized electronic music producers in the world, including Phutureprimitive, The Polish Ambassador, Kalya Scintilla, Desert Dwellers, Ott, Rabbit in the Moon, Bluetech, Random Rab, Bird of Prey, Kaminanda and Govinda.
Currently, I tour and perform across the United States both as an electronic music artist (Planewalker) and as a Celtic harpist with my father, Michael Martin Murphey, as one of his band members. I recently performed with the Kansas City Orchestra for a crowd of over 7,000 people at the 10th Annual Symphony in the Flint Hills. I definitely could not have done all this had it not been for the support of my friends, family, and loyal fans.
 
My Vision and Why I Need Your Help
It’s taken me decades to get to where I am today, but I’m finally to the point where a successful crowdfunding campaign is possible.
My vision for Planes of Consciousness goes far beyond the music itself.
What I see:
*  A full stage show, with fire performances (by me!) and belly dancing (thankfully, not by me!)
*  Vinyl albums. I promise, they’re not just for hipsters.
*  Album flash drives. These days, even grandma knows what these are.
*  Only the finest t-shirts, sweatshirts, and tank tops featuring my album art.
To kick off the project, I have organized an album release party on July 21 at Taos Mesa Brewing that features the debut performance of our full stage show with my dance troupe along with performances by five other talented music producers and DJs including Ecometric, Adem Joel, Kanizzle, Tasstik and Trillwax. This show is being produced to high standards, and will cost over $2,000 on its own to promote and execute. High quality flyers, a large sound system, several high-powered video projectors, an intelligent lighting system, and the cost of bringing other talented performers in from far away and paying them to perform isn't going to be cheap!
What's in It for YOU:
I think one of the greatest gifts of finding success in life is being able to share more fully with others. 
Even if I don't meet my goal, I will be offering my backers a fantastic assortment of the products that I've listed above, as well as my professional services as a music producer and DJ. For those who are musicians themselves, there is potential to book time with me in my amazing studio. I have a vocal booth, a broad array of digital and physical instruments, and the passion and knowledge to help you achieve YOUR OWN MUSICAL DREAMS.
Beyond the perks, I'm offering you a chance to experience the magic of healing through music in a way you have never experienced before! This is extremely exciting for me, and I look forward with great anticipation to completing this project and seeing my vision realized with your support.
Thank you!

story:
Hello, my name is Jonathan Lane. I have worked in the Kansas City area the past 30 years as a music educator, conductor, professional performer and private music teacher.

 

I am now the musical director of the recently formed Westwood Ensemble. In our current form, we are a community string orchestra that rehearses at the Westwood City Hall in Westwood, Kansas -- located just west of Kansas City, Missouri's famed Country Club Plaza.

 

Orchestra membership includes teenage performers through those of retirement age. This includes families with multiple participants. We have a self-rating membership process and membership and concerts are free to the public.

 

Westwood Ensemble has four concerts planned for our upcoming alpha season, with performances throughout the Kansas City area.

 

Our first concert features Trombonist, composer and arranger Marcus Lewis and his new arrangement for us of Duke Ellington’s “In a Sentimental Mood”.  This concert is rounded out with more American music including Gershwin and Copeland.

 

We are seeking funding for our concert season.  Each concert cost about $1,000 to put on, and our Alpha season funding goal is $10,000.

 

Our list of expenses includes:

Concert Hall Rental,

Liability Insurance,

Sheet Music Purchases,

Paying concert soloists and other professional musicians,

Music Scanning and Printing,

Website Domain Fees,

Promotional Ads, 

Posters and Artwork, and

Paper and Office Supplies.

 

Please join us in this musical journey by coming to our concerts and making a donation. You can like us on Facebook, and watch us on YouTube and Instagram.  Donations can be made on Facebook or our Website – Westwood Ensemble.COM.

 

Thank you.

 

Check out our unique perks for donors.  Come to our concerts

 

 

 

  •

story:
We are Project Tom Buffalo, an independent rock band, with a signature California sound based in Los Angeles California. After three years of being together, we have already have three music videos and an album to show for it.

We currently have a single that is days away from being ready to release.

However, in this day in age, a song itself isn't quite enough to gather attraction from major music festivals and venues. That's why we want to go all out and produce a HIGH QUALITY CONCEPT MUSIC VIDEO.

We already have the script and the team to make it happen. The only thing that's missing is a little bit of money to pay for equipment and actors.

We want to bring back the live band sound and we would like for you to be part of our journey.

Any donation, share, or mention is a direct contribution to our vision of making AWESOME FEEL GOOD ROCK MUSIC. Be a part of our team! Also... there ARE rewards to if you donate ;).

story:
Drop the Bone

Drop the Bone is a phase I learned from my late business manager and spiritual advisor, Carolyn “Goldie” Rush – to whom this record is dedicated. It was great advice: “Stop gnawing on your troubles all the time. Get your shit together and get on with it.”

I met Goldie in the late ‘70s, when she was a partner in a management business called Organizational Common Sense. Bob Weir was one of her clients, and Jon McIntire was one of her closest friends as well as the manager of the Bob Weir Band at the time. We became friends over the course of a few years.

When a series of accidents led me to incorporate (as Truth and Fun, Inc.) in order to enter a contract with Grateful Dead Productions to produce and distribute the Grateful Dead Hour, GDP required that I hire Goldie to manage the business (and keep an eye on me for them). I was happy to oblige, and Goldie ran my business until her death in the spring of 2005.

Dealing with the Grateful Dead wasn’t always easy nor pleasant, and Goldie talked me down from a number of rages and/or depressions over the course of our collaboration. I have always referred to her as “my business manager and spiritual advisor.” She protected my business and my heart, and I still think about her every day.

Our mutual friend Vi©kisa made a painting titled “Goldie says Drop the Bone,” which I bought from her with the idea of eventually using it to illustrate a song called “Drop the Bone.”

A few years ago I proposed to Peter Rowan - who also was a good friend of Goldie’s – that we write “Drop the Bone” together. I’ve been a huge fan of his songwriting for decades, and I figured his spirituality and our shared love of our late friend would lead to a satisfying result. We worked on it in a hotel room in Ohio, and we had a couple more sessions at Pete’s house, and then our separate travels prevented more in-person collaboration.

Some time later, I got a message from Peter’s manager asking for my publishing info. Peter had finished “Drop the Bone” and had recorded it and was planning to release it on an album titled The Old School.

This version of the song was not at all what I had in mind – 

I'm wanderin' around all day long / I’m a little stray dog honey when you're gone / And every evenin' when you come home / You throw your little puppy dog a bone

– but I like it just fine and I am honored to have a collaboration with Peter Rowan on my resume (along with two songs co-written with Robert Hunter).

I still haven’t managed to write a song that does justice to Goldie’s profound advice, but I worked the phrase “Drop the Bone” into another song – “Summer By the Bay” –  which is on this new record I’m working on.

Now, to the work in progress: It’s a studio record that covers the various corners of my weird musical universe: acoustic, electric; solo, trio, full-band; originals and interpretations.

These are the songs I have already started work on. I’ve got a few more songs under consideration; budgeting issues may help determine what gets recorded.

Summer By the Bay, River and Drown, Life Is a Jam - full electric band

Be Like Earl - acoustic quartet

Your Movie - acoustic, with trombone

Norwegian Wood (Lennon-McCartney) - “solo electric” with looping

Rainbow Fox-> Box of Rain (Hunter-Lesh) - “solo electric” with looping, beginning with an improvised piece.

Pancho and Lefty (Townes Van Zandt) - acoustic trio

And these are the great players I’ve been working with:

Jeff Hobbs – violin, cello, trumpet, saxophones,

Robin Sylvester, Joe Kyle, Jr., Dave Jess, and Allegra Thompson – bass

Jordan Feinstein, Holly Bowling, and Bob Bralove – keyboards

Neil Hampton and John Hanes – drums

Greg Stephens – trombone

Eric Thompson – mandolin

Suzy Thompson – fiddle

As with my last couple of records, I have the great privilege and pleasure of working with two amazing engineers who are also good friends: Jeremy Goody at Megasonic Sound and Jim LeBrecht at Berkeley Sound Artists. Dave Glasser (Airshow) will master the record in HDCD™.

I’m looking for the funds to finish the record and get it mastered, packaged, pressed, and promoted.

story:
Representation Matters

Nat Harvie Trio is an all-queer, post-glam, group that has been playing together since the summer of 2016. Nat Harvie (guitar, vocals) has been playing and writing music since the mid 2000s. They released two full-length albums with their first project, Vivielle, before the age of 20. They recorded and mixed Vivielle's second album (Something That Isn't There) as well as Nat's first solo EP (Snow Is A Gift To My Fear). They have spent the past few years honing their skills as a recording engineer and songwriter to craft their first full-length solo album, Nat Harvie's Broken Record.

In 2014, Nat began playing their solo music live with drummer Sam Williams (Chase Down Blue, Brain Bugs, Cabbage) after a short stint with her in the band, Paloma, Paloma. Nat recorded their first EP, Snow Is A Gift To My Fear, and taught Becca DeBoer (Red Mountain) bass for the release show in July, 2016. After a few shows, they decided to start officially playing as the Nat Harvie Trio. 

Nat Harvie Trio creates a visceral sonic experience, exploring themes of queerness, identity, love, and death. They provide a queer, trans, and non-binary representation that is in short supply in the Duluth music community. Nat Harvie Trio provides a voice for experiences of queer folx through song-writing, passionate vocals, and genre-bending, dynamic instrumentation. Their presence is important to increase queer/trans visibility in Duluth's art community, and the music industry at-large, in order to create a diverse representation of queer voices and queer music.

Donating to Nat Harvie Trio will provide funding for the vinyl pressing, mastering, distribution and promotion of our first full-length album.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need $2,500 total for the production and distribution of Nat Harvie's Broken Record. -$2,000 will go to vinyl pressing 
-$300 will go to mastering the album
-$200 will be set aside for distribution and promotion

Depending on the amount you are able to donate, you will be able to receive some of the following items:

•Digital download of the EP, Snow Is A Gift To My Fear
•Digital download of the debut full-length album, Nat Harvie's Broken Record
•Vinyl Copy of the debut full-length album, Nat  Harvie's Broken Record
•Free admission the the album release show in the spring of 2018
•T-shirt
•A private show within a 150 mile radius of Duluth, MN
•Studio time in Nat Harvie's private studio

If we fail to reach our funding goal, we will provide the funds with our personal money, and continue to raise money playing live shows.
 

Your Impact

Funding our album will provide us with the resources to project our voice and unique experiences as queer and transgender folx. We will be able to diversify and expand the definition of queer music and queer art. Visibility is important to queer folx of all backgrounds, in order to provide a healthy and diverse representation through art and performance.
 

Risks & Challenges

Regardless of reaching our funding goals, we will release this album and press it on vinyl. We will take on personal financial risk to do so, and try to raise money by playing live and touring. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to the campaign, please spread the word of Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. Attending our live shows and spreading the word helps, too!

story:
Debut Album Funding

'SongsFromADarkRoom'

My stage name is G-Beat, my real name is Jamal. I am an artist based in the UAE, trying to make good music for the people. This campaign would be really all I need and what's left to get this album done and out there, after its been in the works for almost three years. I couldn't afford paying my audio engineer and designers and merch suppliers and album producers (physical copies) and artists collaborating and and and and ... 

Long story short, I set it to a minimum because hopefully with the album launch, i'll have a little bit more money to carry on and give back to the community and everyone that helped. But for now, I need that first engine ignition push from you :)

 

What I Need & What You Get

What  I Need:

Here is a breakdown of where the money is going:-

  • 200$ Audio Engineer for mixing and mastering
  • 100$ Advertisement and Publishing it online (to ITunes, Deezer, Spotify and Anghami)
  • 200$ creating my first batch of albums to sell.
  • 150$ To rent venues for Launch parties and funding a small tour

If the money never comes through, the most important of all of these is the first 200$, because without it, there is no album really. However, If I end up at least with 200$, the rest will fall into place.

If I end up with extra donations (I doubt), I'll be going on tour with it. It'll pay for my traveling expenses and stay in the countries I'll go to.

What You Get:

Now, what You beautiful people get in return. I've set up as many perks as possible and please check them out before you donate. Everyone that donates anything gets a personal thank you from me, and a hug (mandatory and non negotiable.) As well as many other things, such as your name goes on the contributors on the album, merch, soft and hard copy of the album, maybe executive producer, maybe even some original lyrics from my notebook (I don't usually show that to anyone, I have a terrible handwriting), outtakes that no one ever saw, some demos that never made it to the album, some songs that never saw the sun too. (depends on what you pay accordingly, check perks, pretty please.)

 

The Impact

I was asked to write what difference would it make if you contribute in this section. To be honest, the album really depends on you. As I’m typing this I’m halfway through the album. My deadline to finish it is before the end of the campaign by 15 days. If I’m done with the album and I don’t have the money, I probably won’t release it till further notice. So again, what difference does it make ? All the difference.

 

Challenges

I can’t emphasize on how draining it is to be producing and recording 10 tracks when you’re only 18 with no audio engineering degree and no producers on board. If there is anything I do to make sure I am making good music, I share the new songs in open mic nights and play some of my friends the demos to see what they think. Being self taught in everything can really turn around and bite you when you're the artist and you start doubting your own self. 

It’s been hell of an exhausting ride for the last 5 years, specially that starting off and up until this day, I am getting 0 support from my family, if anything asking me to stop playing music. Continuous discouragement from high school friends about changing directions from beatbox to singing/songwriting and playing guitar. I’ve had my share of obstacles, so to avoid turning this into a drama blog. There has been alot of drama along the way, but this is it. ’SongsFromADarkRoom’ is in the oven, and I can’t wait to share it with you. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ofcourse! Some of us don’t have the bling bling (example: me). You can still help with no money! share this campaign with your friends. Spread the word, help me promote the album when its out. If you’re an artist of any sort reach out for me and maybe you can help with the album itself.

 

Much love and appreciation If you read till here,

I am G-Beat, and you’re Awesome,

Peace.

Some of us don’t have the bling bling (example: me). You can still help with no money! share this campaign with your friends. Spread the word, help me promote the album when its out. If you’re an artist of any sort reach out for me and maybe you can help with the album itself. Much love and appreciation If you read till here,I am G-Beat, and you’re Awesome,Peace.

story:
Link to previous campaign here: 

https://igg.me/at/daniellekane

Update  

Here’s the latest from the studio:

All the instrumental and vocal tracks have been recorded and we are now in the editing and mixing phase, then moving onto procuring copyright and duplication.

Your contribution helps takes the music out of the studio and into your hands.

I’ve been working with John Hoy as my producing partner at Cat Heaven Studio in Marin. John has produced numerous extraordinary albums, including Karen Drucker’s highly acclaimed work, and it’s an honor to work with the producer who raised the bar for the inspirational genre!

It’s a thrill to record fine musicians such as pianist Ross Gualco, pianist, and multi-instrumentalist and singer Rich Armstrong, who plays with Coldplay. 

I’m recording for you the songs and chants that got me through the toughest time of my life.

In Deeper Still, I am reaching out to those who seek a deeper connection to the Divine, a tangible expression of the love that is always present. 

Help me complete the album and allow me to share a gift with you, to show my appreciation of your support.

Check out the perks to see all of the ways I can thank you for your contributions.

In deepest gratitude,

Danielle

story:
What is The Alaska Music Show?

The Alaska Music Show is an independent Alaskan Music Show which plays Alaskan-made music on the air eight hours every day. It's currently on KONR 106.1 FM in Anchorage weekdays from 10 am to 6 pm. It's been an incredible undertaking with a great response from listeners. We play hundreds of Alaskan artists who have recorded thousands of songs made right here in Alaska. We're dedicated to representing each of them through The Alaska Music Show.

Here's where you come in

By supporting The Alaska Music Show, you're helping deliver great Alaskan Music to an audience of hundreds of thousands of interested listeners via the airwaves. 

To keep creating the show, we need production support. It takes time and effort to find new music and put it into rotation. It takes a studio to record announcements and create every show. It's a professional undertaking and labor of love.

Your contribution also forwards our efforts in creating the future 24/7 online version of the show. We've come this far on our own, but there is more work ahead. So to keep new shows coming, we need your support.

What's in it for you?

What do you get for supporting The Alaska Music Show? We're glad you asked. You will be appropriately acknowledged and fawned over on the air as a full-fledged supporter of The Alaska Music Show and recognized as an all-around advocate of music and art in Alaska.  Depending on the level of support, we'll also send you some cool Alaskan CDs we've discovered deep in the vaults.

Remember, this is an ALASKAN Music Show. We're not programmed by someone in Los Angeles. Everything you hear on the air was recorded right here in Alaska. If you can drive a dog team there, we probably have an album from that town or village. This is YOUR music show because you live here (or love Alaska from a distance.) The chances are excellent that you even personally know someone on our playlist - they probably told you about this fundraiser. Alaskan musicians have been making friends and uniquely independent music for a long time and now is their chance for everyone to hear it.

We've worked for years building this music collection and creating a platform to bring this music to our listeners. Thus far the expense has been out of our own pockets because we wanted to prove we could deliver a full-fledged show before we asked for anything. And now the Proof is on the radio. Literally, actually, because there's an Alaskan band called "Proof".

Other cool things about the show...

RURAL ALASKA - Your contribution also helps us produce segments for outlying and rural Alaskan areas that wouldn't receive the show otherwise. It's available for stations outside Anchorage in Southeast, Interior and Rural Alaska to download and air for FREE. How cool is that?

We appreciate that maybe you can't support this financially, but CAN support the show through your personal contacts and by making your own special noise about it with the Indiegogo share tools. Look around, enjoy that video, follow the links and show your support.

Spread the word and Give a Little Dough to the Alaska Music Show.

story:
Dancing out the Door

After two years of hard work and hard love and endless days of dreaming, designing and conjuring we are very excited to share our new LP - Dancing out the Door. And happy to report it will be our first album on limited edition vinyl!

What the hell is happening?

DANCING OUT THE DOOR comes out Friday, October 13 on Good Behavior Records. Pre-order here and get the album early! Plus special amazing bonus stuff. 

This is our third full length album after "Idiots" and "Manufacturing Joy." And it completes the secret code that can now be said aloud for the very first time in public: Idiots manufacturing joy and dancing out the door. 

Say this mission statement around any TJ Kong & the Atomic Bomb band member and you’ll be given the secret information you need to guide you on the next portion of your journey. Plus a refill on power potions. 

Post Apocalypse Blues – that’s what people began calling our music. It stuck. We dig it. This record is an exploration of that idea. Apocalyptic Americana. But besides all that, these songs are a celebration. A joyful madness. Every track has a different story to tell, real stories of strange humans doing beautiful things and being imperfect. Kaboom. Enjoy! 

And also it’s fun to drive to.  

How can I help?

You? Buy the record! Enjoy the record! It's been a long time coming and we know you're anxious to hear it.

Buy it now before it's officially released and we'll send it to you October 1st. We'll ship anywhere in the world, even New Jersey. All pre-sale proceeds cover production and touring costs and help us continue making god-damned beautiful noise and writing songs about fire and hangovers. 

Do you love me?

We wanted to take a moment and say that this trip with TJ Kong & the Atomic Bomb and all the humans who have supported us has been the most amazing and gratifying voyage. 

Who are we kidding? We love you. We are honored to be able to make records with your support all these years. And we think you’ll really like this one. And if you don’t, you can blame the two Josh's in our band. They're most likely to blame for any ill will you hold for us personally or professionally. Certainly not the two Dans. But seriously, it really is wonderful to share our music and get so much back in return. We DO love you!

story:
Short Summary

JIVE64 is an electro pop duo that has been active for a decade now. It was founded by two musicians who are also 80s lovers - Ella Tadmor & Roy Cohen. The duo has performed in every gay party in Tel Aviv, played Dublin pride twice and are a big supporters from within the LGBTQ community. 

The new single from the 4th studio album is a unique piece. It was co-written by the Grammy nominated Pen Up Girls who also co-wrote with Jessie J and many others. It is a unique song about fighting for the right love and overcoming any obstacle when we're united. It is empowering on one hand and carries the 80s huge anthems style like: Total Eclipse Of The Heart and I Need A Hero. Of course all of it comes with the duo's electro pop spices.

 

Why do we need support?

We want this to be a really successful campaign and to raise as much as we can for LGBTQ rights in Chechnya, so this is what we need:

  • Recording 
  • Mixing and mastering
  • PR to make sure people hear about it
  • Distribution to radio stations 
  • Music video (With tons of drag queens and drag kings fighting for love)
  • Video distribution

We promise you that any penny left will be donated to this noble cause.

So whether it's $5 or $1000 any donation counts for us and for LGBTQ rights in Chechnya.

Well, there are perks too:

  • For $5 You may get the next single before it's released
  • For $10 You may get the full album before everyone else
  • For $150 You will get our full discography including our first album remastered and some hidden gems
  • For $1,500 - We will produce and record a cover song for any song you'll choose

 

We are up for the challenge

In the past JIVE64 has entered the charts in Germany, Sweden, Italy & Sweden and our tracks have been played hundreds of thousands of times in radio stations and streaming music services.

We want to use this power given to us to do some good and justice in the world.

In addition to your help we have gathered an amazing team around us to help us making sure people hear about it and a super talented team of drag kings and queens to help us make an awesome video that no one would want to miss!

 

So please help us by donating and spread the word by sharing, liking and nudging everyone around you to join the force.

Kisses and a huge thanks from all of us at the JIVE64 Conqueror team.

story:
Short Summary

Caught somewhere between a gig, an exhibition and a cabaret night, STOP ALL THE CLOCKS brings together Shadow Opera’s incredible artists, some of London’s finest young film-makers, cabaret superstar Frieda Love and some brilliant music. Our film-makers have all made short films inspired by the music our singers will be performing live, creating immersive, engaging vignettes. Featuring music by Weill, Schoenberg, Berg, Britten, Satie and Poulenc (don’t know who they are? doesn't matter, they’re dead anyway…), the evening promises to delight, inspire and thoroughly seduce you with delicious musical oddities! And to top it all, the bar’s open throughout the performance (gin’s not just for intervals)!

We’re doing 3 nights at the Copeland Gallery, Peckham (one of those cripplingly cool, warehouse spaces – stop rolling your eyes, you know you love them). Dates are November 9th, 10th and 11th. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Shadow Opera needs your help! We are fundraising for some of our production costs (projectors and lights don’t come cheap!). Your donations will help us  give this event a spectacular setting and get people to leave those pesky preconceptions at the door. 

  • We need to raise £5000 to cover lighting, projection hire and some other technical trickery.

Risks & Challenges

  • What if we fall short? Whatever happens, the show must go on! Thrifty things that we are,  we will stage a great show in November no matter what. But these funds will help us make this event really special and we need special concerts if classical music is going to reach new, young audiences.
  • We know it's not enough for the musical world to lament it's aging and shrinking audiences. We know artists need to take risks and find new ways of reaching people with this brilliant music. Besides, the risks of not experimenting are far greater!

The Impact

What’s our objective? To make classical music cool, man (yeah I heard too). No, we want to show there are ways to engage with classical music which don’t involve sitting in silence in a room for 2 hours whilst strangers cough on you.

There’s a huge appetite for immersive, unusual cultural happenings (think Punchdrunk, Secret Cinema etc.) and yet the classical music world is doing little to harvest this potential. So your money will help us create a space where curious peeps can come and experience classical music in a way that engages and entertains them

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash? Even if you can’t donate anything you can still help us by getting the word out there.

Please share this campaign, like us on Facebook, share our posts and tweets, shout about what we’re doing to your nearest and dearest and it will really help us not only promote this event, but also our mission to give people a way of enjoying classical music who would otherwise run the other way.

story:
Why Sing Louder?

Music is the most potent tool I know to break down walls, slip through barricades, and connect with each other. And when we authentically connect, we can change the world. Now more than ever we need to be courageous enough to transcend emotional, intellectual, and political barriers, and raise our voices…together.

For the past 6 months I’ve been in the studio tracking a new record to be released this Fall. The songs I've chosen to include on this record give voice to my story, and hopefully resonate with others in a way that inspires them to give voice to their own. When we share our stories, we not only heal ourselves, but empower others to do the same.

I’ve seen the songs on this record move people to raise their voices together, and speak their own truths in a way that makes a difference to them, to others, and to the world. Singing is empowering. Singing together even more so. When we raise our voices in community, they resonate, are amplified, and we are heard. That's why I've chosen songs for this record that feature voices raised together, whether two voices in harmony, a gospel choir, or a community of voices.

I hope people hear this record and understand that they too, can join in, express themselves in community, speak their truth, tell their story, and make a difference. Every voice matters.

Live what you love

Love what you do

Laugh with your friends

Cry with them, too

Sing every day

Sing out loud sing out clear

If you don’t know the words…

Sing Louder!

So, what next?

We've finished tracking the record, We brought in a local gospel choir, players from all sorts of fabulous bands, and a chorus of voices from our community. Now it's time to share the record with communities around the world.

In 1971 the world was asked to sing in perfect harmony; now we're asking you to "Sing Louder" and be heard above the noise.

  • With $12,000 we can mix, master, design, press and release the record
  • With $15,000 we can make a powerful music video of the song "Sing Louder" to promote and share the message behind "Sing Louder"
  • With $20,000 we can run a full scale radio and video promo campaign to have "Sing Louder" heard by the world

Every contribution makes a difference and is rewarded with, at the very least, my sincere gratitude. We also have some fun perks like house concerts, workshops and personalized songs, as well as pre-release signed copies of the CD, a limited edition "Sing Louder Singers" T-shirt with the names of all of the voices from our community choir listed on the back! If you're a musician yourself, you might want to check out the coaching sessions or our keys/guitar/vocals package for your next song.

What else?

The Sing Louder Singers

I've played shows in bars and coffee houses, in living rooms and auditoriums, on festival stages in fields and on farms, and the most empowering part of every show is hearing all of the voices singing back at me. People join in, maybe tentatively at first, but always growing louder and stronger and finally releasing into the bliss that is a chorus of voices raised together.

I've tried to capture that glorious sound coming back at me on the title track of “Sing Louder”. Forty-six souls gathered at MorningStar Studios on July 8th to raise their voices, and share their intentions with the world. Many of them stepped way out of their comfort zones to don headphones and sing into a mic. They held signs and shared dreams, they sang with passion, joy and abandon. The energy was indescribable, and that's why I'm so glad we captured it on tape and on video and we'll be sharing it with the world on this new record!!

(For a full list of members of the "Sing Louder Singers" pick up the limited edition T-shirt - they're all listed on the back!!)

Other Voices on the Record

"Sing Louder" features Meghan Cary with Analog Gypsies:

  • Meghan (vocals and guitar)
  • Peter Farrell (keys, vocals, guitar and U Bass)
  • Jocko MacNelly (bass and guitar)
  • Quint Lange (drums)
  • Stacy Weathers (banjo and vocals)
  • Bob Beach (harmonica, flute and vocals)

And several guest artists:

  • Cheryl Prashker (percussion)
  • Larry Feldman (violin, viola and mandolin)
  • Fred Pellegrini (guitar)
  • Linda Waverka (vocals)
  • Chico Huff (bass)
  • Erik Johnson (drums)
  • Cory's Gospel Choir

Glenn Barratt behind the board capturing it all!

The Songs We're Singing (in no meaningful order...yet)

(all newly arranged and recorded)

  • Sing Louder
  • River Rock
  • Responsibility
  • My Life
  • Sail Across the Water
  • Live!
  • Fly and Be Free
  • Little Girls
  • Drive
  • Wind

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us make all of this happen by spreading the word!

It's easy to share the campaign with friends using the indiegogo share tools found under our fundraising goal:

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Send the campaign URL to friends via facebook messenger
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo

You can also add your voice to the movement by flying the Sing Louder banner as your facebook cover photo and asking friends to do the same.

Every time you raise your voice, share your story, speak your truth, you make a difference!! Thanks so much for spreading the word!

I truly believe that "Sing Louder" is not just a record, but a message to the world for each of us to be courageous enough to voice our truth in community. I'd love to hear from you if you have any ideas about how to amplify this movement.
