Forty-six souls gathered at MorningStar Studios on July 8th to raise their voices, and share their intentions with the world. Many of them stepped way out of their comfort zones to don headphones and sing into a mic. They held signs and shared dreams, they sang with passion, joy and abandon. The energy was indescribable, and that's why I'm so glad we captured it on tape and on video and we'll be sharing it with the world on this new record!!
(For a full list of members of the "Sing Louder Singers" pick up the limited edition T-shirt - they're all listed on the back!!)
Other Voices on the Record

"Sing Louder" features Meghan Cary with Analog Gypsies:

Meghan (vocals and guitar)
Peter Farrell (keys, vocals, guitar and U Bass)
Jocko MacNelly (bass and guitar)
Quint Lange (drums)
Stacy Weathers (banjo and vocals)
Bob Beach (harmonica, flute and vocals)

And several guest artists:

Cheryl Prashker (percussion)
Larry Feldman (violin, viola and mandolin)
Fred Pellegrini (guitar)
Linda Waverka (vocals)
Chico Huff (bass)
Erik Johnson (drums)
Cory's Gospel Choir

Glenn Barratt behind the board capturing it all!
The Songs We're Singing (in no meaningful order...yet)
(all newly arranged and recorded)

Sing Louder
River Rock
Responsibility
My Life
Sail Across the Water
Live!
Fly and Be Free
Little Girls
Drive
Wind


Other Ways You Can Help
You can help us make all of this happen by spreading the word!
It's easy to share the campaign with friends using the indiegogo share tools found under our fundraising goal:

Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
Send the campaign URL to friends via facebook messenger
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo

You can also add your voice to the movement by flying the Sing Louder banner as your facebook cover photo and asking friends to do the same.Every time you raise your voice, share your story, speak your truth, you make a difference!! Thanks so much for spreading the word!I truly believe that "Sing Louder" is not just a record, but a message to the world for each of us to be courageous enough to voice our truth in community. I'd love to hear from you if you have any ideas about how to amplify this movement.

story: Short Summary Why is “Sounds of Revolution” important? What impact do we wish to have with the music? “Reggae should be a force for change. I wrote this album for the freedom of all of the innocent people of the world who are still fighting for their rights. African Americans, Jews, Syrians, North Koreans to name a few. The citizens are innocent, but what can we do to stop those who want to take advantage or enslave the souls of these people. This album is a call to unity. Bob Marley predicted reggae would return to Africa, I wish to speak in his spirit and call out to everyone to sing and dance “ONE LOVE” again. As long as we are separate, none among us is free. Let us all the downtrodden peoples of the world unite and fight for our rights. Fight for the rights of our brothers and sisters who can’t fight for themselves.” -Peace Bambo I am Leah Prout Bambo, band manager of Jah Tribe Band and wife of lead: Habib Peace Bambo. I fell in love with the man and the message, and if you listen, I think you will too. As an artist, Peace Bambo is doing something which is now relatively rare in Rwanda. That is producing live, original music. Many of the country’s artists perished in the genocide. Since that time a new wave of low quality popular music has taken over. It is not uncommon to attend a “popular” concert here, where the “performer” puts on a CD and lip syncs over the track. The challenge is that live music is much more costly and time consuming both to perform and produce. Peace Bambo and his musicians have produced an original work unlike anything being done in East Africa today. In addition to the integrity of the music itself, the music contains important and relevant messages. Messages include: uniting people no matter what color, ethnicity or religion; encouraging people to read and find information for themselves; and speaking against corruption, terrorism, racism. The album is 90% done, but we need your help to complete the work, and bring it to market. We are asking for $6,000. This will go toward the following: Studio and production payment Payment of musicians (back up singer, saxophone and solo guitar artists are receiving $30 per song) Payment of transport for musicians (more than half of the musicians are volunteering, receiving only a reimbursement for transportation cost.) CD printing Payment of practice room Musician transport for practices *In the event that we do not receive full funding, we will use what we get toward completing the album itself and seek other sponsorship for practices. Contributors will receive perks, including: Two songs (digital copy) (Under $25) A pre-release digital copy of the complete album ($25) A pre-release with a bonus track from the second album ($50) Album, bonus track and personal video thank you message from band members ($75) Album, bonus track, video message and named thank you in album cover ($100 +) Album, bonus track, video message, thank you and life-time ½ price tickets with back stage pass (Over $100) Your contribution will help to release this album, but also to provide a livelihood for the talented, dedicated and struggling musicians of Jah Tribe Band. Many of the artists have been working for free or at reduced payment because they believe in the project. Helping us to launch this album will also help to provide work for more than ten people. Please contact me with any questions: leahprout@gmail.com Want to learn more about us, and hear some of the songs? Visit our Facebook pages here: www.facebook.com/JahTribeBand www.facebook.com/RasBambo
story_txt:
Short Summary
Why is “Sounds of Revolution” important? What impact do we wish to have with the music?

“Reggae should be a force for change. I wrote this album for the freedom of all of the innocent people of the world who are still fighting for their rights. African Americans, Jews, Syrians, North Koreans to name a few. The citizens are innocent, but what can we do to stop those who want to take advantage or enslave the souls of these people. This album is a call to unity. Bob Marley predicted reggae would return to Africa, I wish to speak in his spirit and call out to everyone to sing and dance “ONE LOVE” again. As long as we are separate, none among us is free. Let us all the downtrodden peoples of the world unite and fight for our rights. Fight for the rights of our brothers and sisters who can’t fight for themselves.” -Peace Bambo

I am Leah Prout Bambo, band manager of Jah Tribe Band and wife of lead: Habib Peace Bambo. I fell in love with the man and the message, and if you listen, I think you will too. As an artist, Peace Bambo is doing something which is now relatively rare in Rwanda. That is producing live, original music. Many of the country’s artists perished in the genocide. Since that time a new wave of low quality popular music has taken over. It is not uncommon to attend a “popular” concert here, where the “performer” puts on a CD and lip syncs over the track. The challenge is that live music is much more costly and time consuming both to perform and produce.

Peace Bambo and his musicians have produced an original work unlike anything being done in East Africa today. In addition to the integrity of the music itself, the music contains important and relevant messages. Messages include: uniting people no matter what color, ethnicity or religion; encouraging people to read and find information for themselves; and speaking against corruption, terrorism, racism.

The album is 90% done, but we need your help to complete the work, and bring it to market. 
We are asking for $6,000. This will go toward the following:
Studio and production payment
Payment of musicians (back up singer, saxophone and solo guitar artists are receiving $30 per song)
Payment of transport for musicians (more than half of the musicians are volunteering, receiving only a reimbursement for transportation cost.)
CD printing
Payment of practice room
Musician transport for practices
*In the event that we do not receive full funding, we will use what we get toward completing the album itself and seek other sponsorship for practices.

Contributors will receive perks, including: 
Two songs (digital copy) (Under $25)
A pre-release digital copy of the complete album ($25)
A pre-release with a bonus track from the second album ($50)
Album, bonus track and personal video thank you message from band members ($75)
Album, bonus track, video message and named thank you in album cover ($100 +)
Album, bonus track, video message, thank you and life-time ½ price tickets with back stage pass (Over $100)

Your contribution will help to release this album, but also to provide a livelihood for the talented, dedicated and struggling musicians of Jah Tribe Band. Many of the artists have been working for free or at reduced payment because they believe in the project. Helping us to launch this album will also help to provide work for more than ten people.

Please contact me with any questions: leahprout@gmail.com

Want to learn more about us, and hear some of the songs? Visit our Facebook pages here: 
www.facebook.com/JahTribeBand
www.facebook.com/RasBambo

story:
Resumen

 

Estudio Choralia es un proyecto en crecimiento dirigido de la mano de nuestro joven director, Fabián Vargas: quien con 23 años ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria musical como director coral y cantante. Es él quien le da vida a este sueño en una época de constante auge en la disciplina coral.

Estudio Choralia ha logrado codearse con grandes exponentes de la música coral tales como  T. J. Harper profesor asociado de música y director de actividades corales del Providence College, en Rhode Island, Estados Unidos; la visita del Maestro Masahiko Shimizu, profesor de la Universidad de Bellas Artes de Tokio y la Universidad de Tsuru quien actualmente funge como vicepresidente de la Federeración Coral Japonesa. Así como el Dr. Paul Hondorp, quien preside  la  Kentucky American Choral Directors Association (KACDA), y es el actual director de actividades corales de la Western Kentucky University, con quienes Estudio Choralia tendrá el honor de compartir el escenario durante su gira a Costa Rica, el 18 de mayo del presente año en el Teatro de Alajuela.

Ha sido el coro anfitrión del Festival Costa Rica Canta además de ser coro afiliado a la ACDA Costa Rica (única sede externa a los Estados Unidos de la asociación coral más importante del mundo).

En Agosto del 2018, conquistaremos una meta más: ¡Viajar a México como únicos representantes costarricenses al Festival Mundial de Coros! Este festival tiene su sede en Puebla, México y se llevará a cabo del 24 de Agosto al 1 de Setiembre.

La gira por México representa, para nuestro coro, la consolidación como colectivo artístico con calidad de exportación,  que tiene el objetivo primario de ser representación del joven talento costarricense a nivel mundial. El coro cuenta con 40 integrantes en total, de los cuales 32 formarán parte de la gira a México. Todos hemos hecho un gran esfuerzo personal para cubrir los gastos básicos del festival como lo son los tiquetes de avión y la inscripción al evento . ¡Ahora te necesitamos!

Un festival mundial exige que cada coro sea una representación de la idiosincrasia de cada país. Por ello, es de vital importancia la adquisición de un uniforme de gala que nos represente a todos nosotros como costarricenses.

¿Serás parte de nuestro sueño? 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtenés:

 

Necesitamos 3000 dólares  para solventar los gastos mencionados. El monto planteado será óptimo para nuestras necesidades, pero de no alcanzar la meta, el monto recaudado irá para ayudar a los integrantes con menos recursos económicos. 

Si colaborás, ¡te recompensamos!

Además del eterno agradecimiento de todos nuestros integrantes, tenemos recompensas para vos: 

  1. Por una colaboración de 10 dólares serás un Amigo:  Agradeceremos públicamente en nuestras redes sociales tu colaboración y recibirás información exclusiva de nuestras presentaciones futuras.
  2. Por monto mayor a 20 dólares serás un Colaborador Exclusivo: ¡Te dedicamos un video de agradecimiento solamente para vos! Así pues, nuestro agradecimiento público.
  3. Por un monto mayor a 50 dólares serás invitado/a especial a nuestro Concierto de Padrinos, ofrecido especialmente a nuestros colaboradores en esta campaña *, además de acceso exclusivo a acceso a  un ensayo o grabación clave de Estudio Choralia, información exclusiva y agradecimiento público por tu colaboración.
  4. Por un monto mayor a 100 dólares, vos o tu empresa, aparecerán como Socios del proyecto. Tu nombre y/o tu logo estará en nuestras producciones. Tendrás acceso exclusivo a un ensayo o grabación de Estudio Choralia ( para un máximo de 3 personas para las empresas). Además de todo lo anterior.*
  5. Por un mínimo de 600 dólares el logo de tu empresa aparecerá en todo lugar: en todos las producciones de Estudio Choralia. Es decir, ¡serás nuestro Patrocinador!. ¡Además, te ofrecemos un concierto exclusivo para que llevés a tu empresa!*

* Para nuestros donantes desde el extranjero, ofreceremos transmisión en vivo por internet, mediante un acceso exclusivo.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Si no nos podés ayudar con dinero, también otras formas de apoyo son agradecidas: 

 
  • ¡Seguí nuestro trabajo! El apoyo más importante es que nos dejés llegar hasta vos con nuestro arte. 
  • ¡Compartí la campaña! Decile a tus amigos, amigas y familiares sobre nosotros.
  • Seguinos en Facebook, YouTube e Instagram, para compartir por esos medios nuestro trabajo y nuestra campaña.
 

¡Te necesitamos!

Por un mínimo de 600 dólares el logo de tu empresa aparecerá en todo lugar: en todos las producciones de Estudio Choralia. Es decir, ¡serás nuestro Patrocinador!. ¡Además, te ofrecemos un concierto exclusivo para que llevés a tu empresa!*


* Para nuestros donantes desde el extranjero, ofreceremos transmisión en vivo por internet, mediante un acceso exclusivo.
 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
 Si no nos podés ayudar con dinero, también otras formas de apoyo son agradecidas:  
¡Seguí nuestro trabajo! El apoyo más importante es que nos dejés llegar hasta vos con nuestro arte. 
¡Compartí la campaña! Decile a tus amigos, amigas y familiares sobre nosotros.
Seguinos en Facebook, YouTube e Instagram, para compartir por esos medios nuestro trabajo y nuestra campaña.
 ¡Te necesitamos!

story: .

About the Album

This is the beginning of the creation of my first full album, Human Nature. The songs of this album were inspired by the whole spectrum of experiences of being human, the Dark and the Light. The potential for great beauty and acts of selflessness, working for the greater good, and the ability to be cold-hearted, prejudiced and abusive to any part of the amazing creation, the Natural World, to fellow Earthlings. In each song, I express different aspects of this experience that I feel is both personal to my own life, as well as touching upon truths and feelings that are more universal; the confrontation of the imminence of Death and mortality, the falling away and returning to connection and intimacy with Nature, and the current state of personal and societal shadows that are desperately needing to be made conscious. These songs are deeply vulnerable for me to share, and I feel ready and willing to express these parts of my heart with you all in hopes that they touch similar places in your heart as well.

The Call For Support

I have roughly calculated as best as I can how much the totality of this project will cost, but I can not know right now what it will come out to at the end... It seems like it will be around $2000-$2500 for the recording, mixing, mastering of the album, the printing of CD's, custom made sweatshop-free T-shirts, hiring of artist for the album art, hiring of any musicians that I may feature on the album, etc... 

How You Can Help

So, I have listed these perks for donations, all of which I feel have value and I have equated with donation amounts as to how I honestly feel they are worth. Any donations are greatly appreciated, but I absolutely understand that money is tight for a lot of you even if you want to support the album! You can always help out by sharing the link of the fundraiser on Social Media or privately with friends and family, or just send out some good vibes and love for this project! I appreciate it all and truly do not have any expectations from any of you... Thank you SO much for all your support for my music and our friendships. I feel so blessed to have such amazing friends, family and community in my life...

With Love and Gratitude,

Connor Correll

story:
The whole idea for the project began at my agent's 50th birthday party in Vienna, when I surprised him by putting on a dress and singing Mary Sunshine's song from "Chicago." All the guests at the party erupted and screamed with thunderous applause. The very next day, the idea for a full-length broadway CD was born. After all, when I was a child and before I even know what opera was, I was singing tons of broadway musicals. It's in my blood!

Recording a CD of this music with the countertenor voice I have developed and trained for many years is a dream for me, and I have something totally unique and special planned for you. In my career as an opera singer, I have a specialty in performing women's roles, so the idea came about quite naturally that I should bring this element to my CD. This is why I will be recording songs combining both male and female personas! Once the CD has been recorded and released, I have big ambitions for a special and unique concert tour with the repertoire from the CD.

What I Need

I will be recording a full-length CD. I need to cover all the expenses related to the production and release of a new album, which means payments for:

  • Pre-Production
  • Recording, mixing, and mastering
  • Our amazing pianist
  • Cover Artwork and Booklet design
  • Photos
  • Videos
  • Publicity

BUT! My ambitions go beyond the CD. I want to spread BroadRAY! far and wide!My agency and myself are planning a LIVE tour of BroadRAY! Contributions beyond our initial goal will go toward publicity for the CD and concert tour.

What You Get

Creating a masterpiece takes time, and I don't want to keep you waiting for the final CD! That's why I have already made a preview recording just for you with 4 songs! This Preview CD is available immediately and will be available EXCLUSIVELY to campaign contributors. 

Some other fun things I have for you:

  • Photos
  • Autographs
  • Wall Posters
  • Private Concerts
  • DVDs
  • Personal birthday songs for you
  • Recognition in the final CD booklet
    • Special Thanks Credit
    • Co-Producer Credit

Why I'm doing this

I want to create something special and wonderful for the world to enjoy. This idea has guided my career each step of the way. I have always accepted my voice and talents as gifts to nourish, protect, and share. That's why I work so hard. Quite simply, I want to make people happy!

The Process

I am very fortunate to collaborate with my agency, Parnassus ARTS Productions, who is producing this CD. They have successfully produced countless magnificent CDs on top labels such as Sony and Decca, and have had 3 GRAMMY nominations. They are overseeing the entire project from start to finish, and will transition the final recorded master to a quality record label. You can see more at www.parnassus.at.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: "Why are you working with the euro currency? I'm an American, can I pay in dollars?"
A: My agency, Parnassus ARTS Productions (located in Vienna) is producing this project. You can absolutely still give to the campaign as an American (or from any other country)! Your credit card company will automatically convert the currency. If you want to check today's conversion rate you can visit: www.google.com/finance?q=EURUSD.

Q: "If you are producing the CD in Europe, will I be able to play it in America or any other country? What about the DVD?"
A: YES! I want to share this project with the world, and the CD and Bonus DVD will be functional in every country.

Q: "When will I get my perks?"
A: I want you to receive your perks as soon as possible once the campaign has finished. Most of the materials will be delivered quickly after the campaign is over, at least by November 2018. If the final CD is included in your perks, that will come to you once it's officially released.

Q: "How will my donation appear on my credit card statement?"
A: INDIEGOGO*BROADRAY

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you're able to contribute or not, you can still help by sharing this campaign!

Use Indiegogo’s Sharing Tools and help me reach as many people as we can! You can find the buttons at the top of the page, under the "amount raised" section. They look like this:

Thank you for looking and listening! Please spread the word, and if you have any questions please click "Ask a question." I'm happy to hear from you!

You can absolutely still give to the campaign as an American (or from any other country)! Your credit card company will automatically convert the currency. If you want to check today's conversion rate you can visit: www.google.com/finance?q=EURUSD.
Q: "If you are producing the CD in Europe, will I be able to play it in America or any other country? What about the DVD?"A: YES! I want to share this project with the world, and the CD and Bonus DVD will be functional in every country.
Q: "When will I get my perks?"A: I want you to receive your perks as soon as possible once the campaign has finished. Most of the materials will be delivered quickly after the campaign is over, at least by November 2018. If the final CD is included in your perks, that will come to you once it's officially released.
Q: "How will my donation appear on my credit card statement?"A: INDIEGOGO*BROADRAY
Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you're able to contribute or not, you can still help by sharing this campaign!
Use Indiegogo’s Sharing Tools and help me reach as many people as we can! You can find the buttons at the top of the page, under the "amount raised" section. They look like this:

Thank you for looking and listening! Please spread the word, and if you have any questions please click "Ask a question." I'm happy to hear from you!

story:
Passion in Pigskin (Yes, a FOOTBALL OPERA!): Brought to you by OOT-WIS

Opera on Tap - Wisconsin (formerly Opera on Tap - Milwaukee, or OOT-MKE), an opera group who performs mostly in bars and restaurants, is bringing new things to the area. OOT-WIS is one of many chapters throughout the US and internationally. OOT-WIS prizes itself on being approachable, fun, relatable, giving the audience a taste of an art that has been misrepresented by modern media.

Other shows/operas our local chapter has produced include:

Amahl and the Night Visitors, The Marriage of Figaro, American Spring (local composer)

Due to OOT-MKE's performing of a local composer's work (American Spring), the New York-based composer/librettist duo of Passion in Pigskin (Michael Lydon and Ellen Mandel) took notice and reached out in interest of OOT-WIS performing their work.

In order to make the show a success, the team is making decisions to keep the production affordable, WHICH IS WHERE YOU ALL COME IN!

 

The amount mentioned in this campaign will help cover costume rental fees (cheerleader and football-player-influenced), minimal props, minimal set pieces, and cast and production team stipends.

Our performance location, Anodyne Coffee Roasters (Walker's Point), has made an agreement with us that allows the rental fee to not have to be a part of this campaign. THANKS ANODYNE!

 

Opera on Tap - Wisconsin wants to help the general public to understand and appreciate how approachable opera can be, especially with influences of jazz and other genres of music.

What We Need & What You Get

So, here's the breakdown:

  • We are looking to raise $3,000. 8 performers (some are covers), two production staff, minimal props, minimal costumes, minimal set pieces, advertising costs; it can add up!
  • What do I get as a donor? Comp tickets, t-shirts, other special perks you will see on this page!
  • Funds will go for all of the up front costs no matter the amount raised here. But we do want to make sure to at least cover costs of cast and production team at minimum.

The Impact

"How does my contribution make a difference?"

  • Supporting local arts
  • Supporting an art form that is often misunderstood
  • Supporting local ARTISTS
  • Supporting local economy (Anodyne included in the end by bringing in more patrons)
  • Helping make a kick-butt production a reality!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some of you just cannot afford to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get word out and make some noise about this Passion in Pigskin campaign.
  • You can share this link using the Indiegogo share tools on this page!

Thanks!

story:
Hello Friends! Welcome to my first ever music fundraiser. It has been an absolutely INCREDIBLE year living in Nashville, TN. I’ve spent countless hours crafting new songs with some of the best co-writers I know that I am really proud of, and I am SO excited to show you all of the material I’ve been working so hard on! My team and I are eager to get back into the studio to start recording these songs, but are in need of your help to make this project and dream of recording them in Nashville, with the best of the best, a reality. Asking for help has always been something I have had a hard time with, but as I move along in my music career, I realize that it is sometimes a necessary thing to do to get me closer to my goals and dreams. We are hoping to get as close to our goal as possible so that we can use the best team and equipment possible to make this project bigger than any project we’ve done before. Any support you can offer, whether it’s a couple of dollars toward my campaign, or a share of my campaign on Facebook, means more to me than I could ever express.

 

What Your Donation Will Go Toward:

Pre-Production

Studio time

Production

Mixing

Engineering

Studio musicians

Mastering

Album Art

Duplication

Radio Promotion

Online promotion

Copywriting

CD Release Party

And much more!

 

This stuff adds up really quickly!! But we are confident that with the help of my supportive fan base, we will be able to raise the funds to make this project happen.

 

Rewards:

We want to be able to give back to you guys for all of your support! We have some pretty awesome rewards that we want to offer for every certain amount of donation. It’s our way of saying Thank You for contributing to this project and contributing to helping me make my dreams come true.

 

THANK YOU!!

I am SO thankful for all of the support you guys have showered me with over the years. It is truly an honor to be able to continue to chase my dreams with you all by my side. All of your shares, likes, word of mouth shout outs, streams of my music... helps me get that much closer to achieving this dream of mine. I feel as though I have already “made it” because of you guys, and want nothing more than to keep putting out music for you to listen to for years to come.  I hope this next EP gives you a glimpse into my heart through my lyrics and allows you to feel closer to both me and my music. I will never be able to thank you enough for standing by my side throughout this journey!

story:
Let's Make Some Music

It's time to head back into the studio and recording some new music and we're excited to include you all in the process! We started this campaign to create a fun way for you, our fans, to be part of the action and to get some cool stuff in the process! Without all of you coming to our shows and spinning our records and wearing our hats and shirts - we simply wouldn't exist - so we want to say a very sincere thank you for being a fan. Check out how to get in on the action below...

What We Need & What You Get

We know it might seem like magic how we just end up with music online and cds for sale and show up on stages around the country... but there's a lot of time and money that goes into the process! For example, there's renting the studio time, hiring a great engineer to capture all the sounds, getting the music mixed and mastered, gas, lodging, etc.

But what's in it for you?? Glad you asked... When you donate to this project, you get cool stuff back! Check out all the perks listed on this campaign and dive in at the level you're comfortable with!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute with your bank account, there are definitely still some ways you can help us out. Simply sharing this on your Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter account helps us get the word out and helps us reach more fans. Indiegogo has made it easy with the share tools located on this campaign. 

Thanks so much for your support and we'll see you on the road!

story:
Short Summary

 

'I think you're really, really going to enjoy... the fantastic sound of Galileo's Fan' - Matt Graveling, Best of British Unsigned

'I think you'll agree, that's absolutely gorgeous... I'll look forward to hearing a lot more from them' - Diana Schad, BBC Radio Scotland

'I can't get this out of my head!' - Future Music Songwriting

 

Hello everyone and thank you very much for taking the time to look at our page.

We are siblings, Martin and Fi Vass, from Nairn in the Scottish highlands. We have been gigging for a number of years now and writing songs habitually for the entirety of our adult lives. Our music is our catharsis and comes from a place of sincere ardour.

'This lady's voice just blew me away' - Elaine Lamb, Oban FM

We began writing separately and would share our musings with one another whenever we had the chance to meet up and we soon discovered our mutual love for each others' songs. As close pals and allies (as well as brother and sister), we have supported each other through life's trials and tribulations and we feel very lucky to be able to now support one another in the story-telling of it. 

'Carefully crafted songs' - Toby Stainton, Inverness Gigs

When we play for an audience, the thing that people comment on most is the strength of the familial/musical connection, especially in the vocal harmonies. When we perform as a trio with our brother, Mike Vass, the response is always the same. I suppose it is because we feel as connected to each others' songs as we do our own and that is clearly appreciated by listeners.

'What a joy it is to hear siblings harmonise' - Neil McFadyen, Folk Radio UK

We grew up playing and singing Scottish traditional music and songs (which provided a rich tapestry of stories and melodies to draw influence from) while listening to everything besides (We enjoyed a combination of Indie, pop, rock, electronic and everything in-between). 

Moving with the rapid development of production techniques, our music has evolved into a full-bodied Indie-band sound, incorporating big, melody-rich choruses, with contrasting subtle electronic themes and textures. Fans have likened it to CHVRCHES, The Cranberries, Idlewild, Jimmy Eat World, London Grammar, Stereophonics and The Frames, to name a few.

'Awesome. Simply awesome. Please! Please! Upload more tunes to 
XRP Radio. I personally love your music. Magic!' - David Campbell, XRP Radio

We are lucky to have a strong team of professionals behind us, bringing our music to another level. Iain Hutchison is our producer at GloWorm Recording Studios in Glasgow, we have Louis Abbott (Admiral Fallow) on drums, Graeme Smillie (Chemikal Underground) on bass and Mike Vass on fiddle.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need

By supporting us, you are supporting the organic creation of new music (no record labels, no constraints), and you are taking the first step on our journey with us, as recording artists. Essentially, simply by pre-ordering an album from us, you become part of our grass-roots record label. When we get off the ground it will be because of people like you. Thank you.

Below is a breakdown of the costs involved in making and promoting the album. Some of these costs are flexible and will be adjusted depending on the amount of support received. 

  • Studio hire £2,770
  • Production, sound engineering and mastering £4,400
  • Session musician fees £1,100
  • Accommodation £1000
  • Album Artwork £700
  • CD manufacture £400-1000
  • Professional PR campaign £1500-4000
  • Indiegogo (roughly 10%) administrative costs £400

We are enlisting your support to help us with the production and promotion costs. The album will cost between £10,000 and £15,000 to make and will ideally include 21 days in the studio with producer (including mixing), 3-4 of those days with session musicians. The mixing is when the magic happens and we're determined not to cut any corners in order to get the absolute best result. Having a professional PR campaign is essential in getting the album into the right hands and, obviously, the more we are able to spend on this, the better the chances of the album being a success.

What you get in return

It's just like online shopping. You pay for your item(s) now, there's a slight delay in shipping, but we guarantee your item will be sent as soon as it's ready :D 

Offers include:

  • Pre-release digital download (be among the first to hear it)
  • Hardcopy of the album (signed copy, delivered to your door)
  • Tickets to album launch party
  • Handwritten, signed and framed lyrics
  • Credit in the album notes. This means that your name, or your company's name, will be included in the liner notes. 
  • Video of us performing a requested cover song
  • Tune/song commission- We will write you a song
  • Private concert- We will play an acoustic gig in your home
  • Full band gig- Book us to play at your venue/event
  • Credit as Executive Producer in the album notes. Fancy.

Please scroll all the way to the bottom on the right-hand side of the page for full details of perks.

 All contributions are greatly appreciated. You do not have to claim the corresponding/full perk if you are unable/do not want to.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, don't worry, there are still ways you can help:

  • Please share our campaign on social media or with anyone you think might be interested
  • Follow us on Facebook/Twitter or sign up to our mailing list here: http://www.galileosfan.com

 

Many thanks, folks.

We hope to see you soon.

 

Join us on social media:

https://www.facebook.com/GalileosFan/

https://twitter.com/FiVass

https://www.instagram.com/galileosfan/

 

Stream the single for free on our soundcloud page:

https://soundcloud.com/galileos-fan/whod-have-t...

 

If you have any questions about the campaign, please direct them fivass25@gmail.com 

 

Thanks again.

Follow us on Facebook/Twitter or sign up to our mailing list here: http://www.galileosfan.com

story:
Short Summary

Hey! Tim Carman here, 

Some of you may know me as the drummer for the award winning soul singer Julie Rhodes, recently declared "Female Vocalist of the Year,” and “Americana Artist of the Year" in Boston. Others might know me as a drum teacher in Boston and Los Angeles, and author of the drum instruction book Shape Beats For Kids. You may have also seen me perform as the drummer for various artists like Christy Calabro (Brett Michaels, Poison), The Tokyo Tramps, All Talk, Sheldon and Cunnane, Violet Wine, Valley Shine, The Potluck Quartet, Mother Jones, Roberto Hermosillo, Eric and the French Quarter, Nick Camillo, Jake and the Infernal Machine, Tom's Folly and The Elizabeth Kill. But I’m hoping you’ll soon know me as the creator of the funk band Tim Carman and The Street 45s and composer of an original funk album. To step into this new role as composer and tackle this challenge of recording an original album, I am looking for support from amazing family and friends. I am hoping you can help me realize this dream and am confident you will be dancing to the finished product! After hundreds of hours of writing and tinkering, I currently have ten demos, have met with the producer, and am preparing to record this album…which is where you come in!

Why I Need Your Help

These ten demos have been years in the making and I want to give them the release they deserve, properly recorded in a state of the art studio and performed by some of Boston's most talented session musicians. 

Cost Breakdown

Recording Fees: Studio Time + Producer + Recording Engineer + Musicians  = $8,000

Post Production Fees: Mixing/Mastering + Album Artwork + Manufacturing + Donation to "Music and Youth" + Indiegogo Fees = $4,000

Recording an album is an expensive endeavor and as an independent artist, you are my record label! With this campaign, I am asking you to be directly involved with the creation of Tim Carman & The Street 45s and in turn you will receive some cool perks!

The Impact

As a kid, I was extremely lucky to have the positive force of music in my life. That is why I want to use this fundraiser to also help support music development for kids in low-income areas in Boston. Five percent of all contributions that are $100 and above will go to the "Music and Youth" initiative! Find more here: https://www.musicandyouth.org/music-and-youth-m...

Additionally,Tim Carman & The Street 45s  will highlight some of the incredible musical talent that already exists in the Boston area. For me, this is a family project.  Many songs will have guest artists on them such as Matthew Stubbs  (Charlie Musselwhite, Matthew Stubbs and the Antiguas) and Justin Lopes (Barely Dead, Matthew Stubbs and the Antiguas). As a contributor, you can help spread this Boston based musical talent to more listeners across the country and the globe!

This project has been a dream of mine for well over a decade and I have finally gathered the courage to set the project in motion. I can't express how much your support means to me!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have any money to contribute to the campaign, I appreciate you helping spread the word!! Please use the Indiegogo share tools and let friends and family know about the campaign. Every share will help!

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign and I appreciate your support. 

Thanks,

Tim

http://timcarmandrums.com/

https://www.instagram.com/tcarmandrums/

*Photos above by Gary Alpert

That is why I want to use this fundraiser to also help support music development for kids in low-income areas in Boston. Five percent of all contributions that are $100 and above will go to the "Music and Youth" initiative! Find more here: https://www.musicandyouth.org/music-and-youth-m...
Additionally,Tim Carman & The Street 45s  will highlight some of the incredible musical talent that already exists in the Boston area. For me, this is a family project.  Many songs will have guest artists on them such as Matthew Stubbs  (Charlie Musselwhite, Matthew Stubbs and the Antiguas) and Justin Lopes (Barely Dead, Matthew Stubbs and the Antiguas). As a contributor, you can help spread this Boston based musical talent to more listeners across the country and the globe!
This project has been a dream of mine for well over a decade and I have finally gathered the courage to set the project in motion. I can't express how much your support means to me!

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you don't have any money to contribute to the campaign, I appreciate you helping spread the word!! Please use the Indiegogo share tools and let friends and family know about the campaign. Every share will help!
Thank you so much for checking out my campaign and I appreciate your support. 
Thanks,
Tim
http://timcarmandrums.com/
https://www.instagram.com/tcarmandrums/
*Photos above by Gary Alpert

story:
About Our Project

Music has always had a way of touching people in the most interesting of ways. For me, at the age of 15, I will always remember the feelings that came over me while watching a live concert on TV, and it was in that moment that I found my passion for music. I knew from that moment on that I wanted others to feel the same emotions I had felt while watching that concert, and I knew I wanted to do it with the music I would one day write. We all have similar stories and passions, but music happens to be ours.

Being first generation Iranian-American, I (Ashkan) have always felt strongly that I wanted to use my creation of art & music as a means to help people. So, in our recent partnership with Preemptive Love Coalition we will be able to do that very thing as we donate 10% of all our future music sales, streams, merch sales, ticket sales and more as a means to help refugees & asylum seekers get the aid, food, shelter, and surgeries they need so that they can rebuild their lives.

Help us release this album into the wild by joining us in our debut release, and know that by helping us fulfill our dreams, in return you are also helping refugee families in Syria, and Iraq rebuild their lives.

It's been 2 years in the making and we can't wait to share it with you.

Love,

Lone Wild

 

Special Note for Early Birds (Before 50% Funding)

Everyone who gives at the $10 level or more will receive:

  • All our previous released music that is no longer available - 15 Songs Total
  • Unreleased Demos ONLY available to backers - Alternative song versions & songs that didn't make the cut
  • Early Bonus Track Releases as they come - roughly 4 tracks 

 

The Vision & Impact

  • We will be donating 10% of all income from this campaign, future music sales, future music streams, merch sales and more to help refugees through our partnership with Preemptive Love Coalition. In helping us, we will be able to fulfill our vision of being a catalyst for change in the lives of others, while providing a platform for you to do the same. Preemptive Love Coalition helps bring aid, shelter, food, life-savings surgeries and so much more to refugees & asylum seekers in Syria, Iraq, and the Middle East. Read up more on them here!
  • Also, by helping us release this new music into the world you will be helping fulfill a life-long dream of a few musicians who want to create great music.
  • We intend to continue our partnership with Preemptive Love after this success of this project by continuing to donate a minimum of 10% of all income that comes to the band from live shows, ticket sales, merch sales, music sales & streams and more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have spent a lot of time acquiring knowledge, buying studio equipment, recording at home, trading work for studio time, and by paying for the first half of this project out of our own pocket. We feel our decision to do this will set us up for success with future music releases. but we still need help!
  • We need at least $5,000 to help cover the remaining costs of recording, mixing, mastering & duplication costs of the record. This will allow us to release the new music excellently, fulfill our vision to aid our partnership with Preemptive Love (read on that above), and be able to fulfill the rewards we have decided on for you!
  • We put a ton of thought into the best ways we can reward you other than just getting a CD in the mail. So, outside of the music & t-shirts, we have some really great ways to be apart of the creative process of future productions tied to this project, like being in a music video!
  • If we don't reach out entire goal, we'll look at what has come in to see if it's still possible to fulfill rewards. In the case that we cannot fund this project in its entirety, we'll get in touch with you as soon as possible to either refund your money or see how we can reward you if you decide you'd still like to be invested in this project!

 

    Risks & Challenges

    Releasing an album into the wild can often times be very financially taxing on a band, and recording music well requires the right equipment and sometimes hiring professionals that have spent their lives crafting the sonic qualities that make recorded music sound so pleasing.

    To lower the number of costs that went into creating this new music & future music, we purchased our own studio equipment for recording what we can at home without sacrificing quality. We have spent a lot of time acquiring knowledge, recording at home, trading work for studio time, and by paying for the first half of this project out of our own pocket. We feel our decision to do this will set us up for success with future music releases

    In doing so we were able to get everything that WE could do on our own done, but now we just need your help to get the little bit that is left taken care of.

    At this time, music is valued less and less due to streaming services like Spotify, Apple Music, and Youtube. Though they are great tools with getting your music around the world and into the ears of listeners who may have otherwise not known about you, these services are infamous for paying content creators (like musicians) historically low amounts of income for their hard work, making it very hard to continue to create art & music of high quality.

    Once we've completed this fundraiser we will be able to release our new music into the wild. We'll devote our efforts to delivering our rewards and begin the process of touring these songs we've worked so hard to create!

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Sometimes you just can't give financially, but you still want to help? GREAT! Here are a few ways to do that!

    Share These Few Important Keys With Your Friends on Social Media!

    • Share what we're doing on your blog, vlog, or radio show
    • Share this campaign page & tag your friends that you think would be interested!
    • Share our mission of donating 10% of all that comes into this campaign, future music sales, future music streams and more to Preemptive Love Coalition, a non-profit providing aid, food, shelter, and life-saving surgeries to refugees in Syria & Iraq.
    • Share our weekly video updates about the success of the project with your friends & family.
    • Donate your skills or services that would help us fulfill our rewards: printing, screen printing, video making etc...

    After it's funded, Help us in these ways as we release new music: 

    • Stream our songs to build a buzz & to build revenue for us to give to Preemptive Love. Every stream produces something, even if it's a little bit, a lot of streams can add up for some major impact and allow us to continue doing what we love while helping others along the way.
    • Take Videos of you listening to the music & we'll share it on our feed!
    • Share the music on your social avenues like Instagram stories, Facebook, Twitter, & Snapchat.

story:
Pete Seeger’s image should be carved into Mount Rushmore.  That’s what Harry Belafonte once said, and he has a point.  Pete not only sang songs about our shared landscape, history, values and struggles, but he was the embodiment of the principles he sang about.  He was a mentor to thousands of musicians, activists and other citizens of Mother Earth.  Pete Seeger was the soul of American folk music and the conscience of the American ideal.

In recognition of Pete’s 100th birthday this May, 2019, I have recorded a collection of songs that profoundly impacted me over the ten years I knew Pete and the hundred or so times we met, performed together or talked on the phone.  Pete was a collector of wisdom.  His wisdom and philosophy are evident in his music and the way he lived his life.  And that is what this album will share with the world.

I didn’t know much about Pete before I met him in 2003.  But what happened the night before we met and the first two things Pete said to me made all the difference.   I will tell more about that in one of the “updates” on this site.

Now, 16 years later, having seen Pete's mission from the inside, I am touring throughout the United States and Canada sharing concerts with thousands of people who are helping to keep his tradition alive.  This new album is the next big step.  I think it will cast Pete in an even greater light than that in which many people already see him.  He was a beacon of hope and a spring of wisdom that we can continue to look to for guidance and sanity for many generations to come.

But I need your help.  It will take about $30,000 to get this CD into the hands of DJs, music media and music lover around the world.  We’ve already been in a state-of-the-art studio.  We’ve already done the graphics.  And we already have a limited number of advance copies printed and in our hands.  Most are going to DJs and music media, but some are available to you, today. 

Now, we need get the CD into the hands of DJ’s all over the U.S. and Canada; get the rest of the CDs manufactured so they can be available for sale at concerts; pay for the studio time;  pay the musicians what they deserve, and take care of other expenses.  It’s a lot to ask, but if I we can raise half of the total cost in this campaign, we will be able to celebrate one more victory and continue doing our part to keep Pete’s music and legacy alive.

Every contribution moves us closer to our goal.  And we have some wonderful gifts for everyone that helps.  It's a way to thank you and to give you a piece of this worthy project so you can say, “I helped keep the flame alive.”  Please join us in honoring and celebrating Pete Seeger, his music and his gift to us all.  Thanks you!

story:
New goal and $5,000 match!

Because of the generosity of our library sponsors, we are able to reduce the goal of our individual campaign to $15,000. Indiegogo won't let us change that, so we're updating that information here!

We also have a generous individual donor who has pledged a $5,000 match to get us to our goal. That means we're actually 50% there!!! Please support this project today (or share with your friends who might want an awesome anthology on their iPad or their bookshelf!).

Who are we?

Dave Berger and Chuck Israels arranged the Anthology. Dave was the founding conductor and arranger for Jazz at Lincoln Center. Chuck is a famed bassist, member of the Bill Evans Trio, and founder of the first jazz repertory orchestra. These experts curated and arranged the over 350 tunes in the Anthology.

This project aims to celebrate the public domain and the rich history of American song. While crowd funding for sound recording projects is nothing new, this is the first peer-reviewed song anthology to ask for your support so that it can be made freely available on release. Forever. For everyone. Dave and Chuck as the arrangers are donating their new harmonizations and all other new content in the Anthology to the public domain with a CC-0 license so that teachers, students, and musicians can freely reuse, modify, and share anything in the Anthology.

This is the first musical score in the Music Library Association Open Edition Series. It will be published by Aperio, the University of Virginia Library open press, in collaboration with the Peabody Institute of the Johns Hopkins University and the University of Michigan Library.

The publication team includes music library and copyright experts: Brandon Butler (UVA), Paul Cary (Baldwin-Wallace), Kathleen DeLaurenti (Peabody Institute), Dave Ghamandi (UVA), Melissa Levine (University of Michigan), and Matthew Vest (UCLA) with special support from Robert Schwartz of D.C. law firm Constantine | Cannon and Shebam Productions LLC.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This project is different from your typical songbook. Rather than sell copies to recoup costs for printing and royalties, we're hoping you'll help us fund those costs up-front so that we can make the Anthology freely available, including the software notation pages, to everyone!

  • The majority of funds raised will cover the arrangers' fees for David Berger and Chuck Israels for researching, arranging, and providing classic and suggested harmonizations for each of the 373 tunes in the anthology. By agreeing to dedicate their work to the public domain, Dave and Chuck are surrendering any chance to earn royalties from this release, and we want to fairly compensate our arrangers for their research and expertise;
  • Print costs to produce a physical copy for individual and library backers;
  • Publishing costs for copy editing and hosting files online with Aperio;
  • Any costs associated with other backer rewards.

The physical copy of the edition produced by the publishers will be limited to backers of this campaign at the $100 level. But we know that digital provides musicians with the most flexibility: printing single tunes on demand, adding them to your iPad score library, and editing, transposing, arranging, or adapting them with notation software. The digital edition will include:

  • A PDF that is MusicXML encoded that can be imported into the score reader or music notation software of your choice to be arranged or adapted in any way you like!
  • A Sibelius source file for Sibelius users to easily edit and arrange that is also compatible with NVDA screen readers
  • All of the songs and introductions in the print edition
  • Additional on-line lyrics for some songs.

Any additional funds raised will support:

  • A possible expansion of the Anthology to include the many songs new to the public domain, next Jan. 1, from 1924
  • New publications from MLA Open Editions.

The Impact

Popular song is one of the great treasures of America’s cultural heritage. Songs like Oh! How I Hate To Get Up In The Morning, Tiger Rag and Deep River are part of the fabric of American life. By preserving these and other essential American songs in usable versions, the Public Domain Song Anthology will benefit music teachers, students, performers, and music lovers.

The International Music Score Library Project has demonstrated the value of freely available public domain music. Other musical score-focused campaigns have attempted to bring as many as 100 scores to new, free editions. This project will bring over 350 songs from early folk, spiritual, jazz, and popular American song to the world.

We also know that purchasing music can be a barrier to learning, and too often teachers and students don't have the funding they need to acquire music for private lessons. By releasing this anthology without any claimed copyright restrictions from our arrangers, these 373 songs belong to everyone for learning, playing, and enjoying.

Finally, because these songs are completely free of copyright, they can be performed, adapted, arranged and recorded without a license.  Performers relying on this songbook can assure venues that there is no need to purchase a blanket license from the major performing rights organizations.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our project team is a group of professional musicians and academics. We are passionate about the impact that freely available music, formatted for accessibility, can have on the lives of music students and teachers.

Funding this project is a challenge. Many academic publishers will consider making a book openly available if the cost is covered - in the range of $15,000 for a single book. Music as scholarship isn't usually funded by libraries this way, and while we do have some library support, this project is about funding 373 individual works, not one academic book. The biggest risk to our project is that our arrangers will complete their work, and there will not be enough funding to cover their costs.

 

Can't Donate? Help us Spread the Word!

Funding this project is important, but we also want your help getting the word out to musicians and teachers everywhere about this amazing new resource! Your help sharing our project in your community is priceless!

story:
Hi! We’re Modern Day Cure, a worship band based in Nashville, TN and our heart is to exalt Jesus, share His truth, and see people changed by His power. In the past two years we’ve experienced a lot of change. As life-long residents of Michigan, we felt God leading us to move to Nashville. We obeyed his voice and recently had our first child, Brave! During this time, God has shown us that He is constant in the unknown. He’s also given us new songs to share in this season and we’re excited to release the first single this fall! With the help of our friends, family, and supporters, our goal is to raise $5,000 to complete this first phase of the project.  It’s our hope that this single will encourage hearts and serve as a reminder that God is constant, faithful, and can be trusted. 

It's true -- recording and marketing quality music can be expensive, but our heart is to properly represent the song that God has given us.  Our $5,000 goal will help cover costs associated with production, mixing, mastering, digital distribution, artwork, targeted song marketing, and video production.  

To show our appreciation, every person who donates will receive a perk. Perks range from social media shout outs, dinner with the band, and a full-band night of worship for your event or church. We want to thank you in advance for your support! No amount is too small, but even if you can’t contribute monetarily at the moment, there’s still two tangible ways to help us reach our goal. First, pray. We believe in the power of prayer. Will you pray that we meet our goal and the music we release impacts hearts and lives? Second, share, share, share! We want to get the word out about our campaign to as many people as possible. Raising awareness helps us reach our goal. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools! Will you help us email, text, and share to social media?

Thank you for joining us on our journey to record new music! We can’t wait to share our new single with you! 

Aaron & Tamar | Modern Day Cure

www.moderndaycure.com

https://instagram.com/moderndaycure

https://facebook.com/moderndaycure
story_txt: Hi! We’re Modern Day Cure, a worship band based in Nashville, TN and our heart is to exalt Jesus, share His truth, and see people changed by His power. In the past two years we’ve experienced a lot of change. As life-long residents of Michigan, we felt God leading us to move to Nashville. We obeyed his voice and recently had our first child, Brave! During this time, God has shown us that He is constant in the unknown. He’s also given us new songs to share in this season and we’re excited to release the first single this fall! With the help of our friends, family, and supporters, our goal is to raise $5,000 to complete this first phase of the project.  It’s our hope that this single will encourage hearts and serve as a reminder that God is constant, faithful, and can be trusted. It's true -- recording and marketing quality music can be expensive, but our heart is to properly represent the song that God has given us.  Our $5,000 goal will help cover costs associated with production, mixing, mastering, digital distribution, artwork, targeted song marketing, and video production.  To show our appreciation, every person who donates will receive a perk. Perks range from social media shout outs, dinner with the band, and a full-band night of worship for your event or church. We want to thank you in advance for your support! No amount is too small, but even if you can’t contribute monetarily at the moment, there’s still two tangible ways to help us reach our goal. First, pray. We believe in the power of prayer. Will you pray that we meet our goal and the music we release impacts hearts and lives? Second, share, share, share! We want to get the word out about our campaign to as many people as possible. Raising awareness helps us reach our goal. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools! Will you help us email, text, and share to social media?Thank you for joining us on our journey to record new music! We can’t wait to share our new single with you! Aaron & Tamar | Modern Day Curewww.moderndaycure.comhttps://instagram.com/moderndaycurehttps://facebook.com/moderndaycure

story:
Hey everyone! My name is Sam Graham from Boston and I'm finally recording my debut EP of original music. 

I started my song-writing journey 4 years ago on the heels of my New England Conservatory education (the first time). After jumping from department to department, genre to genre, writing my own music was the first time I finally felt like I knew where I wanted to be as an artist. It was also an amazing coping mechanism when dealing with my first major heartbreak and first existential crisis. This collection of songs will bring the listener from the loss to new love that I've found.

The project is underway, but we still need your help reaching the finish line!

 

This campaign is to raise the rest of the funds I need to finish my professionally recorded EP with producer Alex Yen, a graduate of Berklee's Production and Engineering Master's Program. Together we are breathing new life into my music and shaping my own arrangements to bring out the best for the project.

So far, we've begun recording and finished the rhythm section session. They sound amazing! While I've managed to begin the process through my own means, the cost of recording adds up quickly and I need YOUR help to finish. Your donations will help fund the following:

  • PRE-PRODUCTION: Magic happens before we even hit the studio. Pre-production covers rehearsals with musicians and producers to make sure everything sounds amazing and is ready for recording. This is where all the new and exciting ideas in the process come from.

 

  • RECORDING: We've already finished one piece of the puzzle, but still need to record horns, strings and vocals for the finished product. Studio time and engineering costs are the bulk of the budget and where most of your donations will go.

 

  • MIXING & MASTERING: Once we have all the parts recorded, it's time to put them all together and begin the long process of making a finished product. We "mix" the levels of each instrument so that each one shines through. Mastering is the process where we take a step back and look at the whole product from beginning to end and make the sound as cohesive as possible.

 

  • LICENSING AND DISTRIBUTION: This registers my music under copyright and gets the music ready for online and physical distribution.

 

  • ARTISTIC COLLABORATORS: Producing the product goes beyond just the music. This covers principal photography as well as graphic designers who helped with merchandise and logos.

 

  • THE VIDEO: Pushing my artistry as far as possible, if I reach my goal of $5000, I will direct and produce a music video for my lead single "Humming Song". In a digital age where most media is consumed visually, this video will help tremendously in expanding the reach of my project to a larger audience.

 

DON'T THINK YOU'RE LEAVING HERE EMPTY HANDED!

Perks for the project include:

  • Pins
  • Stickers
  • T-Shirts
  • Comp Tickets
  • Custom Cover Songs
  • Private Live Performances

***Every donation of $25 or more will receive a personalized postcard with a handwritten thank you from Sam. Donations of $10 or less will receive an emailed thank you.***

(My mother will be so proud. We take Thank-You letters very seriously...)

 

It might be "on-brand" for me to cry and whine about this project...

...but your contribution would truly change my life. I've struggled a lot as a musician and whether I'm "good" enough to live up to the reputation of my school and my peers. I've also struggled with romance and put too much of my self-worth into how someone else sees me. This music is very personal to me and reflects a lot of my own demons, but also the joy and love I've found in myself and around me. I finally feel like I'm worth it. Working on this project has not only shown me how capable I am, but who I am as an artist. I hope that my story and music can help someone else feel the same way.

 

I'm a good horse to bet on having already won two competitive grants while at New England Conservatory: The $500 “Spark” Grant Award to launch this album, as well as NEC’s $1,500 "Entrepreneurial Musician Grant" to direct, produce and star in a same-sex rendition of Jason Robert Brown’s “The Last 5 Years”, benefitting the local Boston nonprofit BAGLY to support LGBTQ+ youths.

 

If you're ready to donate, head to the "BACK IT" button at the top right. Anything you can contribute will get me one step closer to my goal!

If you want to help more, PLEASE share this campaign on your social media with the share buttons on the page. 

Thank you so much for checking out my IndieGoGo. I'm so excited to share this with you!

story:
Welcome!

We are Very Sorry and this is our campaign to raise money so that we can record a brand new album in a studio. It is our personal goal to create music inspired by our own honesty and humor. We hope you'll consider donating.

The money we receive from this campaign will go towards paying for a week of studio time, during which we will record our new songs. Your donation gives support to our songwriting and friendly collaboration. In addition, we have a handful of donation perks that we thought might be fun, so make sure to check those out!

We plan to release our new album by the end of summer on Bandcamp and Spotify. For updates on projects join our mailing list! http://eepurl.com/gmKPv5

story:
Welcome Friends—Old and New!

If you're reading this, you probably already know my work and reputation for invention and integrity. If not, I hope you'll get to know me and my music. And join in bringing the Coyote Motel to life in 2018!

Over the decades I’ve earned an international reputation as an original, hard-working musician and entertainer, and respected and award-winning journalist, historian, educator and advocate. I have devoted my life to celebrating great American roots music and building a bridge from it's past to the present and the future. I believe the album I've just started making, called Coyote Motel, is the next step forward, capturing a more mature and expressive vision. I truly want to spread joy and inspire with the Coyote Motel.

But to do that, I need to complete it and get it out into the world. First, I need to record the bulk of the album. Then it needs the three M's: mixing, mastering and manufacturing! With your support, I can bring the very best of the songs I've been writing over the past three years to life. 

So … I'm offering little and big "perks" for your sharing at different levels, from an executive producer credit on the project (which would cover the entire cost of mixing the album) to pre-release autographed copies of the finished CD and even advance MP3s. There are also some one-only guitar gear offers, of items culled from my personal collection, and Skype guitar lessons. And at every level of giving, there will be music for you. I’m also happy to tailor a package of rewards specifically for you.

Every penny of the $5,500 needed to fulfill this mission will be used to make the album and take it to the world. And if we exceed our goal, we can think about some extras, like vinyl and T-shirts and more tour dates that will bring us closer to you. If you can’t afford to contribute, please help me get the word out. Share my campaign on Facebook and Twitter, tell your friends, call folks who’d want to participate. Our goal is to make great music that makes everybody who chooses to support Coyote Motel proud that they did! Thank you very much for reading this!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Denarii Grace. I'm a blues singer-songwriter, poet, freelance writer and editor, aspiring screenwriter, public speaker/educator, and long time activist. I'm a brown-skinned, Black, bisexual, multiply disabled, proudly fat, poor, femme woman.

When I was a little girl, before elementary school, I always used to tell people that I wanted to be a singer. At around 11 or 12, I knew that my stage name would be "Denarii Grace" - my first and middle names. I even had what I thought was a fancy way of signing autographs: print text my first name and the "g" and "r" of my middle name, then write "ace" in cursive - because some how calling myself an "ace" was cool - don't ask.

Somewhere along the way, I gave up that dream. As far as I was concerned, that was all it was - a dream. I grew up poor and I needed to pick a practical, stable, secure career path. So I gave up the thought of living life as an artist and opted to attend college to major in English, with the intention of becoming a high school English teacher (which, for the record, I also really wanted to do). In addition, as I got older, I began to doubt my musical gifts. I started comparing my vocal ability to others and feeling inadequate. Those fears stopped me - for a LONG time.

But I believe that this is what I've been called to do, life has lead me right back to where I once lived - in music, in the arts - and I plan to stay here, with your help and support.

I've been through a lot - experienced a lot, felt a lot, grown a lot, learned and unlearned a lot - and it shows through the work that I create. And I want to share those experiences, those hopes, those dreams, those beautiful, painful, joyful, empowering words, with as many people as possible. And you can help me get there.

What I Need & What You Get

Initially, when I decided I'd start a crowdfunding campaign, my goal was going to be $5,000. But then I thought it'd probably be best to really think about what I'll need to get done and who will need to be paid so that I don't underestimate how much I'll need to raise.

There is a lot that goes into making a record, whether it's an EP or a full album - especially one's IDEAL record. Like many artists, I'm a perfectionist - I want to work with good quality studios and engineers, good quality indie musicians, good quality EVERYTHING. At the end of the day, the work I put out reflects on ME. And doing that costs money.

So here's a rough breakdown of what the money I raise will go to, and how I got to a whopping goal of $25,000 (note that that figure factors in the fees that IndieGogo and the payout company charge me). I'm still working out the kinks and, again, some  of these numbers are guesstimates based on past experience but:

$2000 - studio time, including Lyft* transportation to and from studio

$500 - rough estimate to copyright the seven original works that will appear on “POWER” EP via Legal Zoom

$1485 - Txlips quoted fee for recording three of the seven songs with me (includes cost of recording at ATL studio, where they're based)

$X - [unnamed indie rapper] fee for recording

$6,000 - total for all other session musician/background singer fees

$500 - professional mixing costs

$200 - get CDs pressed and made (yes there will be physical copies, not just digital yay!)

 

$250 - roundtrip flight to ATL to record with Txlips

$600 - 5 day/4 night stay in ATL

$150 - ATL transportation (Lyft*)

 

$500 to $1,000 - photographer fee for “POWER” EP cover photoshoot at Jones Beach

$10 - roundtrip public transit travel to Jones Beach

 

$400 - roundtrip flight to Bay area to record with [unnamed indie rapper]

$750 - 5 day/4 night stay at Courtyard Marriot Oakland Emeryville

$250 - Oakland transportation (Lyft)

 

$5,000 - promo/ad costs

Those are the basics, plus, since I don't have a "traditional" job, I'll also need funds to...yanno, eat and pay bills and take care of my pets during this process. In addition, I wanted a buffer since I don't yet know how much the rapper will charge AND, at the end of the day, I'm new to this process and there may be steps that I'm missing or I may be underestimating the costs of some pieces to this puzzle. Between that and factoring in the IndieGogo fees, that's how I came to the $25,000 goal.

I believe that artists deserve to be compensated FAIRLY for our work, so I took into consideration things like industry standards for session musician rates as well as talking to/knowing people who work in these professions and what their general rates are in order to roughly calculate how much things will cost. In addition, I based things like hotel and flight costs on my past experiences (I fly Delta).

I'm not really sure what you'll get. I have a Patreon and I've found that trying to create "reward levels" that make sense and also aren't super taxing when I already have a lot of work to do (the above is just the tip of the iceberg) is hard for me. So, if possible, I'd rather hear what YOU'D like to see. I can certainly do behind-the-scenes and "first listen" stuff, but beyond that, I have no earthly idea of what I'm doing, LOL, so please help with that.

My hope is that, more than anything, folks just want to support a proudly fat, Black, multiply disabled, poor, bisexual, femme woman trying to bring something at once both different and familiar to the scene, just trying to make good, powerful, empowering music. My hope is that people care enough about those of us who are less likely to make it in this industry that you'll do what you can to help make my dream come true. And the best part is, because I believe in compensating artists fairly, your contribution would not only help ME, but by extension will also help other multiply marginalized artists with whom I plan to work to get paid so THEY in turn can eat, add to their resumes, and in turn continue with their dreams.

* I am physically disabled with chronic pain and I find that sometimes it's easier for me to travel via Lyft instead of taking public transit, which is usually cheaper (especially with longer distances). I will take public transit when I'm capable of doing so, but it's not always possible, especially in places I'm not familiar with, so I factor that higher cost into my calculations.

The Impact

In addition to the above, one of the most important impacts - for me - is based on what I've already experienced. Whether it's my poetry, my workshops, my public speaking, or - now - my music, my entire life (but increasingly these days) has been filled with comments from folks talking about how my work has affected their lives for the better. It's mindblowing and humbling and powerful and moving to have people come up to you and ask for an autograph - little old "nobody" me - and all I want is to increase that impact, to help folks unlearn, as I have, to help heal, to empower my communities, and to give people strength and love.

And because I don't come from money, because I'm a full-time artist, I don't have the money to do it on my own. So I need to connect with folks who share my values, who want to see more diversity (of both artists and the art that we make) in music, in the hopes that our shared values will move you to contribute. Even if you can't afford to give at the time that you stumble upon this, you can still share the SHIT out of this campaign.

Hey, for all you know, the work I create might just influence and inspire YOU.

story:
The stars aligned in late November — thanks to the 2016 Kickstarter campaign! We spent three days tracking in Ithaca N.Y. at Pyramid Studios and put down the majority of the tracks for the new album.

  The players consisted of Sebastian Steinberg  (Fiona Apple, Soul Coughing). Sebastian was fresh off of a tour with Iron and Wine . Greg Evans  (Ithaca College percussion professor and awe-inspiring musician). Friend and Producer Craig Street   (Nora Jones, Joe Henry, Holmes Brothers),whom I have been cultivating this album with for a couple of years now. Willie Watson (Old Crow Medicine show, Gillian Welch & David Rawlings) put down some vocals and we hope to have him back for the next session. With luck my friend  Tyler Ramsey will be joining us as well.

Here is a very  rough track of the song "The Split"  with Willie Watson on duet vocals. This might give you a hint at what to expect. http://www.jennielowestearns.com

The experience in the studio has exceeded my expectations. This is my fifth studio album and it has proven to be the most exciting and rewarding production time thus far! I am now launching the final crowd funding campaign through Indigogo with anticipation that  we can complete tracking of the  album in early March 2018! I cannot continue this inspired process without your help.
story_txt:
The stars aligned in late November — thanks to the 2016 Kickstarter campaign! We spent three days tracking in Ithaca N.Y. at Pyramid Studios and put down the majority of the tracks for the new album.
  The players consisted of Sebastian Steinberg  (Fiona Apple, Soul Coughing). Sebastian was fresh off of a tour with Iron and Wine . Greg Evans  (Ithaca College percussion professor and awe-inspiring musician). Friend and Producer Craig Street   (Nora Jones, Joe Henry, Holmes Brothers),whom I have been cultivating this album with for a couple of years now. Willie Watson (Old Crow Medicine show, Gillian Welch & David Rawlings) put down some vocals and we hope to have him back for the next session. With luck my friend  Tyler Ramsey will be joining us as well.
Here is a very  rough track of the song "The Split"  with Willie Watson on duet vocals. This might give you a hint at what to expect. http://www.jennielowestearns.com
The experience in the studio has exceeded my expectations. This is my fifth studio album and it has proven to be the most exciting and rewarding production time thus far! I am now launching the final crowd funding campaign through Indigogo with anticipation that  we can complete tracking of the  album in early March 2018! I cannot continue this inspired process without your help.

story:
God Still Has Soldiers

A soldier is someone who eagerly desires to be the hands and feet of Jesus. A soldier desires to see communities filled with hope, schools revamped with an everlasting truth, and cities unified. With everything that's taken place in our world, the need for soldiers is greater than it's ever been. Our generation needs young world-changers, impacters, and difference makers. Our heartbeat is to be leaders of that movement.

We launched Bold Records in 2014 with a passion for people and a love for Jesus. After assembling a small team, we traveled from state to state proclaiming truth through music and we witnessed God do immeasurably more. 

Our organization has grown and so has our needs. With your help we are able to continue to create and distribute high quality resources, hire extra help to facilitate and execute campaigns, fund outreach opportunities, tours, and album releases. 

We are excited to continue in our mission of taking the message of hope to new cities and states all throughout the nation. We are passionate about engaging youth. Engaged youth take action. Help us continue to reach this generation.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Without God everything else is meaningless, therefore:

Pray that God works through this process, and that His grace covers us as we move forward to taking the necessary steps towards reaching His people.
