story:
Hi there!  
Thank you so much for stopping by. I have a lot to fill you in on, but it’ll only take a few minutes. 
As a little girl, it was so often that I would make up little tunes that would grow into massive works of art in my own little head. As I grew, I honed my skill as a creative musician. 
While in my undergrad program at Oklahoma Baptist University, along with a handful of other projects, I settled nicely into Massey, a six piece folk-rock band that encouraged my own maturity in song writing and  overall musicianship. Even though I was prolifically writing for Massey, I had a completely separate collection of songs that  I would sing solo, but only in my apartment or for my family and special gatherings. 

Only a few years ago, I started to feel that it is important for my growth as a musician to document those works that have accumulated over the years. As I share my narrative and that of my family with you, I do so humbly and gratefully as you are the folks that will make this project a documented mile marker. 

BREAKDOWN 
So, you’re probably wondering, “How much will this cost?”
Well, my goal is to raise $16000 in 60 days. This amount will cover media + marketing of the finished product; studio time; mixing; mastering; duplication (CD + Vinyl); travel necessities; and incentive fulfillment. 
If you choose to support this life-changing project of mine, there are some amazing incentives that you are eligible for (see incentive list)- all of which I chose with you in mind! 
If my goal is not reached, the funds raised will still be used to record and distribute a smaller work  to those who supported the campaign. 

THE IMPACT
I am among so many talented creatives in my community. It truly blows me away when I think about it. Being inspired and encouraged by many of those creatives, I find myself with my guitar in hand or at the keyboard, scribbling down my thoughts as quickly as they come. 
 I must say,  I get so much joy from singing, performing, and songwriting. But my songs are not just for me. They are for my children. For my grandchildren. They’re for you and your children. For my community. 
While I have had and continue to have great success as one of the lead vocalists/violist in my folk-rock band, Massey,  now is my  time to grow a little deeper. 

RISKS
Just like with any creative project, there is always potential for bumps in the road. Because I have committed to working hard to see this project through, I will approach any unforeseen obstacles with patience. 

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT
I realize that monetary support may not be feasible for everyone, so I will suggest that sharing this page or any of my previously posted videos on social media are wonderful ways to support my project.

story:
Our Story

Hello folks! Thanks so much for taking the time and caring enough about us to check this out.  For those who don't know us well, we are a band based in Victoria BC, and play our own blend of rootsy, folkloric dance music... a world of earthy, danceable influences filtered through Cascadian eyes and ears. Compassion Gorilla was birthed in 2008 and has honed its sound through years of evolving membership and diverse collaborations... close to 15 musicians have played an important role in shaping the base from which the band now operates. 

Over the past three years the band has been digging deeper as a 5-piece ensemble to consolidate diverse influences: recent Argentinian collaborations of trombonist Daniel Cryderman, the Brazilian percussion expertise of drummer Dan Beer, the band’s experience touring Mexico in 2013, the Balkan horn influences heard on previous releases, and the folk and rock sensibilities to be expected of a Canadian band born of acoustic origins. Our task over these years has been to develop a concise vision of our musical offering, and that is now what we are now bringing to the recording studio.

 

The New Recording

We began this recording in the fall of 2016, first testing our production process with the single song you see above: "Apocalypse Never".  The intention was to establish the method by which the rest of the album would be produced, and to arrive at a sound that was simple, warm, and that maintained a folkloric feel.  We're sure that we've hit the nail on the head here, and have been following through with the rest of the songs via the same process.  

The team working on this recording includes local Victoria mix engineer Michael Hall, Vancouver-based mastering engineer Kevin Kowal, Mayne Island-based visual artist Leya Tess, and CG's Chris Fretwell taking on the recording and production.  In addition to the band's core lineup, some amazing guest musicians are gracing us with their sounds on this recording, including Mob Bounce (hip-hop duo), Marley Daemon (accordion) and Suzanne Stirling (trumpet), and a bumpin' remix of "Apocalypse Never" from Rio-based producer Maga Bo!

 

What We Are Asking

We're asking for support to help us with some of the costs of completing this project, and we have lots to offer in return, including downloads, physical copies of the finished project, t-shirts, and performances.  Check out the column on the right for the details on all the perks!

The funds we raise through this campaign will go toward:

  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Artwork
  • Manufacturing

Whether or not you're able to pitch-in financially, you can help us by sharing this with folks who you think would be interested in the music we're making.  There are options embedded on this page for easy sharing to social media, or you can copy and paste the url address.

Thank you!!!

story:
Hello and Welcome! Salut et Bienvenue!

"Amirault [...] can burn or croon as needed." Peter Hum, Ottawa Citizen.

My name is Steve Amirault. I am a pianist/vocalist/composer. I've been a professional musician for about 30 years. I'm asking for your help to produce my next recording, "Hold on, Let go."  

"Hold on, let go" is about transitions, taking risks, moving on but remembering where you came from. This will be my first Solo CD.  For the past few years I've been playing a lot of solo shows, including a 5 month contract in Japan, and a regular night at the Royal York Hotel here in Toronto. I'm really excited to get into the studio, document my new music and share it with you.  I'll record some originals and some standards (piano and piano/voice).  

What I need & Where it goes.

I need to raise $10, 000 for - Studio fees: Recording, editing, mastering, piano tuning. CD Production: Manufacturing, Art design, Photography.  Promotion: Hiring a publicist to promote the CD, and some promo video. Mechanicals: Recording Rights for Standards (non originals) 

Toronto - Hold on, Let go.

Just under 2 years ago I packed up and left Montreal (my home for 25 years) and moved to Toronto. I love it here, I find the city and the music community very welcoming and inspiring. It certainly wasn't easy to leave my friends and family, but I knew it was time for a change. So far I've been focused on getting established and making a living in my new city, and now it's time to record my new music! 

Challenges.

As we all know, more and more musicians are using crowdfunding. It's a great way to get the music directly to the people that want it. This is the only way this recording is going to happen. This will be my 6th CD, and my first solo recording.  I have funded a few of my albums in the past,  but unfortunately I'm not in a position to do that now.  That's why I need your help!

Contribute/Share/Text/Yell/Pass Notes in Class. 

You can also help by sharing with your social network. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!  THANK YOU! STEVE

Music in the video. Hold on, Let go, and Je vois Clemente danser. From One Existence.

story:
Hi, we are Red Convertible Recording (producers/engineers, Ricky Berotti and Kieran O'Leary), and we have recently taken over the original Studio G in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We're so excited to bring fresh creativity and mind-bending sonics to musicians and listeners alike, but in order to do that, we need to revitalize the space and return the studio to its original glory and then some!

The original Studio G, founded by Tony Maimone and Joel Hamilton, is rich with musical history and significance.  From its early days, the studio has seen iconic artists and bands including, The Black Keys, Mos Def, Jim Jones, Q-Tip, Sparklehorse, and Black Francis from The Pixies. Our mission is to revive the space and restore it to its former preeminence. We’re asking for your support in raising $20,000 to both enliven the studio and build a space for artists to grow and create.  

To give you a little background, we began producing bands in 2016 in a tiny cement box studio on Meserole Street in Brooklyn. We worked full time jobs tirelessly in order to fund our musical careers and afford all of the essential gear that we used to record our own music and others. Ten-hour workdays followed by six-hour recording sessions became the staple of our existence for years and allowed us to share our creativity with those who worked with us. However, now that our early twenties have come and gone, we feel it is time to devote our entire lives to what we’re most passionate about.

Running a studio is no joke. Luckily, we have taken the advice of those who have come before us and want to ensure we have enough operating capital, gear, and experience to become one of Brooklyn’s hippest and most sought after studios.

Our dedication to recording and mixing is like no other.  As musicians, currently creating work in our own band, The Post Nobles, we know what it’s like to have a less than stellar studio experience.  We also know what it’s like to have an obsessive drive to make music that feels absolutely perfect.  Considering the sheer volume of new music being released, we know it’s not easy to stand out in the crowd.  Our mission is to create sounds and sonic landscapes that no one has ever heard before and to give our clients the attention to detail and professional experience that they wouldn’t necessarily receive in a larger scale environment. If the artist isn’t happy with how their song sounds, then neither are we. We will continue to work with an artist until their vision is met; nothing less will come from RCR.

In order to provide this kind of experience for musicians, we need to revamp the original Studio G and breathe new life into the space. Our goal is to offer artists a unique experience without the high price tag of typical NYC studios. Though our space is almost complete with an incredible live room, control room, echo chamber, and amp booth, we are looking to renovate the majority of the control room, build a vocal booth, and procure more gear to ensure that nothing is more than a chair-swivel away! In order to accomplish this, we need YOUR help!

Donating to our campaign will allow you to buy exclusive merch, give you access to live acoustic concerts from some of Brooklyn’s hottest bands, half priced studio days, and other sweet perks that you will love! What’s more important though, is that your donation will be a stepping-stone in providing a space in which creative energy can build on itself. Artists who may not ordinarily have the opportunity will be able to thrive in our studio, a space in which they have the freedom to completely express themselves and grow creatively.

story:
My Story

Time flies! I've been in Nashville for nearly two years now and I've written a ton of new songs that I'm excited to share with you. However, professional studios are expensive and I need YOUR help to successfully release my new single, "The River." This catchy tune is one of my favorites and I'm really excited to get it into your hands!

My Plan

My band will record this roots-rock tune at the very cool Welcome to 1979 recording studio known for it's vintage vibe and gear. My publicist will also roll out an extensive promo campaign to make sure The River is heard by a broad audience.

My Campaign:

I'm funding a chunk of the production cost myself. However, there are a ton of expenses other than just recording and they add up quick. I need your help pulling together $3,500 to get a completed product to you this spring.

Target = $3,500 for studio rental, engineering team, final mixing and mastering

Your generosity for helping me complete this project will be rewarded with exclusive perks and packages! The more you donate, the cooler your rewards. 

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best way to help me other than a donation is to share this crowdfunding campaign with others. Simply copy and paste this LINK to all your social media accounts, text the LINK to your friends and family, and/or email the campaign LINK to everyone who loves music and might spare a dime for a young artist. Help me get the word out. No act of kindness is too small. Remember to use the IndieGoGo share tools, and spread the word!

My Heartfelt Thanks

If you can contribute to this campaign, I thank you from the bottom of my heart. If not, I fully understand, but please spread the word to friends, coworkers, 3rd cousins, remote acquaintances and family pets. I was overwhelmed by the support I received for my 2017 crowdfunding campaign and can only hope for this one to be as successful.

story:
Overview

 

  • Tambores del Pueblo is a Puerto Rican folkloric music ensemble based in Austin, TX. Its members come from diverse backgrounds but all have strong ties to the island. Playing together consistently for the past year, Tambores del Pueblo has developed a large repertoire of bombas, plenas, seises, and aguinaldos, and it is now time to record some of that material. The goal is to record an EP of 5 original songs in order to get our music out to the world. The funds raised from this campaign will go directly to the costs of producing a professional quality recording.  Although Tambores del Pueblo is rooted in traditions, the group is also hoping to push this music forward into the 21st century.  
  • Please check out more of our videos and content on our social media pages:

Facebook: Tambores del Pueblo (https://www.facebook.com/groups/257750334972689/)

Instagram: tamboresdelpuebloatx (https://www.instagram.com/tamboresdelpuebloatx/?hl=en)

 

About Puerto Rican music

You may ask, what is bomba?

  • Bomba is an Afro-Puerto Rican style of dance music that originated in areas along the coast. It is characterized by the interplay between vocalists, percussionists, and dancers. The ensemble consists of 2+ large barrel drums (known as barriles), the cuá (a special type of barril that is played on the shell of the drum with sticks), and a large maraca. There are several rhythms found in bomba music including the sicá, yubá, and holandés.

What is plena?

  • Plena is another Afro-Puerto Rican style that developed initially in Ponce over a century ago. Plena is typically played with panderetas (frame drums), güiro, and possibly cuatro, guitar, and/or bass.

Seis and aguinaldo?

  • Seises and aguinaldos form the core of the música jibara or música típica repertoire. This music comes from the mountains of Puerto Rico and is associated with Christmas, even though it is played all year round. Each town in Puerto Rico is said to have its own version style of seis or aguinaldo (i.e. seis bayamonés, aguinaldo orocoveño). The ensemble often includes cuatros, guitars, and güiro.

 

Tambores del Pueblo:

Wilfredo Burgos Matos: vocals, maraca, güiro

Karolina Arocho: vocals, güiro, bomba dancer

Adam Rosario: barril primero, pandereta, cuatro, guitar

Alejandro Cotto: barril segundo, pandereta, vocals

John Bimbiras: cuá, cuatro, guitar, bass

 

What We Need 

  • We asking for funds in the amount of $1500 to produce a professional quality EP recording of 5 original songs. We plan to record 3 bombas, 1 plena, and 1 seis or aguinaldo.
  • The money will go to production costs, including a full day in the recording studio, mixing and mastering, and shooting a video of the session. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still try to record a demo but with perhaps fewer songs. 

 

What You Get

  • All of those who donate will receive mp3 downloads of the 5 songs online! 
  • Songs can be made available through various platforms

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's OK! You can really support by:

  • Sharing this campaign across your social media networks - tell your friends about me!
  • Retweet or share messages we post about it too!
  • Listen to our music, and if you like it, let other people know!!

 

Thank you so much for your time and interest! And we hope you enjoy our music.

Sincerely,

Tambores del Pueblo
story_txt:
Overview
 

Tambores del Pueblo is a Puerto Rican folkloric music ensemble based in Austin, TX. Its members come from diverse backgrounds but all have strong ties to the island. Playing together consistently for the past year, Tambores del Pueblo has developed a large repertoire of bombas, plenas, seises, and aguinaldos, and it is now time to record some of that material. The goal is to record an EP of 5 original songs in order to get our music out to the world. The funds raised from this campaign will go directly to the costs of producing a professional quality recording.  Although Tambores del Pueblo is rooted in traditions, the group is also hoping to push this music forward into the 21st century.  
Please check out more of our videos and content on our social media pages:

Facebook: Tambores del Pueblo (https://www.facebook.com/groups/257750334972689/)
Instagram: tamboresdelpuebloatx (https://www.instagram.com/tamboresdelpuebloatx/?hl=en)
 
About Puerto Rican music
You may ask, what is bomba?
Bomba is an Afro-Puerto Rican style of dance music that originated in areas along the coast. It is characterized by the interplay between vocalists, percussionists, and dancers. The ensemble consists of 2+ large barrel drums (known as barriles), the cuá (a special type of barril that is played on the shell of the drum with sticks), and a large maraca. There are several rhythms found in bomba music including the sicá, yubá, and holandés.
What is plena?
Plena is another Afro-Puerto Rican style that developed initially in Ponce over a century ago. Plena is typically played with panderetas (frame drums), güiro, and possibly cuatro, guitar, and/or bass.
Seis and aguinaldo?
Seises and aguinaldos form the core of the música jibara or música típica repertoire. This music comes from the mountains of Puerto Rico and is associated with Christmas, even though it is played all year round. Each town in Puerto Rico is said to have its own version style of seis or aguinaldo (i.e. seis bayamonés, aguinaldo orocoveño). The ensemble often includes cuatros, guitars, and güiro.
 
Tambores del Pueblo:
Wilfredo Burgos Matos: vocals, maraca, güiro
Karolina Arocho: vocals, güiro, bomba dancer
Adam Rosario: barril primero, pandereta, cuatro, guitar
Alejandro Cotto: barril segundo, pandereta, vocals
John Bimbiras: cuá, cuatro, guitar, bass
 

What We Need 


We asking for funds in the amount of $1500 to produce a professional quality EP recording of 5 original songs. We plan to record 3 bombas, 1 plena, and 1 seis or aguinaldo.
The money will go to production costs, including a full day in the recording studio, mixing and mastering, and shooting a video of the session. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still try to record a demo but with perhaps fewer songs. 

 
What You Get

All of those who donate will receive mp3 downloads of the 5 songs online! 
Songs can be made available through various platforms

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, and that's OK! You can really support by:

Sharing this campaign across your social media networks - tell your friends about me!
Retweet or share messages we post about it too!
Listen to our music, and if you like it, let other people know!!

 
Thank you so much for your time and interest! And we hope you enjoy our music.
Sincerely,
Tambores del Pueblo

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lauren Teel. I am 19 years old and an Audio Production major at Middle Tennesse State University. I grew up in North Texas and am a country singer/songwriter and musician. I play guitar, piano, ukulele, and am trying to learn the banjo. I am currently unsigned and have decided to release my first album which includes 14 self-written tracks. This campaign is to launch my merchandise for my brand. I have poured almost all of the extra money I had after paying for food, gas, and other college necessities, on creating my album and still have more to pay in order to get it out there. This campaign is so that I can produce my first album and start selling merchandise after my music is released which will give me a huge boost in starting up my country music career.

What We Need & What You Get

There are 14 songs in total on the album. Since tracking/recording is $65 an hour, mixing is $125 per song, and mastering is $100 per song, it adds up to about $6K, not to mention paying the session musicians (drummer, bassist, banjoist), which all comes out to about another $6K since professional musicians charge around $40-50 an hour. When it comes to the merchandise, since it is much cheaper to buy things in bulk, the remainder of the money after hitting $12K will go to buying the actual custom-designed products that I will be selling on my website. Each person who donates at least $50 will get discount codes to use during checkout at www.laurenteel.com.

The Impact

Ever since I was a little girl, I've always wanted to make an impact with my music and to write songs that people can relate to. Taking the next step with the production of my first album and merchandise will help me build and grow my fan-base. Your contributions, no matter how small will make a huge difference in my life and the lives of those who just might hear my music one day.

Risks & Challenges

There could be price changes when it comes to the websites that I will be using to create my merchandise. If that happens I will be glad to cover the difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help.

  • Visit my website www.laurenteel.com and subscribe to our email list
  • Listen to my music when it comes out on Apple Music and/or Spotify
  • Tell people about this
  • Like, share, and/or comment

story:
DEAREST FUNDER!

Professor Grandma made this is ECO rap with the last of her pension, and a shoestring. "Poison in the Fjord" was made to open the environmantal demonstration by "Nordfjord Natur og Ungdom" in Førde 22. March, demonstrating to stop a mining company from dumping their waste into the fjord. The teenagers loved the song and asked for the music video and to hear it on Spotify! With your support this can become a reality! It is currently part of a science show and a workshop on www.nor-sci.com 

Professor Grandma will be "Over the Moon!" if you give her support so that she can record the 3rd and final verse, make a PROPER music video, pay the people involved PROPERLY, in addition to affording her daily tea and biscuits!

For this she hopes to raise Kr 200 000,- She will be making the song and music video with all the funsing she receives, whether she reaches her goal or not! Any access fund will go towards record ing her new songs, "Molekyler and S-S-Super Scientist!" If you are not able to support by donating money, then she will be forever grateful if you please help by sharing this page! 

Previous musical science productions by Heidi, (aka Professor Grandma) with the VilVite Science center in Bergen:

Laksen Maks og Mia Makrell https://vimeo.com/104847371

Metamorfose https://youtu.be/pTqZcnvWO3I

THANK YOU for helping Professor Grandma SAVE THE WORLD ONE VERSE AT A TIME!

Heidi Ektvedt is Professor Grandmas´ alter ego. She is a teacher and science artist from Bergen in Norway. She has lived half her life in England . After finishing her teacher training in Oxford, she taught in London and Brighton while she trained in Forum Theatre, as a puppeteer and storyteller. Like the salmond, she returned to her home to have her two children. She loves to engage children of all ages in science "edutainment". 

A BIG thank you to

Musician and sound engineer magician Dag Erik Nygaard 

Directress, camera and editor whizz Yana Gorbalenya 

FabLabTastic dancers Henni and Anni

Camera Queen Mette Meidell 

Effects and graphics Master Georgij Voinov

Super scientist Sabine-Bee Haake

Camera and editing whizard Gabriele Bertotti

story:
Hello my friends,

I’m Leona X.  I’m a songwriter, singer, and lead guitarist based in Las Vegas.

My greatest passion is songwriting, and through it, I want to spread a message of love, compassion, and equality for all species, and for our beautiful planet.

Recently , I experienced something incredible.  A spiritual awakening that changed my life and made me look at things so differently, right when I needed it the most.

Over the last year I lost my mother, my beloved cat, and couple years ago I found my biological father, only to find that I was too late. He passed away in 2013, never knowing about me, and I was his only child.  It broke my heart. I had looked for him for a big part of my life, and I finally found him,  too late.  I experienced so much loss all at once. 

 

But the silver lining is that, out of all of that came an amazing song.  I really feel like it’s my best work ever.  It really came from my heart, more than any other song I have ever written.  I’ve never done or felt anything like this.  I poured all my heart and soul into this song.  Everything I was going through, including finally starting to love myself for the first time. It’s all in there. 

“I’m Alive” came to me all at once, on a very magical night, 3 days before my beloved cat, Ebby, crossed over.  The veterinarian gave me the grim news that she wouldn’t make it through the week.  

That night, on November 12th, 2019, it was a Full Taurus Moon. I went into my music room, and everything I was feeling and going through just flowed out of me so easily.  I could actually feel the power of the moon and the universe working through me.  It was indescribable. I just let the feeling overtake me. 

Three days later Ebby crossed over.  I then wrote the intro to the song and called it”’Til We Meet Again”. 

“I’m Alive” was recorded during the Full Lunar Eclipse, also know as the Full Wolf Moon, on January 10th 2020.  I’ll never forget walking outside of the studio and looking up at the sky, and it was absolutely amazing, you guys!  And there was magic flowing through that room!

This song means more to me than any other one I’ve written. It's everything I imagined and more.  The release date will be March 9th 2020, on the day of the Super Full Worm Moon. 

 

That means this song will have been written, recorded, and released under three very powerful super full moons!

Now, I want, so much, to make a video to go with it.  I have such a huge vision, with a sincere message of hope. 

This song gives hope to all that have loved and lost, and, to me, personally, it’s a testament to the incredible power of Mother Nature, and the oneness between us and the universe.  

All I want, more than anything, is to make this creation in my head become a reality to share with the whole world!

You can be a part of making it happen, my friends.  It’s all up to us.  There is no record label.

With your contribution we can make it happen.

Let’s come together and spread a rocking message of love and compassion for all.

Friends, please know how grateful I am for your continued love and support.  

It’s people like you who make a difference.  

Together, we can do this…

Love always, Leona XOXO

What We Need & What You Get

 

Friends, I need at least $2,000 to make a quality music video.  

To make a video there's a cost for everything.  Some of these things are;

Location Costs - Some places require a permit.  My dream is to film at either Mount Charleston, where I had the video shoot, or at Spirit Mountain.  Since this song is about the power of Mother Nature, it has to be at one of these places.

Travel - We need to rent a U Haul truck to transport all off our equipment to the location.

Videographers - We need at least three crew members to film.

Musicians - I have to pay them to work for the day.

Dancers - I need at least 4 dancers.

Costumes - For me, I need at least three different ones, and for the dancers as well.  They are very expensive.

Props - I haven't decided which ones to use, I'm still figuring that out.

B Role Footage - Stock video, and special effects.

Editing & Post Production - This is where the big money and time is spent.

Advertising - No one will watch or buy anything they don't know about, so there will always be promotional and marketing expenses for everything.

PERKS:

Since I will be putting this out before the release date, YOU will be one of the first to hear it, and receive a digital download of the song (with a donation) before it goes public.  

I will also make personal, behind the scenes, in the making, video footage, special, just for you.

Plus signed photos and posters of the cover art for "I'm Alive", and of the pictures that are taken at the shoot.

Signed copies of my last EP, "The Woman In Me", and many more personalized perks!

The biggest perk of all will be joining me , as a guest, to the video shoot!!

 

The Impact

"I'm Alive" gives hope to all that have loved and lost.  I want to spread a message that the world needs to hear.  We all lose people and pets that we love, and it hurts so much.  Life and death happens.  Like I explained above, I lost so much, but being able to channel all of my feelings into this song was such great therapy for me.  It really helped me to grieve and heal.  It is my hope that it will do the same for others.  Anyone who has experienced loss will feel transcended with this song, and somehow be able to relate, realizing that we are all ONE with the universe.  We are all worthy of love.  ALL lives matter.  We are all connected to everything, the sky, the heavens, the water, and the earth.  Because of this, when someone you love crosses over, you can literally feel them "everywhere, all around". 

This song will uplift you and make you feel Alive!  The light is within ourselves!

My last Ep, "The Woman in Me", was made possible by all of YOU, and I am eternally grateful.

Since then, I have grown so much, as a person, as a singer, a guitarist, and in every way.

 

Risks & Challenges

$2,000 will make filming a video happen.  Bottom line is, the more we raise, the better quality, more intense, and more visual it will become.

If we don't meet the goal, I'll still make a video the best I can.  If we go above the goal it means we won't need to cut so many corners.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, monetarily, here are some of the ways you can still help:

1.)  SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! On Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email, text, phone, etc.

       Use the Indiegogo share tools!

2.)  VOLUNTEER - On the day of the shoot we will need:

        Photographers - to document the day with photos and for the special perks.

        Transportation - We can save money by not having to rent a truck

        Loading - Help loading equipment is super helpful!

        Hair and Makeup - I could really use assistance with this, because I will need fresh ups and   someone to always be checking for out of place hair and messed up makeup, especially since we are dealing with the outdoors and Mother Nature.  Also assist with wardrobe, changing, insure against malfunctions, etc.

        Food and Drinks - We will need nourishment , someone to bring portable snacks and make sure we are all well hydrated.

        Help with emails - Sharing this campaign with your friends will help us to reach our goal.  Also, sharing the release Press to bloggers, vloggers, YouTubers, newspapers, magazines, etc., will make such a HUGE impact on the success of the single!!

       Props - If you have anything we can use, like swords, medieval costumes, anything magical looking, or that's to do with nature etc., that's what we're doing!

       Media - If you have any skills like, photoshopping, editing, graphic design, B roll footage, special effects, etc., THAT would be AMAZING!!

 

Okay!  So I think that is it for now.  I will be sure to post updates on our progress.

Let's make a badass rock video!!  XOXO

story:
West African Blues and Rock Academy

Académie de Blues et de Rock

en Afrique de l’Ouest

 

Actual front of the Sanctuary / La façade actuelle du Sanctuary

 

For eight years, the Sanctuary club has proposed to the public and musicians of Benin, a francophone west african country, to discover the Blues and Rock repertoire, relatively unknown by them, although this universal music finds its roots there.

Depuis huit ans, le club du Sanctuary a offert au public et aux musiciens du Bénin, pays francophone de l’Afrique de l’Ouest, de découvrir le Blues et le Rock, cette culture universelle relativement méconnue dans une région d’Afrique d´où elle a pourtant puisé ses sources.

 

 
At the end of January 2020, the Sanctuary had to close!
Fin Janvier 2020, le Sanctuary a été obligé de fermer ses portes !
 

We need your help to reach our goal: to give the Sanctuary the opportunity to continue its educational work with local musicians and to offer its audience a more intense experience in a more appropriate space.

Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour atteindre notre objectif : donner la possibilité au Sanctuary de continuer son travail pédagogique avec les musiciens de la place et d´offrir à son public une expérience plus intense dans un espace plus approprié.

 

 

Background /Contexte:

For eight years (2012), at the Sanctuary, the in-house band AMBO has offered every friday, saturday and sunday evenings, Rock and Blues concerts to the beninese public. They are the result of an intensive work, week after week, of analysing, learning, understanding this music, to finally master the technique, in order to be able to interpret its repertoire. The Sanctuary is first of all a music academy!

AMBO is composed of young artists brought together and trained by its founding artistic director who can count on the input of many guest-musicians. So far, the Sanctuary has coached three young bands, more than twenty musicians, allowing them to master over 500 titles. Their constantly evolving repertoire ranges from Blues (Robert Johnson, John Lee Hooker, Muddy Waters, B.B. King …), Rhythm &  Blues/Soul (Ray Charles, James Brown, Stevie Wonder, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding...),  Rock/Pop (Led Zeppelin, The Rolling Stones, Michael Jackson, Prince, Deep Purple, Eric Clapton, the Eagles…)  without forgetting Afropop (Angelique Kidjo, Salif Keita, Khadja Nin, Myriam Makeba…), Reggae and Zouk (Bob Marley, Alpha Blondy, Kassav...), and french artists (Nougaro, Jonasz, Patricia Kaas, Edith Piaf, Johnny Halliday...).

Today, these musicians are themselves training new promising artists.

 

Depuis huit ans (2012), au Sanctuary, le groupe AMBO, a proposé tous les vendredis, samedis et dimanches soirs des concerts de Rock et de Blues au public béninois. Ces soirées sont le résultat d'un travail acharné, toute la semaine, à apprendre, comprendre, disséquer cette musique, et maîtriser les techniques nécessaires à l'interprétation du répertoire. Le Sanctuary est avant tout une académie!

Le groupe AMBO est composé de musiciens assemblés et formés par le directeur artistique qui l'a créé, en s'appuyant souvent sur des musiciens invités. À ce jour, le Sanctuary a coaché 3 groupes, soit plus d'une vingtaine de musiciens,  ce qui leur a permis de maîtriser un vaste répertoire (plus de 500 titres !!!). Ce répertoire, en constante évolution, va du Blues (Robert Johnson, John Lee Hooker, Muddy Waters, BB King…), Rhythm & Blues / Soul (Ray Charles, James Brown, Stevie Wonder, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding ... ) au Rock et à la Pop (Led Zeppelin, The Rolling Stones, Michael Jackson, Prince, Deep Purple, Eric Clapton, the Eagles…) sans oublier l’Afropop (Angelique Kidjo, Salif Keita, Khadja Nin, Myriam Makeba…), le Reggae et le Zouk ( Bob Marley, Alpha Blondy, Kassav ...) et les artistes français (Nougaro, Jonasz, Patricia Kaas, Edith Piaf, Johnny Halliday...).

Aujourd'hui, ces musiciens forment eux-mêmes de nouveaux artistes à venir.

 

 
 

The Sanctuary is a unique springboard which has provided to all these musicians a highly professional and performing tool that allows them to develop and improve their artistic personality.

Le Sanctuary est un tremplin unique qui a permis à tous ces musiciens, dans des conditions techniques professionnelles et performantes, de développer et de perfectionner leur personnalité artistique.

 

 

Without entry fee, the receipts from the bar, our only source of income, were used to cover the running costs and to correctly pay, every week, all the musicians. However the surface of the Sanctuary, and therefore also the receipts, were cut in half when the Government of Benin decided to clear the public space and to suppress all privileges granted by the town hall of Cotonou.

Sans prix d´entrée, seules les recettes du bar ont permis de couvrir les frais de fonctionnement, et surtout ont permis de correctement rémunérer, chaque semaine, tous les musiciens. Cependant, l'espace du Sanctuary, et donc ses recettes,  ont été réduits de moitié quand le gouvernement béninois a décidé de dégager les espaces publics mis à disposition par la mairie de Cotonou.

 

Breakage of the Sanctuary in 2017 (see FAQ) / La casse du Sanctuary en 2017 (voir FAQ)

 

 

 

Moreover, the Sanctuary regularly organized events around a theme or a legendary artist.

Régulièrement, le Sanctuary a proposé à son public des événements musicaux autour d’un thème ou d’une légende de cette musique .

 

On the other hand, the Sanctuary had become the place where visiting artists have been invited to perform with the house band.

D´autre part, le Sanctuary était devenu le lieu où les artistes de passage ont été invités à se produire en compagnie de ses musiciens.

 

Finally, we regularly invite local artists to take advantage of our technical infrastructure to present their work.

Enfin, nous invitons régulièrement des artistes locaux à profiter de notre scène pour présenter leur travail.

 

 

Besides these artistic activities, a workshop offers musicians a competent service for the maintenance of their instruments and amps. Young people in need of resources also have the opportunity to use the instruments of the Sanctuary, many of which were obtained through the contribution of our network of artists around the world.

A côté de ces activités artistiques, un atelier technique offre aux musiciens un service compétent pour l’entretien de leurs instruments et amplis. Les jeunes en manque de moyens ont aussi l´occasion d´utiliser les instruments du Sanctuary, dont beaucoup ont été obtenus grâce à la contribution de notre réseau d´artistes dans le monde.

 

 
The time has come. The Sanctuary is now closed. The musicians stay home. The public regrets the closure of our club and we can no longer continue without reinstalling the Sanctuary in an adequate working space. It all comes down to money.

L’heure a sonné. Le Sanctuary est maintenant fermé. Les musiciens restent chez eux. Le public regrette la fermeture de notre club et nous ne pouvons plus continuer sans réinstaller le Sanctuary dans un espace adéquat. C’est une question de moyens.

 

 

Our needs today /Nos besoins aujourd’hui :

We need to move the Sanctuary to a new, larger space. This requires a significant investment, broken down as follows:

  • Rental of a space: a deposit equivalent to one year of rent, and a minimum of 6 months of advance rent are common practices in Benin.
  • Adaptation of performance spaces and educational spaces.
  • Improvement of our technical equipment.
  • Provision to ensure the wages of the musicians during the improvement and launch of the new space.

 

Nous devons déménager le Sanctuary dans un nouvel espace plus grand. Cela demande un investissement important, décomposé comme suit :

  • Location de l’espace : une caution équivalente à un an de loyer, et un minimum de 6 mois de loyer d’avance sont pratiques courantes au Bénin.
  • Adaptation des espaces de spectacle et des espaces pédagogiques.
  • Renforcement de nos équipements techniques.
  • Provision pour assurer le cachet des musiciens durant la relance du nouvel espace.

 

A contribution of 22,000,000 CFA francs (Euro 33,500 or USD 37,000) is necessary to carry out this project and ensure its sustainability.

Un apport de 22 000 000 fcfa (Euro 33 500 ou USD 37 000) est nécessaire pour mener à bien ce projet et assurer sa pérennité.

 

 

Sandy Keale, famous Blues coach and performer in Paris

 

Mika bass, our bands conductor, and main teacher
 

The whole Sanctuary-team thanks you for your help. / Toute l'équipe du Sanctuary vous remercie de votre aide.

Thanks to all of you who contributed to make this page  / Merci à tous ceux qui ont contribué à cette page: Dominiqueee, Jean-Pierre, Charly, Corsini, Nicolas pour ses photos, et toute l'équipe du Sanctuary

story:
Classical music exists in two realms: the museum, and the laboratory.

Choral music is one of the oldest and most universal art forms, however most concerts today rely on performance practices and repertoire from the 1500s-1800s.

Music from this era is wonderful, and well-supported by audiences, donors, and educational programs. In fact, in all of North America, 10% of the choruses with million dollar annual budgets are located in Washington, DC. 

I have spent the last 30 years of my life practicing and performing this music. What I have learned along the way is that, while this music is gorgeous, thought-provoking, and can move your emotions from anguish to serenity, it is largely unchanged in hundreds of years. It’s a fantastic way to explore the museum of classical music, but it doesn’t do enough to support the new, unknown, emerging, and under-represented choral musicians of today.

Artifice was founded because I feel strongly that when my career in music is over, a choral performance will look and feel very different. With that thought in mind, I am building an ensemble that will help explore what’s possible in choral performance, advocate for new voices in choral composition, and help shape the next generation of choral music.

Our premiere performance is on March 6th at the Bennett Park Art Atrium, and is being presented in collaboration with our friends at StageFree. The nine pieces we will perform represent a sampling of modern choral music, including pieces by composers singing in the ensemble. 

Our debut performance explores themes of hiraeth, a Welsh word that roughly translates to missing a time, an era, or a person - including homesickness for what may not exist any longer. It is associated with the bittersweet memory of missing something or someone, while being grateful of their existence. It can also be used to describe a longing for a homeland, potentially of your ancestors, where you may have never been. 

Giving your support to this project will help defray costs associated with rehearsal and performance spaces, music purchases, equipment purchases for the performance, the various expenses that come along with starting a nonprofit, and helping launch a program that will shape the next generation of choral music and musicians in Washington, DC. 

I hope to see you there, on March 6th.

Dr. Casey Cook
Founder/Artistic Director
Artifice

story:
The Fuel:

"There's always a song around God...if a local church is seeing God, they'll have a song. Songs are a sign of life." - Adam Russel

Our local churches are alive and we've seen God do amazing things all around us. He's revealing himself through the worship of His people and we're seeing salvations, restoration and healing as the supernatural power of His love breaks through. 

The Mission:

Station Worship has set out to write and record songs that move people's hearts closer to Jesus and that declare His amazing grace!

Sarah and Pat Traynor and the Station Worship Crew have spent over 18 months writing and crafting songs inspired by the undeniable things we are seeing God do. Now it's time to record and release our first project. We're inviting you to help...

The Need:

Here's the low down:

  • We need to raise $38,000.00 to complete this (6) song album. It includes professional composition, production, recording, pre-mix engineering, mixing, mastering and release of our first (6) songs.
  • Check out the various levels of support and the great perks on this page.
  • Your contribution will directly support the creation, release and distribution of our first album!
  • Pray big prayers! Participate by sharing this campaign and consider Partnering by giving.

The Team:

"There is nothing more right in the universe than to sing praises to The Creator of the universe." 

Station Worship is a collective of local worship leaders, writers and musicians who are passionate about writing music that draws people's hearts closer to Jesus in worship. Your support will ensure that the message in these songs reach as many people as possible and will help secure the future of Station Worship! 

    The Impact:

    Worship is missional. Locally inspired songs bring encouragement to the body of Christ and remind us that God is on the move in our area. As we connect our hearts to the mission through our own words and songs, we're inspired to continue the pursuit of His Kingdom. Let's go church!

    As New Englanders we have a unique song to sing that testifies to what God is saying and doing in our corner of the world. We are Stationed here to tell of His good news! 

    We've shared stripped down acoustic versions of some of our songs, and the response has been amazing. We're already hearing testimonies of how our songs are impacting people! Praise God!

    The Challenges:

    • With pure joy we've given this project everything we can, but we recognize that without your support the momentum could slow down.
    • Without your partnership our reach is limited. So consider helping us reach as many people as possible with our songs.

    The Support:

    Important ways everyone can help:

    • Pray for us daily.  We ask you to pray this simple prayer "God, let these songs impact the world around us, and show me how I can help." 
    • Share!  Re-post Station Worship social media news and updates and share this page with anyone you think might want to partner with us.  

    God will be glorified by the music you help create.  Thank you so much!

story:
THIS PROJECT MUST BE POSTPONED DUE TO UNFORESEE CIRCUMSTANCES. PLEASE LOOK FOR RELAUNCH SPRING OF 2021.

 

About "The Death and Life of Aida Hernandez" Commission

 

Aida Hernandez was an undocumented teenage mother who was deported to Mexico and had to combat a militarized U.S. immigration system if she was to have any hope of reuniting with her son. Her story, told in the book, “The Death and Life of Aida Hernandez,” challenges us to confront our laws and practices and the impacts they have on the lives of our neighbors.

I invite you to join me in telling Aida’s story through song in a new choral work for SSAA choir. Together, we can amplify her voice and help others (and ourselves) better understand the struggles of undocumented women and children and take action to change our world for the better.

My name is Michael. I am a composer of choral music. I love collaborating with others and seeing the light within them shine. My passion is to elevate the stories that I believe, when heard, can make our world a better place. It’s my way of fixing things, both in the world around me and within me.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

To do Aida’s story justice, I am writing a 15-minute, multi-movement work for SSAA choir. Composing a brand-new work is exciting, but it takes many hours of work.

My goal is to raise $10,000, which will allow me to set aside the time to write, edit, and engrave the piece, to hire a pianist to record rehearsal tracks for each part, and to create movement videos that demonstrate the phrasing of the piece. This will also allow me to edit footage from virtual choir members (you!) to create the final product that will be shared and delivered to you.

Finally, 10% of the funds raised will be donated to the nonprofit organization No More Deaths, whose mission is to end death and suffering in the Mexico-US borderlands through civil initiative: people of conscience working openly and in community to uphold fundamental human rights. 

So I need your help.

You can join me as a major commissioning choir, an individual singer, or as a non-singing book club partner. At each of these levels, you can amplify Aida’s story, bring a new piece of music to life, and make a difference in your community, our nation, and the world.

 

The Impact

 

As we look around at our country and our world, it is clear that there are many challenges we must address. It can be hard to know where to begin, or if our efforts will really make a difference.

What I’ve learned from my years of writing choral music with a social justice focus is that we truly can change the world through music. Choral music is the perfect medium to raise awareness, engage ourselves and our community in dialogue, inspire compassion, and incite meaningful change. Music speaks directly to the heart, and choral music can share stories and experiences through lyrics.

During the pandemic, many of us are cut off from our usual outlets of community and expression. But we still need community, a purpose to channel our artistic talents, a way to use our energies for good. This project will have an immense impact on our lives and on the world as we come together in the Book Club, Q&A Sessions and more, and as we combine our voices in song and let them resound across the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

I am committed to writing this piece, hosting the Book Club and Q&A sessions, and creating the virtual choir video. If my financial goal is not reached, all commitments listed in the “perks” will be honored. In this way, I and my business are absorbing the risk of this project. There is no risk to donors. The risk to myself is that if we do not reach our goal, I will have to write, edit, and engrave the piece and produce the rehearsal materials at a lower rate of compensation.

I am an experienced composer with an extensive catalog of choral music and many published works. I have successfully completed over a dozen professional commissions, and I have successfully administered and completed three commissioning consortiums.

 

Testimonials

 

"Michael is an excellent musician with a clear, engaging musical voice. She has the ability to work quickly and flexibly with collaborating musicians and composes music that is both topical and accessible, while never vapid. Being a conductor herself she understands the learning process, the abilities of singers, and the need to write music that fits the voice. I highly recommending collaborating with this excellent musician and person."

-Dr. Allan Friedman, Director, Women’s Voices Chorus of Chapel Hill

"My treble chorus commissioned Michael as part of the “Radium Girl” consortium. The experience was an incredibly rewarding one. I was in contact with Michael throughout the process, and they were able to use information about my singers and our abilities to inform their piece. They were very flexible and open to new ideas when I suggested using “singing bells” since my singers were struggling with overtone singing. The piece itself was lovely and powerful, yet accessible for my young (15-16 year old) singers. The poetic text and expressive text-setting led to fruitful discussions of social justice issues with my singers, and how art can shed light on these issues. The most rewarding component of the whole experience, however, was our two Skype sessions with Michael. Michael asked for a recording of my choir prior to the sessions so they could give us some feedback, and they really made my singers feel proud of our work on the piece. They were very open and answered questions from my singers about their creative process, their inspiration, and their life as a composer. They asked my singers questions that made them think deeply about the music and the subject matter. For my singers to have this kind of personal interaction with a composer throughout the commission process was incredibly valuable. The consortium made this commission affordable for my public school ensemble. We will certainly be participating in another project soon."

-Sara Cowan, Choral Director, Omaha Central High School

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I would love for you to join us as a commissioning choir, singer, or book club member, but I understand this may not be possible for everyone who supports the mission of this project.

  • You can help amplify Aida’s voice by sharing this project with choral singers who do not have the opportunity to sing this season, or with choirs who are working to program their season.
  • Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
  • Visit my website and subscribe to my newsletter to be the first to know about future projects, and to be notified when the virtual choir video for this project goes live.
story_txt:
THIS PROJECT MUST BE POSTPONED DUE TO UNFORESEE CIRCUMSTANCES. PLEASE LOOK FOR RELAUNCH SPRING OF 2021.
 
About "The Death and Life of Aida Hernandez" Commission
 
Aida Hernandez was an undocumented teenage mother who was deported to Mexico and had to combat a militarized U.S. immigration system if she was to have any hope of reuniting with her son. Her story, told in the book, “The Death and Life of Aida Hernandez,” challenges us to confront our laws and practices and the impacts they have on the lives of our neighbors.
I invite you to join me in telling Aida’s story through song in a new choral work for SSAA choir. Together, we can amplify her voice and help others (and ourselves) better understand the struggles of undocumented women and children and take action to change our world for the better.
My name is Michael. I am a composer of choral music. I love collaborating with others and seeing the light within them shine. My passion is to elevate the stories that I believe, when heard, can make our world a better place. It’s my way of fixing things, both in the world around me and within me.
 

What We Need & What You Get
 
To do Aida’s story justice, I am writing a 15-minute, multi-movement work for SSAA choir. Composing a brand-new work is exciting, but it takes many hours of work.
My goal is to raise $10,000, which will allow me to set aside the time to write, edit, and engrave the piece, to hire a pianist to record rehearsal tracks for each part, and to create movement videos that demonstrate the phrasing of the piece. This will also allow me to edit footage from virtual choir members (you!) to create the final product that will be shared and delivered to you.
Finally, 10% of the funds raised will be donated to the nonprofit organization No More Deaths, whose mission is to end death and suffering in the Mexico-US borderlands through civil initiative: people of conscience working openly and in community to uphold fundamental human rights. 
So I need your help.
You can join me as a major commissioning choir, an individual singer, or as a non-singing book club partner. At each of these levels, you can amplify Aida’s story, bring a new piece of music to life, and make a difference in your community, our nation, and the world.
 

The Impact
 
As we look around at our country and our world, it is clear that there are many challenges we must address. It can be hard to know where to begin, or if our efforts will really make a difference.
What I’ve learned from my years of writing choral music with a social justice focus is that we truly can change the world through music. Choral music is the perfect medium to raise awareness, engage ourselves and our community in dialogue, inspire compassion, and incite meaningful change. If my financial goal is not reached, all commitments listed in the “perks” will be honored. In this way, I and my business are absorbing the risk of this project. There is no risk to donors. The risk to myself is that if we do not reach our goal, I will have to write, edit, and engrave the piece and produce the rehearsal materials at a lower rate of compensation.
I am an experienced composer with an extensive catalog of choral music and many published works. I have successfully completed over a dozen professional commissions, and I have successfully administered and completed three commissioning consortiums.
 
Testimonials
 
"Michael is an excellent musician with a clear, engaging musical voice. She has the ability to work quickly and flexibly with collaborating musicians and composes music that is both topical and accessible, while never vapid. Being a conductor herself she understands the learning process, the abilities of singers, and the need to write music that fits the voice. I highly recommending collaborating with this excellent musician and person."
-Dr. Allan Friedman, Director, Women’s Voices Chorus of Chapel Hill
"My treble chorus commissioned Michael as part of the “Radium Girl” consortium. The experience was an incredibly rewarding one. I was in contact with Michael throughout the process, and they were able to use information about my singers and our abilities to inform their piece. They were very flexible and open to new ideas when I suggested using “singing bells” since my singers were struggling with overtone singing. The piece itself was lovely and powerful, yet accessible for my young (15-16 year old) singers. The poetic text and expressive text-setting led to fruitful discussions of social justice issues with my singers, and how art can shed light on these issues. The most rewarding component of the whole experience, however, was our two Skype sessions with Michael. Michael asked for a recording of my choir prior to the sessions so they could give us some feedback, and they really made my singers feel proud of our work on the piece. They were very open and answered questions from my singers about their creative process, their inspiration, and their life as a composer. They asked my singers questions that made them think deeply about the music and the subject matter. For my singers to have this kind of personal interaction with a composer throughout the commission process was incredibly valuable. The consortium made this commission affordable for my public school ensemble. We will certainly be participating in another project soon."
-Sara Cowan, Choral Director, Omaha Central High School
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
I would love for you to join us as a commissioning choir, singer, or book club member, but I understand this may not be possible for everyone who supports the mission of this project.

You can help amplify Aida’s voice by sharing this project with choral singers who do not have the opportunity to sing this season, or with choirs who are working to program their season.
Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Visit my website and subscribe to my newsletter to be the first to know about future projects, and to be notified when the virtual choir video for this project goes live.

story:
Back in 2018 I had the amazing opportunity to record my first project, an EP album of worship songs that I had been leading at my church. Since then I've been blessed to be able to share those songs throughout southern New England. Along the way I've been slowly writing more songs. And then this year, like so many others, I found myself with a lot more time on my hands. 

During the spring and early summer I spent time writing and soon realized that I was feeling called towards recording again. I reached out to Old Bear Studios to see about some options and was able to secure a week in the studio for January 2021.

Old Bear Studio, Batavia, NY

 

The plan for this album is to record several original songs along with a few contemporary arrangements of service music that we sing at my home church in Brookfield, CT. The goal is to record 10 tracks, making this my first full length album. It's an aggressive goal to accomplish with just 6 days in the studio, but work has already begun to make that happen. I'll be working ahead of the studio time to get things started and there will be many long days in the studio getting tracks recorded. 

Along the way I'll be sharing bits and pieces of the process and the music itself. If you want even more insider access, be sure to check out the Backstage Pass and All Access level perks. Like and follow my Facebook page for more information about when I'm in the studio.

https://www.facebook.com/PatrickOConnorsMusic

 

Playing live at Third Day Cafe, Waterbury, CT   photo credit: The Peter Perspective

 

Recording a full length album involves a lot of planning and a lot of people. Along with that comes a lot of expenses. The goal this time around is higher, and I believe the perks for this campaign are aligned to match. I'm once again offering CD's, T-shirts, concert tickets, album artwork, and public recognition for your contribution within the album liner notes. There are also some cool new perks, like custom snapback hats, an album poster, behind the scenes access to the recording process, early access to the final tracks, and more. 

You'll find all the perks listed on this page. When you see the perk you like, click on that perk to insure you're signed up for the right amount. The money donated goes towards studio time, which includes musicians for the sessions, post-production/mix-down, mastering, distribution, CD production, and the cost of the perks themselves.

Anthony recording piano on the track "Give Us Life"

 

This campaign is set up with flexible funding, meaning that all money donated towards the project will be used. Should the amount raised fall under the goal, the project will still move forward. From making another EP this time around, to recording all the tracks and releasing them at different times as funds are available for post-production and distribution; this project is 100% led by the Spirit and I firmly believe the funding needed will be available at the right time. 

Of course we can't seem to do anything in 2020 without addressing the corona sized elephant in the room. I am planning a release concert to launch the music when it's ready. The goal is to hold that in late May/June 2021 at my home church. If in the event that guideline/restrictions delay either the studio or post-production timing, or the release itself, I will have the concert as soon as it is safe and feasible to do. This may include delaying several weeks or adjusting the concert location to a larger venue. 

Jeremy tracking guitars on my last album

 

Of course this campaign is setup to generate funds for the project. But more importantly than that, I covet your prayers throughout the campaign and the entire process of making this album. It's a massive undertaking on so many fronts. I ask for prayer for guidance on making smart, timely decisions as needed. For good health and safety for all involved. For inspiration for myself, the producers and musicians as we finalize and record the songs. And for my family as they go on this journey with me. 

Another huge way to help is to share this with others. That can be done directly by sending it to a friend or family member, or simply liking, commenting, and sharing on social media. The social media machine is massive and filters out so much, any interaction with campaign posts or updates helps others who might be interested see it as well.

Thanks again for taking a few minutes to check this out. God Bless! 

 

Special thanks to Glenn Johnson for the video production on this campaign and to Chris Barrett for photography!

story:
Be a Part of my New Album
Dream Chaser!

Be in the Liner Notes!
Become Executive Producer!
Get a Gold or Platinum Record!
Own a song as NFT!

Hi! My name is Martin Motnik. I’m a professional bass guitarist who works as a freelance musician for live concerts and studio recordings. I’m also a member of the German pioneers of Heavy Metal ACCEPT, and a solo artist on bass guitars.

When the pandemic hit and we couldn't go on the road, I decided to use the time to record a new full-length solo album. Following the tradition of my first album Bass Invader with renowned session drummer Gregg Bissonette, it was my goal to create complete and enjoyable instrumental songs while playing everything with bass guitars, on top of world-class drum tracks. To add variety, I’ve had the amazing Swedish guitar wizard Mattias IA Eklundh featured on two songs (one of them a Neil Peart-approved version of Rush’s YYZ). You can listen to the album on your preferred streaming service here: https://motnik.hearnow.com 

 


On my new album I thought that every song should feature a guest solo, ideally each one played by a different guest. That artist should also be someone who was influential to my musical development or who meant a lot to me on a musical or personal level. Basically, I wanted to have an album where I’m playing with my heroes.

"I always dreamed of playing with my heroes, and now the dream has become true."

I started reaching out to my heroes, and to my delight they agreed to participate! What started out as a lofty idea 15 months ago is now a stunning collection of world-renowned musicians on 10 original bass-virtuoso songs. Each song is carried by one of four most talented drummers, complemented by a guest solo by some of the world’s finest musical prodigies.

This album is the result of having a utopian idea and working to make it a reality. Just like joining ACCEPT in 2019, becoming a member of a legendary band was a dream until it was real. The title of my first album Bass Invader was supposed to describe how I approached my bass guitar; I invaded it! This new album made me realize how I’m spending my life; by chasing my dreams. That gave me the idea for my new album; it’s going to be: Dream Chaser.

 

This is your chance to get your name on an amazing collaboration of world-class musicians!

Mixed and mastered by my brother Frank – sound engineer with distinguished credits – I now have the masters in my possession and ready to be released. But in order to do this right, I want to release the album on CD as well as on high-quality vinyl. The collection of musicians who contributed deserve nothing less than the best. And I want to give you the opportunity to be on an album with these musicians!  That’s the reason for this crowdfunding campaign.

 Frank and Martin Motnik putting the final touches on the mix (with the help of Atreju)

The more we raise the more awesome the product and also the perks will be. I tried to come up with rewards that are as exceptional as the musicians I got to play with.
 

What's in it for you?

This is your chance to get your own personalized golden or platinum record, be mentioned on the album as Executive Producer, to get your name in the Thank You liner notes on a record with some of your favorite musicians, and to even own the master recording of a song as a non-fungible token (NFT) and make a real monetary investment. But even a relatively small contribution will get you an place on a Thank You-page for all eternity, you can get early access to the music, get the physical album before anybody else, or get a shout out or have a personal video chat with me.

Because of the pandemic, many vinyl factories are far behind with their orders. That’s why I chose my birthday November 10th as the release date; I’m optimistic that that’s enough time for the production. But contributors will get access to the music significantly earlier.

"Make Dream Chaser a physical album, get amazing rewards, and become part of a wild dream that became a reality. 

"Let’s dream together – shall we?"

 

What’s the goal?

  • Support the production and manufacturing of physical copies of my second bass solo album, accompanied by world-class drummers and featuring legendary guest soloists!
  • Get the album out on high-quality vinyl!
  • Receive high-value, one-of-a-kind perks!
  • Invest into the future and become the owner of the original master file of a song as a non-fungible token (NFT)!

 

Who’s on it?

Featured musicians (in order of appearance):

Drummers:

  •             Christopher Williams (ACCEPT, Gene Simmons, Ace Frehley)
  •             Walfredo Reyes Jr. (Santana, Chicago, Steve Winwood)
  •             Joe Babiak (Michael Angelo Batio, Attitudes & Altitude)
  •             Gregg Bissonette (L.A. Session, Ringo Starr All-Star Band, David Lee Roth)


Guest soloists:

  •             Joe Satriani (Solo)
  •             Wolf Hoffmann (ACCEPT)
  •             Bruce Kulick (KISS, Grand Funk Railroad)
  •             Frank Gambale (Session Guitarist, Chick Corea)
  •             Trev Lukather (Session Guitarist, Steve’s son)
  •             Andy Timmons (Danger Danger, Olivia Newton John, Solo)
  •             Mattias IA Eklundh (Freak Kitchen, Solo)
  •             Tim Tucker (United States Marine Band)
  •             Jennifer Batten (Michael Jackson, Jeff Beck, Solo)
  •             Derek Sherinian (Dream Theater, Whitesnake, Sons Of Apollo)


Mixing & Mastering:

Frank Motnik (Elton John, Roxette, The Darkness, Curtis Stigers, N’Sync, Martha Wash feat. RuPaul)

 

What are the songs?

Martin Motnik - "Dream Chaser"

01 "Departure" – Motnik / Williams / Satriani 4:54

02 "Ensenada" – Motnik / Reyes Jr. / Hoffmann 3:30

03 "Attitude Of Gratitude" – Motnik / Babiak / Kulick 4:52

04 "Do Not Open That Door" – Motnik / Babiak / Gambale 4:20

05 "Bach Cello Suite 1 on bass" – Martin Motnik 2:39

06 "175 Proof Rum" – Motnik / Reyes Jr. / Lukather 3:39

07 "Shuttle Home" – Motnik / Bissonette / Timmons 5:35

08 "Something I Don't Know" – Motnik / Bissonette / Eklundh 4:58

09 "Take A Breath" – Motnik / Bissonette / Tucker 4:04

10 "Harmonycs" – Motnik / Williams / Batten 4:16

11 "Arrival" – Motnik / Williams / Sherinian 3:49

 

AND WHO T.F. IS MARTIN MOTNIK??

I’m a passionate disciple of heavy strings, a slave to low frequencies, a person dedicated to being the foundation of a song and the glue within a band. My job is done well when I make others sound great. I’ve played over 5,000 shows; in 4,500 of them no one probably noticed me, and that’s a good thing. The bass should be felt; you should only notice it when it drops.

Born and raised in Ludwigshafen, Germany, I found my calling at age 13 when my brother brought home our first bass guitar. After that I spent my teenage years practicing and dreaming about becoming a professional bass player. After graduating high school I became a banker, quit that job, and went to college for an MBA diploma – the most fancy wall art I now own. But all those years I’ve dreamed about and worked on making music my profession. In 2008 I decided to go all in, bought a ticket to L.A. and took a chance with the savings from a music store job. I got lucky and ended up getting a tour with The Scorpions’ Uli Jon Roth, got a visa, got a Green Card, and was able to stay in the land of my dreams.

It hasn’t been easy, but it was worth it. The struggle of a musician jumping from gig to gig, always worrying if enough jobs would come through to pay the bills, is real. But the moments on stage, in the studio, and any other musical interaction are worth the efforts. I’ve recorded with legends like Hal Blaine and Don Randy, members of the Wrecking Crew who have played on more songs that some people have heard in their lives. I’ve performed and recorded with musicians who have provided the foundation for Elvis Presley, Frank Sinatra, Carlos Santana, Ringo Starr, AC/DC, KISS, The Beach Boys, or The Eagles. I’ve played on 5 continents and traveled around the world and across the equator, all because of some big strings. Others want to pull them, I’m happy if I can pluck them.

I love hearing a song on which I helped make the artist in the front sound better, give them the foundation and the confidence to shine. This album is just my little step into the limelight. And still I hope I won’t bother you with mindless exercises or show-off techniques. They are fine, but they are tools to achieve something greater: actual music you can listen to and enjoy. If I can get you to do that, then I have done my job well. 

Here are some of the amazing people I had the honor to work with:

Live Credits (excerpt):

ACCEPT • Uli Jon Roth (Scorpions) • Missing Persons • Chris Slade (AC/DC, Manfred Mann’s Earth Band, Tom Jones, Asia) • Mugs Cain (Michael Bolton, Sammy Hagar, Eric Martin) • Ray Parker Jr. (“Ghostbusters”) • Marco Minnemann (Paul Gilbert, The Aristocrats) • Walfredo Reyes Jr. (Chicago, Santana, Christina Aguilera Band) • Don Dokken (Dokken) • Doug Aldrich (Whitesnake) • Doug Bossi (David Coverdale, Jennifer Paige, Don Henley etc.) • Paul Shortino (Quiet Riot) • Jimmy Crespo (Aerosmith, Rod Stewart) • Phil Campbell (Motorhead) • Akira Jimbo (Casiopea) • Eisbrecher • Darkseed

Recording Credits (excerpt):

• Gregg Bissonette (David Lee Roth, Ringo Starr, Carlos Santana et al.) • Hal Blaine (Nancy Sinatra, Elvis Presley, John Denver, the Ronettes, Simon & Garfunkel, the Carpenters, the Beach Boys et al.) • Don Randi (Linda Ronstadt, Quincy Jones, Cannonball Adderley, Herb Alpert, Sarah Vaughan, Frank Zappa et al.) • Matt Bissonette (Don Henley, Joe Satriani et al.) • Chad Wackerman (Frank Zappa et al.) • Michael Landau (Miles Davis, Michael Jackson, Pink Floyd, B.B. King, Ray Charles et al.) • Kenny Aronoff (John Mellencamp, Bob Seger, Elton John, Meat Loaf et al.) • Chris Slade (AC/DC, Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Asia et al.) • Atma Anur (Jason Becker, Richie Kotzen, Tony MacAlpine et al.) • Mattias "IA" Eklundh (on Steve Vai's label Favored Nations) • Harold Faltermeyer (Composer “Top Gun”, “Beverly Hills Cop” etc.; producer Billy Idol, Jennifer Rush et al.) • World's Apart (European platinum awarded band) • Darkseed • The Roxx • Martha Wash feat. RuPaul

To everyone who has helped me make my dream a reality: Thank You!

Some final remarks

I tried to be as accurate in my perk descriptions as possible, however some fields had limitations set by Indiegogo. For clarification:

  • If we reach 50% of the goal, every contribution of $100 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.
  • If we reach 75% of the goal, every contribution of $75 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.
  • If we reach 100% of the goal, every contribution of $50 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.

Also, I was limited to list a maximum of 10 perks per contribution. However, the higher-end perks will definitely include all of the before-mentioned perks, even if they're not listed in the drop-down fields. If you're interested in one of those perks, feel free to contact me for clarification and confirmation.

Lastly, I will eventually publish play-through videos for each song. If you become the owner of the NFT original file of the song (check the last two perks for explanation) I will add your name to the credits of the corresponding video; unless you prefer not to.

Can't contribute? No problem!

If you can’t help me directly through a contribution, no problem! These are tough times for many. Help me spread the words by sharing this campaign with your friends, colleagues, and everyone else who you think loves music! And who doesn’t love music?

Keep in touch!

To stay up-to-date, please follow me on my social media pages for behind-the-scenes video and photos:

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/motnik

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/motnik

YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/motnik
