Following the tradition of my first album Bass Invader with renowned session drummer Gregg Bissonette, it was my goal to create complete and enjoyable instrumental songs while playing everything with bass guitars, on top of world-class drum tracks. To add variety, I’ve had the amazing Swedish guitar wizard Mattias IA Eklundh featured on two songs (one of them a Neil Peart-approved version of Rush’s YYZ). You can listen to the album on your preferred streaming service here: https://motnik.hearnow.com 
 

On my new album I thought that every song should feature a guest solo, ideally each one played by a different guest. That artist should also be someone who was influential to my musical development or who meant a lot to me on a musical or personal level. Basically, I wanted to have an album where I’m playing with my heroes.
"I always dreamed of playing with my heroes, and now the dream has become true."
I started reaching out to my heroes, and to my delight they agreed to participate! What started out as a lofty idea 15 months ago is now a stunning collection of world-renowned musicians on 10 original bass-virtuoso songs. Each song is carried by one of four most talented drummers, complemented by a guest solo by some of the world’s finest musical prodigies.
This album is the result of having a utopian idea and working to make it a reality. Just like joining ACCEPT in 2019, becoming a member of a legendary band was a dream until it was real. The title of my first album Bass Invader was supposed to describe how I approached my bass guitar; I invaded it! This new album made me realize how I’m spending my life; by chasing my dreams. That gave me the idea for my new album; it’s going to be: Dream Chaser.
 
This is your chance to get your name on an amazing collaboration of world-class musicians!
Mixed and mastered by my brother Frank – sound engineer with distinguished credits – I now have the masters in my possession and ready to be released. But in order to do this right, I want to release the album on CD as well as on high-quality vinyl. The collection of musicians who contributed deserve nothing less than the best. And I want to give you the opportunity to be on an album with these musicians!  That’s the reason for this crowdfunding campaign.
 Frank and Martin Motnik putting the final touches on the mix (with the help of Atreju)
The more we raise the more awesome the product and also the perks will be. I tried to come up with rewards that are as exceptional as the musicians I got to play with. 
What's in it for you?
This is your chance to get your own personalized golden or platinum record, be mentioned on the album as Executive Producer, to get your name in the Thank You liner notes on a record with some of your favorite musicians, and to even own the master recording of a song as a non-fungible token (NFT) and make a real monetary investment. But even a relatively small contribution will get you an place on a Thank You-page for all eternity, you can get early access to the music, get the physical album before anybody else, or get a shout out or have a personal video chat with me.
Because of the pandemic, many vinyl factories are far behind with their orders. That’s why I chose my birthday November 10th as the release date; I’m optimistic that that’s enough time for the production. But contributors will get access to the music significantly earlier.
"Make Dream Chaser a physical album, get amazing rewards, and become part of a wild dream that became a reality. 
"Let’s dream together – shall we?"
 
What’s the goal?

Support the production and manufacturing of physical copies of my second bass solo album, accompanied by world-class drummers and featuring legendary guest soloists!
Get the album out on high-quality vinyl!
Receive high-value, one-of-a-kind perks!
Invest into the future and become the owner of the original master file of a song as a non-fungible token (NFT)!

 
Who’s on it?
Featured musicians (in order of appearance):
Drummers:


            Christopher Williams (ACCEPT, Gene Simmons, Ace Frehley)

            Walfredo Reyes Jr. (Santana, Chicago, Steve Winwood)

            Joe Babiak (Michael Angelo Batio, Attitudes & Altitude)

            Gregg Bissonette (L.A. Session, Ringo Starr All-Star Band, David Lee Roth)

Guest soloists:


            Joe Satriani (Solo)

            Wolf Hoffmann (ACCEPT)

            Bruce Kulick (KISS, Grand Funk Railroad)

            Frank Gambale (Session Guitarist, Chick Corea)

            Trev Lukather (Session Guitarist, Steve’s son)

            Andy Timmons (Danger Danger, Olivia Newton John, Solo)

            Mattias IA Eklundh (Freak Kitchen, Solo)

            Tim Tucker (United States Marine Band)

            Jennifer Batten (Michael Jackson, Jeff Beck, Solo)


            Derek Sherinian (Dream Theater, Whitesnake, Sons Of Apollo)

Mixing & Mastering:
Frank Motnik (Elton John, Roxette, The Darkness, Curtis Stigers, N’Sync, Martha Wash feat. RuPaul)
 
What are the songs?
Martin Motnik - "Dream Chaser"
01 "Departure" – Motnik / Williams / Satriani 4:54
02 "Ensenada" – Motnik / Reyes Jr. / Hoffmann 3:30
03 "Attitude Of Gratitude" – Motnik / Babiak / Kulick 4:52
04 "Do Not Open That Door" – Motnik / Babiak / Gambale 4:20
05 "Bach Cello Suite 1 on bass" – Martin Motnik 2:39
06 "175 Proof Rum" – Motnik / Reyes Jr. / Lukather 3:39
07 "Shuttle Home" – Motnik / Bissonette / Timmons 5:35
08 "Something I Don't Know" – Motnik / Bissonette / Eklundh 4:58
09 "Take A Breath" – Motnik / Bissonette / Tucker 4:04
10 "Harmonycs" – Motnik / Williams / Batten 4:16
11 "Arrival" – Motnik / Williams / Sherinian 3:49
 
AND WHO T.F. IS MARTIN MOTNIK??
I’m a passionate disciple of heavy strings, a slave to low frequencies, a person dedicated to being the foundation of a song and the glue within a band. My job is done well when I make others sound great. I’ve played over 5,000 shows; in 4,500 of them no one probably noticed me, and that’s a good thing. The bass should be felt; you should only notice it when it drops.
Born and raised in Ludwigshafen, Germany, I found my calling at age 13 when my brother brought home our first bass guitar. After that I spent my teenage years practicing and dreaming about becoming a professional bass player. After graduating high school I became a banker, quit that job, and went to college for an MBA diploma – the most fancy wall art I now own. But all those years I’ve dreamed about and worked on making music my profession. In 2008 I decided to go all in, bought a ticket to L.A. and took a chance with the savings from a music store job. I got lucky and ended up getting a tour with The Scorpions’ Uli Jon Roth, got a visa, got a Green Card, and was able to stay in the land of my dreams.
It hasn’t been easy, but it was worth it. The struggle of a musician jumping from gig to gig, always worrying if enough jobs would come through to pay the bills, is real. But the moments on stage, in the studio, and any other musical interaction are worth the efforts. I’ve recorded with legends like Hal Blaine and Don Randy, members of the Wrecking Crew who have played on more songs that some people have heard in their lives. I’ve performed and recorded with musicians who have provided the foundation for Elvis Presley, Frank Sinatra, Carlos Santana, Ringo Starr, AC/DC, KISS, The Beach Boys, or The Eagles. I’ve played on 5 continents and traveled around the world and across the equator, all because of some big strings. Others want to pull them, I’m happy if I can pluck them.
I love hearing a song on which I helped make the artist in the front sound better, give them the foundation and the confidence to shine. This album is just my little step into the limelight. And still I hope I won’t bother you with mindless exercises or show-off techniques. They are fine, but they are tools to achieve something greater: actual music you can listen to and enjoy. If I can get you to do that, then I have done my job well. 
Here are some of the amazing people I had the honor to work with:
Live Credits (excerpt):ACCEPT • Uli Jon Roth (Scorpions) • Missing Persons • Chris Slade (AC/DC, Manfred Mann’s Earth Band, Tom Jones, Asia) • Mugs Cain (Michael Bolton, Sammy Hagar, Eric Martin) • Ray Parker Jr. (“Ghostbusters”) • Marco Minnemann (Paul Gilbert, The Aristocrats) • Walfredo Reyes Jr. (Chicago, Santana, Christina Aguilera Band) • Don Dokken (Dokken) • Doug Aldrich (Whitesnake) • Doug Bossi (David Coverdale, Jennifer Paige, Don Henley etc.) • Paul Shortino (Quiet Riot) • Jimmy Crespo (Aerosmith, Rod Stewart) • Phil Campbell (Motorhead) • Akira Jimbo (Casiopea) • Eisbrecher • DarkseedRecording Credits (excerpt):• Gregg Bissonette (David Lee Roth, Ringo Starr, Carlos Santana et al.) • Hal Blaine (Nancy Sinatra, Elvis Presley, John Denver, the Ronettes, Simon & Garfunkel, the Carpenters, the Beach Boys et al.) • Don Randi (Linda Ronstadt, Quincy Jones, Cannonball Adderley, Herb Alpert, Sarah Vaughan, Frank Zappa et al.) • Matt Bissonette (Don Henley, Joe Satriani et al.) • Chad Wackerman (Frank Zappa et al.) • Michael Landau (Miles Davis, Michael Jackson, Pink Floyd, B.B. King, Ray Charles et al.) • Kenny Aronoff (John Mellencamp, Bob Seger, Elton John, Meat Loaf et al.) • Chris Slade (AC/DC, Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Asia et al.) • Atma Anur (Jason Becker, Richie Kotzen, Tony MacAlpine et al.) • Mattias "IA" Eklundh (on Steve Vai's label Favored Nations) • Harold Faltermeyer (Composer “Top Gun”, “Beverly Hills Cop” etc.; producer Billy Idol, Jennifer Rush et al.) • World's Apart (European platinum awarded band) • Darkseed • The Roxx • Martha Wash feat. RuPaul
To everyone who has helped me make my dream a reality: Thank You!
Some final remarks
I tried to be as accurate in my perk descriptions as possible, however some fields had limitations set by Indiegogo. For clarification:

If we reach 50% of the goal, every contribution of $100 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.
If we reach 75% of the goal, every contribution of $75 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.
If we reach 100% of the goal, every contribution of $50 and bigger will additionally receive the album as a vinyl record, autographed by me.

Also, I was limited to list a maximum of 10 perks per contribution. However, the higher-end perks will definitely include all of the before-mentioned perks, even if they're not listed in the drop-down fields. If you're interested in one of those perks, feel free to contact me for clarification and confirmation.
Lastly, I will eventually publish play-through videos for each song. If you become the owner of the NFT original file of the song (check the last two perks for explanation) I will add your name to the credits of the corresponding video; unless you prefer not to.
Can't contribute? No problem!
If you can’t help me directly through a contribution, no problem! These are tough times for many. Help me spread the words by sharing this campaign with your friends, colleagues, and everyone else who you think loves music! And who doesn’t love music?

Keep in touch!
To stay up-to-date, please follow me on my social media pages for behind-the-scenes video and photos:
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/motnik
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/motnik
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/motnik

story:
Summary - Help us Make Music

 

I am singer and co-writer for Toronto Experimental eco-Punk band RPNA (Real People Not Actors), and we would love to release a VINYL RECORD from our upcoming sessions at Chalet. As RPNA is on hiatus due to a member having other pro obligations, we are creating a reunion project and will record as The Rulers, a tribute to our original punk band from 1980. As of late-August, the proposed Rulers lineup for these sessions will be Mr. Mad (Ken),  and myself (Joe) from the original Rulers, plus three young players: guitarists Connor and Garrett from RPNA, plus new Ruler, Guitarist / Bassist, Scott.

We want to make a vinyl record, a Limited Edition Vinyl Record release!!! My start in music with Joe College and The Rulers produced a 7" 45rpm single (incl a cover of Working Class Hero) that is still highly sought-after today, 40 years later. Now I want to produce and release a 12" EP with members of Real People Not Actors plus guests whom I have played with over the years.

We will now record as The Rulers:

Wakin Up in the 2020s - original rocker

Home from Parade - Rulers version of the Ray Materick gem, a First Nations freedom song.

My Pledge of Love - Rockin cover of the Joe Jeffries R&B gem

Dirty - Punky version of contemporary alt-rock song.

Hallucinogenics - Psychedelic version of the Matt Maeson ditty.

+ Gimme Shelter!!! - tribute version in planning

We have been rehearsing and recording for 3 years, though the past 18 months have been hampered by the pandemic. In addition to core members, we have had the pleasure of having Wild T sit in with us for some recording sessions. We have some time booked at an excellent professional studio (Chalet) in early October, and would LOVE to release our output as a vinyl EP.

 

Here's us covering Hercules:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=05Y-yeFAvw0 

 

Here doing Paint It Black, with Wild T sitting in on lead guitar:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HhzFq9j4zl4

 

You too can be passionate about this project, support us and get involved! It's hard for me to express the magnitude of what contributors like you will help us achieve. This may be my final recording session, so I want to make it something special. Can you contribute $15 to help us make a special recording?

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise CDN$1,500, to use for releasing a vinyl record of our upcoming recording sessions. If we can exceed that, we will include a couple of special guests on the recordings, and be able to issue more copies. Even if we do not reach our goal, we will utilize the funds toward the recording and mixing and still try to produce, at minimum, a 7" vinyl single. 

1500 seems like a reasonable, humble amount and it will allow us to press a 7" single. If we get to 2500 we can press a 12" EP, and if we go higher, we can improve the quality of the recording and the pressing, and initiate a wider, record-store release, so THANK YOU ALL in advance!!!

 

Perks!!!

We are offering a range of perks including digital downloads, outtakes, opportunities to attend a rehearsal or recording session, or a chance to sing or play on this record.

 

Your Impact

People, please KNOW know the difference your contribution will make! The boys in The Rulers / RPNA will be super happy to be releasing a new vinyl record that will also be distributed digitally. We are an eco-conscious, antiwar Experimental Punk band hoping to raise consciousness via music, and YOU can be an ally and supporter!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, as that WILL be a meaningful contribution. Please share this page on your facebook, twitter and LinkedIn profiles, thank you!!!
  • Also, please feel free to click on and utilize the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it, you help us out a bit, and we'll get to release a great record!!!

story:
The Gist: 

Sings & Plays is my second release as a leader and my first album as a singer. It is both exciting and a bit scary to debut this side of my artistic endeavors. 

In collaboration with Mike Clement, Alex Dyring, Ryan Hanseler, Alexander Geddes and Gerald Watkins Jr. this album was recorded in New Orleans, LA at both Butcher Studios and the Music Shed. We are very proud of this release.  

The recording of "Sings & Plays" began just before the onset of the COVID pandemic. As with many, many in our community and beyond, the past year and a half took a financial toll on me. So here I am appealing to you all. If you were hoping to purchase this album or support my career financially, please consider pre-ordering a copy here. This is the best way to directly support me as artists see very little to no revenue from iTunes and other streaming services. 

Sings & Plays is fully mixed, mastered, and ready to be released on August 13. My hope is to use this peer-to-peer campaign to recoup some of my costs. 

TLDR: 

Buy my album from me on this site. If you don't have $$ show some love by sharing this campaign on your facebook, insta, finsta, dating profile, etc..

story:
Short Summary

Hello future patrons!

Mandy Goodhandy and Richard Henry have joined forces to help provide a space with not only excellent food, but also a space to bringing back live entertainment.

Mandy is a transgender woman, entertainer and entrepreneur.  Mandy owned and operating her own club called Goodhandy’s in 2006 changing the name to Club120 in 2012 with business partner Todd Klinck. They opened a restaurant downstairs and called it 120 Diner in 2014, featuring live music, comedy and a variety of art themed events. This is when she got to work side-by-side with Chef and manager Richard Henry. 

Richard Henry s

e Lakeview Diner before opening Les Rossignol and Le Canard Mort in Riverdale both which he sold to join Mandy in opening the 120 Diner as Chef.

Mandy Goodhandy aka Amanda Taylor and Richard Henry have over 50 years in the hospitality industry between them.

They have now taken over the lease at the location that operated as The Old Nick.  The Old Nick was a neighbourhood staple which they intend to renew and revive as a fresh new restaurant, special event and live entertainment space.

What We Need & What You Get

The budget is $100,000+ but we are looking to raise $40,000.  We would love your support to make this all happen. The space has been cleared out so we will need to start from scratch. We have three to four months to complete this by building a stage, bar, kitchen, downstairs lounge and all the decorating required to provide a beautiful ambience for dining and/or to watch your favorite musicians, comedians and singers. Also providing smaller events for many art forms and groups that sometimes have trouble finding safe and welcoming venues. This project will also include LGBTQPI2SA friendly, including a small weekly Trans gathering that was started by Mandyt back in the 90's. This all can be obtained mostly by your generosity here on Indiegogo. No donation amount or your help with social media will be too small!

We are also willing to talk to potential patrons who prefer to make more private arrangements; cheque, money order, e-transfer etc. Or patrons who wish to make a much larger donation with a return on their investment. Reach out directly to Mandy or Richard on FB.  

Let's talk perks!

We are not talking about free money here. We have outlined everything you will get back from your donation (see the list of perks for the amount you donate), big or small. These perks will come in the form of food and beverages, VIP parties, private concerts, private meet and greets etc.  

Even if we do not reach our goal, all the money collected will help with bringing back one more much needed dining spot, live performance venue and safe space for many communities in Toronto.

No matter what, this venue will open! Even if you are unable to contribute financially, please help by sharing this campaign by spreading it across your social media platforms.

We appreciate your consideration and thank you for reading about our campaign.

Love  always,

Mandy & Richard

story:
Welcome, 

I’m Nathan McEuen. I’m a songwriter and performer, and I’m excited to share my newest project with you!

As an independent artist, I’ve been lucky to share my music on some of the biggest stages, T.V. and radio broadcasts across the globe, but I couldn’t have ever done it without the continued love and support from dedicated music fans like you.

Recently, I’ve been joining forces with the legendary Mason Williams (SNL, Classical Gas, Smothers Brothers),  Chris Caswell (Daft Punk, The Muppets), Kelly Ward (Grease, Once Upon A Forest), and producer Paul Allen, to create my latest album, ‘SPECTRUM’!

What originally started as a single album concept, SPECTRUM has now become a 'double album' (with over 30 songs, and 80+ minutes of music). Featuring all new recordings, several special guest artists, bands and orchestras, and multiple musical worlds, from Classical, to Americana, to Hard Rock, this album brings together a complete ‘SPECTRUM’ of my musical repertoire.

I’m asking for your help and support in completing this album, and to become part of the process of making exciting new music, by either donating through one or more of the campaign PERKS, and/or by sharing this page with your friends and family! 

Your contributions are integral to the production and promotion of this album! I cannot do this without you! If the campaign goal is met, I'll be able to release SPECTRUM by January 3, 2020, do a cross-country tour (w/ band), produce music videos, update branding, websites, and kick it all off with a private VIP album release party, in Los Angeles, CA — December 28, 2019 — one week before the worldwide release!

The goal is $50,000.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign has a ‘Flexible Goal’ of $50,000. Every dollar raised, however much ($1 to $1,000,000+), will be used in the production and promotion of this album. The more money raised, the further this will go!

Costs include, but aren’t limited to: Musician Fees, Engineers, Studio Rental Fees, Mixing, Mastering, Artwork, Producer Fees, Royalties, CD & Vinyl Replication, Online Presence, Music Videos, Promotion, Travel/Touring, Distribution, Legal Fees, and Indiegogo Fees, to name a few.

If you are able to donate, there are 15 different PERKS to choose!! Depending on your contribution, you will be gifted/awarded anything from: Album Pre-Sales to Thank You's (in liner notes), Private Concerts to Cameos in Music Videos, Gold Tickets to ‘Associate Producer’ credits, and more... There’s a fun PERK for everyone and every budget!

—> —> —> Please take a look at all the PERKS —> —> —>

The Impact

SPECTRUM will be entered for Grammy Award consideration, for the 2021 season.

Your contributions will keep this album entirely independent, and help employ over 50 musicians, artists, engineers.

This will be my first vinyl pressing.

 

Risks & Challenges

In the 14 years and five albums of my solo career, I’ve played over 2,000 shows, selling over 40,000 albums, with every single dollar made going directly back into the music. I do this because I love it!! After investing hundreds of thousands of dollars, in 14 years, I have yet to make a profit. (Sometimes, playing a banjo, is not the best way to make money, or friends.) 

Having a full budget to complete an album, without cutting any production/promotion corners, is my goal, and is something I haven’t experienced, yet! 

With your help, I will achieve this goal!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute financially, but still would like to help, please spread the word by sharing online, talking to people, and making some noise about this campaign!! The more people know, the merrier! - Thank you, I couldn’t do this without your love and support! Cheers,

 

Nathan McEuen

www.nathanmceuen.com

 

 

—> —> —> Please take a look at all the PERKS —> —> —>
story_txt: Welcome, I’m Nathan McEuen. I’m a songwriter and performer, and I’m excited to share my newest project with you!As an independent artist, I’ve been lucky to share my music on some of the biggest stages, T.V. and radio broadcasts across the globe, but I couldn’t have ever done it without the continued love and support from dedicated music fans like you.Recently, I’ve been joining forces with the legendary Mason Williams (SNL, Classical Gas, Smothers Brothers),  Chris Caswell (Daft Punk, The Muppets), Kelly Ward (Grease, Once Upon A Forest), and producer Paul Allen, to create my latest album, ‘SPECTRUM’!What originally started as a single album concept, SPECTRUM has now become a 'double album' (with over 30 songs, and 80+ minutes of music). Featuring all new recordings, several special guest artists, bands and orchestras, and multiple musical worlds, from Classical, to Americana, to Hard Rock, this album brings together a complete ‘SPECTRUM’ of my musical repertoire.I’m asking for your help and support in completing this album, and to become part of the process of making exciting new music, by either donating through one or more of the campaign PERKS, and/or by sharing this page with your friends and family! Your contributions are integral to the production and promotion of this album! I cannot do this without you! If the campaign goal is met, I'll be able to release SPECTRUM by January 3, 2020, do a cross-country tour (w/ band), produce music videos, update branding, websites, and kick it all off with a private VIP album release party, in Los Angeles, CA — December 28, 2019 — one week before the worldwide release!The goal is $50,000. What We Need & What You GetThis campaign has a ‘Flexible Goal’ of $50,000. Every dollar raised, however much ($1 to $1,000,000+), will be used in the production and promotion of this album. The more money raised, the further this will go!Costs include, but aren’t limited to: Musician Fees, Engineers, Studio Rental Fees, Mixing, Mastering, Artwork, Producer Fees, Royalties, CD & Vinyl Replication, Online Presence, Music Videos, Promotion, Travel/Touring, Distribution, Legal Fees, and Indiegogo Fees, to name a few.If you are able to donate, there are 15 different PERKS to choose!! Depending on your contribution, you will be gifted/awarded anything from: Album Pre-Sales to Thank You's (in liner notes), Private Concerts to Cameos in Music Videos, Gold Tickets to ‘Associate Producer’ credits, and more... There’s a fun PERK for everyone and every budget!—> —> —> Please take a look at all the PERKS —> —> —>The ImpactSPECTRUM will be entered for Grammy Award consideration, for the 2021 season.Your contributions will keep this album entirely independent, and help employ over 50 musicians, artists, engineers.This will be my first vinyl pressing. Risks & ChallengesIn the 14 years and five albums of my solo career, I’ve played over 2,000 shows, selling over 40,000 albums, with every single dollar made going directly back into the music. I do this because I love it!! After investing hundreds of thousands of dollars, in 14 years, I have yet to make a profit. (Sometimes, playing a banjo, is not the best way to make money, or friends.) Having a full budget to complete an album, without cutting any production/promotion corners, is my goal, and is something I haven’t experienced, yet! With your help, I will achieve this goal!! Other Ways You Can HelpIf you’re unable to contribute financially, but still would like to help, please spread the word by sharing online, talking to people, and making some noise about this campaign!! The more people know, the merrier! - Thank you, I couldn’t do this without your love and support! Cheers, Nathan McEuenwww.nathanmceuen.com  —> —> —> Please take a look at all the PERKS —> —> —>

story:
We have put together some different options available to celebrate this project. Along side this we shall keep you updated with tour extras, photos and videos as the project unfolds.

After being together for only a year we have already amassed a big collection of songs and arrangements. We wanted to make a record that captures the energy of our live performances, so recorded it as much as we could simultaneously, adding extras but keeping the feel and dynamic of us performing live as best we could.

The album is coming out on CD and download with some lovely extras including badges, posters, a double bass lesson and some T-Shirts too!

Thanks so much for checking us out and being part of making of this record. We are very excited to be putting it out and we really hope people enjoy it :)

story: • I am a life long musician. I play multiple instruments and sing.  As I have lived my life, I have turned to poetry and then song writing as a means of expression. A lot of my songs are taken from my own personal life experience or the  lives of others.

story:
Hi guys, It's your boy K to the O

If you landed on this page, i just want to let you know you are an amazing person. I started doing music in the latter parts of 2019/beginning of 2020 and I so far, the journey has been a very epic one. I have received so much love from so many supporters and i will forever be grateful to everyone who has supported me.

My first album - Highly Confidential was phenomenal. It brought so much joy to people all across the globe that I would have never thought would listen to my music. The album is being played on radio stations in countries like China, Panama, France, Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa, United States, Iceland and many other countries and all of this has been possible through the support of God and everyone who has played my music

So, yeah, by the grace of God, my music journey has been very successful but what next? Do I just stop there? The answer is 'definitely not.' I am a strong believer in striving for excellence and I believe that with your help, we can get to greater heights. 

Saying this, I am pleased to announce that my next body of work will be an EP of 6 songs called 'Keep Your Head Above Water'. This EP will make you smile, dance and even cry (tears of joy I hope). It will help people mentally and spiritual through these trailing period and hopefully put a little bit of sunshine in the atmosphere.

Wow, you're still here. If you’re still reading, I am going to assume you have liked what you have read. And, if you’re still on the fence, check out my previous album 'Highly Confidential' which is out on all platforms: https://distrokid.com/hyperfollow/kofi8/highly-... 

God bless you,
K.O.F.I

 

What We Need

Making an international body of work is not a walk in the park as many may think. We have to think of many costs. This is a breakdown of the cost involved in the full production of 'Keep your Head Above Water' EP. I will try to keep it simple:

  1. Purchasing Beats - £400.00 (This will cover the cost for licensing each song so I can have full rights to it when it is played anywhere)
  2. Recording & Mixing - £300.00 (Cost for Recording, Engineering Cost & Mastering for 6 songs)
  3. Marketing Cost - £500 (Paid Ads, Promotion on different channels and platforms)
  4. Music Video - £300 (This will cover the cost of 1 music video for the EP)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this project, that is totally fine. I am certain that if you could, you would not hesitate to help out. You can still do something to go a long way.

- Firstly, I would like you to personally share this campaign with 7 people. That means tell your family &  your friends and hopefully, they can contribute. Remember, nothing is too little.

-  Secondly, I would like you to share this campaign on your social media platforms using the Indiegogo Sharing tool. It could also go a long way to achieve my goal. 

 

Thank You,

God bless you for giving!

story:
Your brotherhoods needs you.

 

To make the new album & it's release we are in need of your help.

There has been so much blood, sweat & tears behind this record & yet again we are out of money.
And we hope that we can count on you all once again to reach our goal.

The plan is to have two videos for two very strong singles & with your contribution we will make it two great ones.

So join us

story:
This Me

My name is Lauren Leigh. I like to sing. I am a singer.

I come from a super musical family. Eve Selis is my auntie and Claudio Martin is my father, both musical legends in San Diego. 

 (I used to hate name-dropping but now I don't so whatever.) 

 I've always done other people's music but have been writing my own songs. And you know what? I'm over not having a little piece of creativity that I can call mine. I've been on the San Diego music scene professionally for five years and have grown to love the excitement of being a background vocalist, as well as a front-woman for several cover bands. I've worked hard, hustled and struggled to get by as a working musician. But this year my hard work has paid off and I got my first tour with The Pink Floyd Experience opening up for Foreigner in Canada.   

This tour reinforced the idea that I'm doing what I should be doing.  I've been close to giving up, but what artist hasn't? It takes courage to write your own stuff and bitch, I'm courageous.  So let's do this, yeah? 

What I Need 

Okay, it takes a lot of mulah to make a record, but luckily we are only making an EP. HA!

I am estimating that it will take a minimum of $6,000 to make a bare bones EP for release.  However, I am setting a goal of $10,000.  Let me break down how that money will be spent:

  • Paying for production and mixing.  Duh. I am working with Fernando Perdomo at Reseda Ranch Studios! A dream come true!  
  • Guest Musicians-- Pay the talent. I can't do it on my own and honestly gross, who does that? My band will consist of local legends Sam Hunt, Joshua Taylor, Joshua Weinstein, Tony Econom, Harley Magsino, Carissa Schroeder, Sandi King and probably a few more because I have VISIONS. 
  • Mastering.  I want to work with the one and only Fernando Perdomo (Echo in the Canyon) and his ears on this.  I trust him more than anyone to get it right. 
  • Distribution.  iTunes, Spotify, Pandora, and all the digital things, as well as good, old-fashioned hard copy CD's for me to sell at shows. I want to use Groove House and their Eco-sleeves to provide an eco-friendly case with album art. 
  • Promotions.  I need to create a promo kit and get it into professional promoters hands for the best chance at getting heard by the right people. I want to use Borerro Visuals for the kit, promoters TBD. 
  • Extra money (anything over $6000) goes toward making everything BETTER. Album art, music video, any extra stuff I couldn't do to make the EP better because it's expensive (extra tracks, musicians, guest vocalists). Anything over that will allow me to not have to grind and hustle so hard every week to make ends meet, and I'll be able to take an extra day in the studio and work on this. 

What You Get

  • You get perks! Perky perks! Check out the perks in the perk section. Perks.
  • This includes lots of stuff.
  • FOR EXAMPLE: getting a personalized thank you postcard, maybe a free digital download,  a shout out on insta, a polaroid photo from recording sesison, having your very own house concert or even getting producer credits! 

The Impact

I mean, music is my life.  I want to have something to show my son when he's older. Your ears will like it. It could be a game changer for my career. BOOM. Impact.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? I get it. I'm broke too. 

Share this campaign on your social medias. 

I promise you, it helps more than you know. Maybe you know someone who never knew they needed me to need them until you shared it on your facebook.  Maybe your great aunt Hilde is destined to be a Lauren Leigh fan, and it's all up to you.  Pressa the button.

story:
Walking Into The Black

 

Thank you so much for checking out my Indiegogo page. I'm excited for this opportunity to share my newest work Walking Into the Black. Every record encapsulates a period of an artist’s life and this period happens to be, well... dark. I had an 8 month period that stopped me cold. It was the perfect storm - personal grief, conflict, illness, transitions, major house repairs (burst pipes), and more. In the midst of it all, I had a week-long silent retreat at a Trappist monastery in Kentucky staring at me on the calendar. I thought about cancelling, but something inside told me to go.

 

 

On my second night at the Abbey, one of the monks gave me permission to let it all out and encouraged me not to censor myself. For the next five days, I ‘walked into the black’ feverishly writing. These eleven songs are not what you think would come from a place of silent serenity and perfect weather. They are honest, raw, brooding, vulnerable, strange and also... beautiful. They are human. This album is what I heard in the silence of that week.

It's not all autobiographical. Embedded within me is a profound belief that it is an artist’s job to bare witness to his time in history, to ask the right questions and to express, (in the words of Picasso), “the horrifying, passionate and pleasing events in the world, shaping himself completely in their image.” 

We live in unprecedentedly confusing times and yet I find myself being more and more drawn to certain universal themes - 'the poor will always be among us,' 'war begets war,' 'love drives out fear'. I am most passionate about engaging with the parts of us that are fragile and vulnerable and if art has nothing to do with investigating these areas, then what is it truly for? I learned that exploring the dark corners and expressing them with as much honesty and authenticity as one can muster up is a way to discover the most penetrating light.

 

"Will the birds start singing?

Will the bells start ringing?

Will the dawn start bringing good news? Good news?

We love, we laugh, we bruise.

It’s all that we can do

                                              How long until the sun breaks through?                                                                        

FROM 'SIX MINUTES TWENTY SECONDS'

 

The Process & Team

The songs have groove and they needed a band and a good one. I returned home and arranged the material slowly this past summer with the musical aid of Andrew Saliba (guitar), Ian Thompson (bass), Andy Szumowski (drums) and Martin Spence (piano). They brought so much creative energy to these songs - adding new sections, intensifying harmonies and yes, finding the perfect grooves. We recorded the rhythm tracks over a weekend in October with Ian Gorman at La Luna Studio in Kalamazoo. The band absolutely nailed it in these sessions and truly gave us the definitive performances of these songs. 

 

 

Then, on to overdubs with the wonderful Drew Elliot at Hope College. I had the honor of recording the strings on my last album Fear Not with Drew and was blown away by his skill as well as the facilities at Hope. These sessions were also unique in that a group of Drew's students in the recording arts program were in attendance for hands on training. In this sessions, we recorded the incredible Debra Perry & Majestic Praise (previously featured on Queen Bee), Jen Fortosis (previously featured on After Sally), Patty Pierzchala, additional guitar, Rhodes/Hammond B3, and my vocals. All in all, the tracking is now complete! We have mixing and mastering left to go.

 

Photo by Josh Kaufman

 

The Party

You are probably reading this because my music has communicated to you in the past and that is incredibly powerful and meaningful to me! My aim is to create an album that will touch you personally. What this means is a product that is recorded and packaged beautifully and professionally. It also means working with a wonderful team of artists; many of whom freelance full-time. It takes a community to sustain the arts and I am grateful to be both a receiver and a benefactor.  

 

PRODUCTION COSTS (Estimated):

$3,350 - Room rentals, engineering, mixing & mastering

$1,000 - Short-run vinyl pressing. Vinyl is back! How cool would it be to hear this music on a record player?

$1,500- Album Packaging/Printing

$300 - Rewards Shipping

$300 - Marketing/Digital Release Setup

$1,850 - Artists

$400 - Indiegogo platform Fees

___________________

TOTAL: $8,700

 

The Impact

 

“Blake’s breathtaking eye for significant detail and his skill for getting inside of characters to reveal flesh and blood human lives is nearly unparalleled among modern songwriters, no matter if they are mainstream or indie.”    -No Depression

 

I have been an independent musician for ten years now and have slowly built a following; particularly in the US, Netherlands and Italy. I have done this from the quality of my songwriting and performance, rather than a popular social media platform. I believe I have something important to say and the message has always been my focus. Fear Not (2017) and Alone On The World Stage (2015) garnered praise in publications such as the Huffington Post, American Songwriter, Paste, Folk Radio UK and have made numerous 'Best of the Year' lists. Both of these records were crowdsourced and the money raised enabled them to be heard without the support of a major label. I see Walking Into The Black completing a trilogy of strong albums that have already produced fruit.

 

Risks & Challenges

In the past, I've used Kickstarter, a platform that uses an 'all or nothing' approach' (i.e. If you raise your goal then you receive the money. If not, then you don't get a cent). In those cases, I hadn't started production. This record is different because as soon as I finished writing the final song, I felt an urgency to capture the feeling and share it. I wanted to hold on to my experience at the Monastery and let go of the pain of those eight months. I wanted to express my current thoughts on the world around me. So, I jumped right into recording and its expense.

It is a risk to create independent art. There is no insurance when things go haywire. I am hopeful I can raise the funds to finish this piece of art. As it is nearing the finish line, I don't fear its completion artistically, but financial support is crucial to get these songs to you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. We have 35 days to make it happen and even though I have a loud voice, my reach is only so far! 

Please share, post and spread the word! It will also help to build the excitement for release day.

 

Photo by Derek Ketchum

Vinyl is back! How cool would it be to hear this music on a record player?$1,500- Album Packaging/Printing$300 - Rewards Shipping$300 - Marketing/Digital Release Setup$1,850 - Artists$400 - Indiegogo platform Fees___________________TOTAL: $8,700 The Impact “Blake’s breathtaking eye for significant detail and his skill for getting inside of characters to reveal flesh and blood human lives is nearly unparalleled among modern songwriters, no matter if they are mainstream or indie.”    -No Depression I have been an independent musician for ten years now and have slowly built a following; particularly in the US, Netherlands and Italy. I have done this from the quality of my songwriting and performance, rather than a popular social media platform. I believe I have something important to say and the message has always been my focus. Fear Not (2017) and Alone On The World Stage (2015) garnered praise in publications such as the Huffington Post, American Songwriter, Paste, Folk Radio UK and have made numerous 'Best of the Year' lists. Both of these records were crowdsourced and the money raised enabled them to be heard without the support of a major label. I see Walking Into The Black completing a trilogy of strong albums that have already produced fruit. Risks & ChallengesIn the past, I've used Kickstarter, a platform that uses an 'all or nothing' approach' (i.e. If you raise your goal then you receive the money. If not, then you don't get a cent). In those cases, I hadn't started production. This record is different because as soon as I finished writing the final song, I felt an urgency to capture the feeling and share it. I wanted to hold on to my experience at the Monastery and let go of the pain of those eight months. I wanted to express my current thoughts on the world around me. So, I jumped right into recording and its expense.It is a risk to create independent art. There is no insurance when things go haywire. I am hopeful I can raise the funds to finish this piece of art. As it is nearing the finish line, I don't fear its completion artistically, but financial support is crucial to get these songs to you. Other Ways You Can HelpPlease help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. We have 35 days to make it happen and even though I have a loud voice, my reach is only so far! Please share, post and spread the word! It will also help to build the excitement for release day. Photo by Derek Ketchum

story:
Short Summary

Hailing from Los Angeles, Fleischkrieg is a new take on heavy electronic music.  Fusing retro-synth wave electronic overtones, with crushing guitars, topped off with haunting and aggressive vocals.  We were founded by Richard Cranor, a film and video director (Star Leaf) with a passion for moving and soul-stirring soundscapes. Early 2019, Richard began a musical journey writing synthwave style music to carry the provocatively introspective lyrics that plagued him.  Later in the year, he added Thomas Crawford of Ceraphym to the fold as guitarist and co-writer.  Adding his 20+ years of music and entertainment experience to finish what turned to be Fleischkrieg's signature sound, lovingly referred to as "BrutalWave".

This campaign is to help fund our debut release to match the level of quality as our vision.  To aid us in that vision, we are working with Producer/Singer/Songwriter D-Punk from DK-Zero.  We are also budgeting for multiple music videos that will help fans visualize the subject matter that inspired them. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a base goal of $5,000 USD broken down as follows (in order of priority):

  • $1,200 - Production/Mixing/Mastering
  • $1,900 - Initial Vinyl Pressing (200)
  • $350 - Initial CD Pressing (100)
  • $1,550 - Initial Merch Order (T-shirts,Hoodies, Stickers, Posters, etc.)

Anything above our goal will go toward costs of the music videos.

We're offering several perks in support of this campaign.  All perks include digital access (streaming and downloading) to Herzblut two weeks before the official release. 

Herzblut album perks include:

  • CD
  • Vinyl
  • T-shirts
  • Hoodies
  • Posters

Exclusive campaign support perks include:

  • Album Liner Notes
  • Handwritten Lyrics
  • Agile 7 String Baritone Guitar signed and used by Thomas
  • Acting Part in upcoming music video

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some things you can also do to help us out:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page.
  • Spread the word about Fleischkrieg on your social media.
  • Follow and stream our music on your favorite streaming service!
  • Follow us.

Sincerely thank you for your support.

-FLEISCHKRIEG

story:
Story:

Hi! We're Joe and Beau. We play music as Gold Light and Snakemusk respectively. We teamed up last year over a love of Hank Williams and The Everly Brothers et al., and started a little duo project that evolved into an all out 5 piece band. We wrote a bunch of original songs and recorded them over the course of last year. We now have together a full-length album of these songs that we would love to release as a vinyl record.. BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP TO DO SO!

 

Releasing a record is fairly expensive, and we are not all that rich. We are aiming to raise funds to help with the cost of pressing vinyl. It's always been a dream to release an album on vinyl and we feel we have the perfect one to do so with, and by contributing even the smallest amount you will help us achieve this dream!

 

What We Need & What You Get

It's pretty simple. We're only looking for help with the actual vinyl pressing. For 300 units from United Pressing, it is $2,001 + Shipping. That's where the money is going. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will pay the rest out of our own pockets. But like we said, we are not all that rich.

So think of this as basically a pre-order. We're also keeping what you get really simple: You get the record. Or you get a cassette, or you get a CD, or you get a digital download. (We're paying for the CDs and Cassettes out of our pockets.)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps! Seriously, it all adds up! I did one other Kickstarter project years back that was successful for an indie film, and the whole reason things like this are able to get funded, is to get A LOT of people to contribute just SMALL AMOUNTS. If you're reading this and you were able to give just $5 bucks, we would be well on our way! 

Also, simply spreading the word helps IMMENSELY. Indiegogo even has really simple to use share tools, so help us get the word out and help our dreams come true!

story:
Short Summary​

New Boom CD & Tour

Drummer, guitarist, composer, band leader & teacher from New York. Son & nephew of professional drummers in NYC & Westchester County. I have been playing professionally since the age of 14. Sideman on many recordings of Jazz, Funk, Rock, Pop, Latin & World Music. In addition to concerts,recordings, touring & teaching, I have composed music for & played in musical theatre in New York & Vienna. 2 previous cds received critical acclaim in the USA,UK,Canada, Austria, Germany & Belgium.

This will be my 3rd CD and 10th tour. I financed everything myself in the past but I'm coming off of several years of deaths, divorce and economic destruction so I need help. Frankly, I was wary about asking for money but after everything that's happenend I NEED to do this more than ever!

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise €5,000 to record, master, produce  & package the cds. This includes artwork & pics in & on the cd as well as setting up downloadable tracks. After that it's travel costs and believe me, it all adds up very quickly. I know people who've spent more than this on recording alone.

The first thing you get is the satisfaction of helping an independent artist. Think of salmon swimming up stream or David & Goliath!

Ofcourse you get the new cd or any combination of previous cds plus the new one. There's an instructional dvd for drummers and band performance for your event or venue. There will be co-producer credits for the generous contributors.

I will do my best to reach the goal in 60 days but if I don't I will just keep going privtely until I reach it. That means that everything will happen later than planned but IT WILL HAPPEN. I never give up.

The Impact

Music is the one true language and even religion because it reaches EVERYONE! It breaks down all barriers; age,socio-economic, political, religious and cultural. EVERYTHING! I really feel blessed to be a musician because no matter where I play or what kind of music, people experience Joy. That is a blessing. It's also a responsibility. So not only will you experience your own joy, you'll be helping to spread joy. And we need that.

As I said before I've done this alone in the past so with your help I KNOW I can do it again.

 

Risks & Challenges

In another life in New York I had an investment broker's license and I invested people's money. I believe that makes me uniquely qualified to raise and handle these funds. I also have several friends and aquaintances who have successfully crowdfunded or raised moeny for their projects and businesses

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute you can still help. Please share on your social networks and do use the Indiegogo share tools. You folks who've heard my music or seen me play know what the people will get. Please help spread the word. You'll be spreading joy at a time when we really need it.

THANK YOU!!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Kate Lucid is my musical identity, which was born almost as soon as my regular identity. Family archives attest the first singing on camera at the age of exactly 2 years and 3 months. And it was nothing less than a love song. (Watch out for a video of this coming soon on my social pages!)

I started writing songs when I was 9 (however, you'd laugh if you heard my first creations imitating Britney Spears). Since then I've developed a unique style, which some describe as lyrical, deep, sophisticated, soulful. I accompany myself on the piano, which I've been playing since the age of 6 (I have classical music background). 

Looking back at all the years of performances, music contests and songwriting, sometimes I feel abashed that I still haven't recorded a professional album. All I can say is that it has been long time coming. I feel that I owe it to my music and, more importantly, to all the people who have expressed their admiration over the years to make a high-quality record that all of us would be able to enjoy. 

All the songs are ready to be recorded (although I still have to make some choices, since I have many more than I could possible include in one album). The recording will take place here in Cambridge, UK, where I currently reside. All I need is to raise enough funds to make this happen. And this is were you can become part of this fascinating story!

If you haven't heard any of my songs yet (or would just like to enjoy them once more ;), here are a few videos for you to start with. For more please visit the social media links below. 

Official Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/katelucid.music/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/katelucid/

YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/KateLucid

    

 

I have been truly blessed to work with some remarkabe musicians throughout my musical lifetime. Here's what they have to say about me. 

"Kate is a first-rate musician - Excellent pitch and a rich and luscious quality to her voice that makes you want to hear more and more! One hears the bottom end of the voice and thinks - wow! and then she surprises you by carrying the same stunning quality all the way up! What a talent!" 

Eric Delson, Conductor and composer, Musical Director of the Brussels Choral Society, Head of Performing Arts Department at the International School of Brussels

 

www.brusselschoralsociety.com

"Kate and I shared the same venue, for some musical event in Brussels, a few years ago. My first impression of her was that she was quite attentive to details, checking carefully the piano of the jazz bar, when my own request was ways simpler: if that machine could produce any sound, it was fine for me. (laugh)

Later, Kate’s performance caught my attention: her songs were sophisticated, delicate and full of emotions. There was something happening, as if every note was was carrying its own load of beauty. It was complex, almost like classical music in a pop world.

My biggest surprise was when, after finishing my own set of songs, peacefully sipping a beer, Kate came to me, commenting on one of my songs, giving a kind appreciation of it, spontaneously. It was a nice and generous attitude from her, and the beginning of a mutual interest in our respective music.

I discovered more of her work, as stunning as I could expect, and asked her to be part of my song “Eleganto Ni”, on which she played a smooth, rich and inspired part of synthesised piano. The recording session was all matching Kate’s image: professional, attentive, inspired and kind.

Knowing that Kate would finally record her own solo album is a wonderful news, not only for me and her fans, but also for those who didn’t have yet the chance to listen to her delightful music".

Gilles Snowcat sings love songs after dark since 1988, and is more recently involved in massage and hypnosis music, after finishing writing an ebook, "The Rock Star Paradox". He never left the rock scene though, and is currently recording a new album, that he already humbly depicts as 'an event that will make the baby-boom look like a joke'.

www.gilles-snowcat.com

"Kate and I met up for a jam session in Brussels couple of years ago. Her voice carries a conviction that reflects any lyric she delivers. Her writing abilities is in a league of it's own and I deeply feel the music industry needs more of a talent like Kate's, as she can definitely contribute to the world at large". 

Tomi Temidara, singer-songwriter, Live show finalist on The Voice, Flanders, Belgium

www.facebook.com/TomiTVVV/

"I know Kate Lucid as Kate Sukmanyuk as we were classmates at the lyceum. Since 2005 till 2009 we sang together at the chorus. And already at that time I found how great a musician she is, as she is not only a singer, but also an excellent pianist and songwriter. When I heard her first song “A dream”(Mriya) I realized that she is a gifted one! While studying me and Kate were a part of the quartet and worked closely at the Lyceum ensemble. I guess it was quite a good contribution to her musical future. As a multifunctional musician Kate has a great future! I believe that her first album will definitely burst the music industry!"

Darina Kirilko, singer, vocal coach, lead vocalist at EXCEPTION music band, quarter-finalist of “The Voice”, Ukraine

darinakirilko.com

 

In sum, I need to collect £5,300. If we manage to collect more than that (fingers crossed!), the extra money will go into making music videos and/or additional track recordings. If we collect less than planned, this would only mean that I would have to cut the number of songs I can include on the album. But in any case, the record will be made, even if it only includes 4-5 songs. 

Here's the cost breakdown:

 

I'm very excited to offer some really unique incentives, which you can choose on the right of the page (desktop) or just under the overview section on the main page (mobile). 

If you cannot make a contribution at the moment but would still like to help, you can do more than you think! For projects like these it is extremely important to spread the word, so please share this page on your social media pages.

Thank you so much!

story: Whew, it’s been a year! For those of you who don't know me - I'm Mady. I moved to Nashville in 2015 to go to school and pursue songwriting. I've been at it for a few years now and have released music along the way. But it's time for something new! I graduated college, started writing in an entirely different genre, released a new single, and started a new job. Now I’m SO ready to share more of these new songs with you. It feels like a piece of me I’ve been keeping to myself and can’t wait to show the world. As a post grad coffee shop employee/worship leader/songwriter I’m not exactly swimming in coins, so I need your help to fund this project. And because I would never ask you for free money, I want to raise funds for this project through preorders of physical EPs, limited edition merch designed by my very talented friends, and maybe even some house shows or church events. If you have at all enjoyed my new single, a show I’ve played, or even just like me as a friend, I would love it if you could support this campaign. Even if you can't support monetarily just sharing this on social media helps. I appreciate all of you and can’t wait to release this music!

story:
This year the event takes place on August 10th  2019 and traditionally everything’s on the house: entrance, music, drinks, vibe! But as we are celebrating RadioActive’s 20th anniversary, we thought of raising some money to facilitate its logistics and organization, so that Riris can spread his music love to each and every one of us. This campaign will essentially help Riris rent hi-end sound system, buy lots of ice and pay for post-party cleaning services. Do you want to further support the RadioActive Street Party? Well, show your love by being part of this campaign.

You stand a click away from supporting Riris RadioActive Street Party 2019.

All contributions are welcome, no matter how big or small. 

Please note that when you try to make a donation, the amount will appear in US dollars. Ignore this, as the amount will be automatically translated to EUR, once your donation is finalised.

with many thanks,

Dimitris Kouzelis
story_txt: This year the event takes place on August 10th  2019 and traditionally everything’s on the house: entrance, music, drinks, vibe! But as we are celebrating RadioActive’s 20th anniversary, we thought of raising some money to facilitate its logistics and organization, so that Riris can spread his music love to each and every one of us. This campaign will essentially help Riris rent hi-end sound system, buy lots of ice and pay for post-party cleaning services. Do you want to further support the RadioActive Street Party? Well, show your love by being part of this campaign.You stand a click away from supporting Riris RadioActive Street Party 2019.All contributions are welcome, no matter how big or small. Please note that when you try to make a donation, the amount will appear in US dollars. Ignore this, as the amount will be automatically translated to EUR, once your donation is finalised.with many thanks,Dimitris Kouzelis

story:
Hi !

I am Arnaud Renard and I’ve been working on some new songs on my guitar and I’m really excited about them. I can’t wait for you to hear them! I have already found a studio to record my album and hoping to make future releases as well ! The only thing standing in my way at the moment is financial. Producing music at a high standard is an expensive process, involving many costs.  You can help me release my first album !

 

My timeline is to record the songs on my guitar in the studio in mid-September, October will be for the mastering and hopefully release the song in November.

 

The costs:

Studio hire, production and sound engineering 860€

Visual image 50€

Publishing fees 40€

Indiegogo fees 70€

 

Please Share this project ! 

Thanks

story:
I’m Kris Schultz, a Singer-Songwriter from Austin, TX.

I took the long way to songwriting, and arrived later than most. For much of my adult life, I worked for other musicians and bands on the road, helping them out in any way that was needed. I slung merch, I drove vans, I lugged heavy gear, I even did some road managing. But it never crossed my mind to try playing music, myself. 

Until May 2017, that is, when  I found myself with some extra time, and on a whim, I bought a cheap guitar. Around the same time, my longtime friend Kacy Crowley (who I’d assisted on the road) had started her business as a songwriting mentor and artist development consultant.  On yet another whim (and surprising myself as I said it) I mentioned that maybe I would be a client. She seemed just as surprised as I was, and asked me if I could sing.  I said, “I have no idea. I might be tone deaf, for all I know.” She came over. I dusted off the three chords I had learned from a drummer friend sixteen years before (but had never practiced).  I played Stevie Nicks’ “After the Glitter Fades” with the two of those chords that didn’t scare me. And I think we were both pleasantly surprised I wasn’t tone deaf.


Kacy knew I’d written stories and poems all my life, and gave me an assignment to try to write a song.  I surprised myself yet again when I committed to it, and wrote my very first song all by myself - music, melody and lyrics.  Once I discovered I could write songs, and sing, this whole new sense of hope and optimism overtook me. I went from being a person who woke up at the very last minute each morning, to a person who woke up two hours early to practice and write.  Each night, I couldn’t wait to wake up the next day with the possibility of a new song or some other new musical discovery waiting for me. That feeling continues today.

 

I’ve spent the last couple years playing as many shows as I possibly can. I’ve stuck to the routine of waking up early and writing and practicing every single day. I’m not exaggerating at all when I say discovering songwriting has changed my life.  It’s given me a new life where I feel like I am finally completely the person I am meant to be.

 

The last few months, I’ve had the opportunity to play a few times with a full band (Brian Mendes on drums, Palli on bass, Charlie Richards on guitar, baritone guitar, and lap steel, and the aforementioned Kacy Crowley on background vocals!)  I’ve known everyone in the band for years, and have always admired their work.  I still geek out over the fact that they are playing the songs I wrote on my couch.  And right from the start, everything they played just sounded like I imagined it in my mind.  We went into Ron D’Argenio’s studio recently and recorded two songs, and I’m so proud of what we did, and so ridiculously happy with the results, I decided there was no way around it…. we needed to record eight more songs, for a full length album.  And Ron was so welcoming, with such a kind presence, and is such a talented engineer, I’m confident his studio is the perfect place to record the whole thing.

There have been so many people who have been such an amazing part of this whole journey with me, right from the very first show I played in November of 2017. From people coming out to the shows, sending me encouragement, just generally being amazing to me when I decided to take this crazy leap of faith and throw myself into writing and playing music.  I appreciate that so much, and I hope you will all consider being a part of this segment of the journey, too.  Obviously, contributing monetarily is a big help, but so is sharing this link with friends, talking about this campaign, inviting your friends to check out the music or join you at a show. It all helps, and I’m genuinely grateful for every ounce of support I have been given, continue to get, and may get in the future.  Thank you so much for reading all the way through, and for being a part of this. It means the world to me.

story:
Overview

My name is Gwendolyn Collins.  I am a soul singer/songwriter and storyteller out of MD (USA). I am producing my third project, Storytelling Side III and I would love if you would partner with me to make this vision come true.  I'm very excited to share these storytelling moments with you.  Your contributions are key to helping me make this happen.  As many of you know creating an album is very expensive yet the feeling of completion leaves me feeling amazingly amazing.  By investing in myself, I've previously self-funded two albums, self-produced and funded both national and international shows highlighting myself and other talented indie artists, written and produced for other indie artists all through my movement #TheVirgoLounge but I want to take this album to the next level.  

With your partnership/pledge, I'll be able to do that by hiring session musicians so you can feel the live experience, utilizing recording studios outside of my home, work with top producers and engineers, as well as bringing in some top notch artists as features. 

What I Need

This campaign is the sole vehicle to complete my third storytelling series.  This album is a window into my soul where I get to describe everything I've learned about love, loss and the beauty of music.  In order to professionally record and produce this album, I need the financial support of my music community and that's where you come in:)

What's in it for YOU!

Your contributions to this campaign will be rewarded!! 

I have some really cool partner perks you can choose from depending on the amount you decide to give.  These partner perks are offered to you in exchange for your support.  The rewards vary from downloads of the newest album, signed cds, t-shirts, and really cool goodie bags packed with so many musical delights. 

If I don't reach my goal of $14,000 the money that IS raised below the goal will still be used toward the album while the remainder will come from me.  This could slow down the process however the rewards that are promised will still be distributed once the album is complete.

 

The Impact

As an independent artist, I receive no funds from a big label.  I have no big marketing machine behind me, yet I have done all I can to continually put out quality music as well as support other independent artists thru having them on LIVE shows around the world, showcasing their music on my radio show and sharing their music to my amazing listening audience.  I understand how it takes a collaborative and sharing mindset to make this music work and to spread the music worldwide.  

Often it takes the help of my listeners (new and old) to continue to create music for the soul and those things motivate me to keep making that type of music.

I only have 60 days to reach my $18,000 goal!!  and I believe it can be done.  During this entire process I will share with you how I am allocating the funds giving you sneak peaks into the recording process, studio time, makings of merchandise, photo-shoots and rehearsals.

Every single penny will go towards the completion and marketing of this album.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by SHARING, SHARING and SHARING:) This is the most important thing you can do if you can or can't contribute.  

Much love to every person who has been a part of my storytelling journey and every new person.  Like I always say, there is no me without you...  

Much Love...Gwendolyn AKA Gwennie

story:
Why we are going to Bristol, TN

 

 

The Lucky 5 is a hot swing jazz band inspired by the jazz manouche sound of Django Reinhardt. We've been playing music together for 10 years.We have the opportunity to record a reel to reel album with Bigtone Records in Bristol, TN, and to do some gigs along the way. We have not recorded an album for a while, and in the past 2 years we have some exciting new additions to our band, and have been working on fresh traditional and  original compositions. Bigtone is known for their live true analog reel to reel recording process. Our music is particularly perfect for this type of recording. 

Making the trip will be Kip Beacco (guitar), Matt Downing (upright bass), Jonathan Talbott (fiddle), Carolyn Dufraine (trombone), Will Carroll (drums) and Emily Herder (clarinet). 

 

Cost of the trip/recording, and your perks

The cost for the week long trip to Bigtone Records in Bristol, TN, will be $10,000, and includes the following:

 

Road transportation for the band  of six (rental van, gas, driver)

Expenses (meals on the road) for the band

Housing/hotels when needed on the road 

Studio time and editing for final product from Bigtone Records

Production of vinyl album, CD, and downloadable digital files

 

Premiums: 

 

This is such a great opportunity for us - we are over the moon with the possibility of sharing our latest music with our friends. Your support comes with our thanks and the following percs:

 

$5 - Lucky 5 sticker

$15 - Digital Download of LP

$20 -  signed CD

$25 - Lucky 5 T-shirt

$40 - signed Vinyl 

$50  - signed Vinyl and CD

$100 - t shirt, album, CD

$500 - favorite  song recorded (10 available)

$1000 - Venue Appearance

$1500 - Private house concert

$3000 - Producer credit on album

The Impact

 

Your contribution will make it possible for us to take our band to the next level. Recording is expensive, and while we play as much music as we can, we all have day jobs. We love live music, and think that is the best way to experience what we do, but the true analog recording we will do at Bigtone Records is the next best thing. Bands need to record. For spotify, for festival applications, for new venues, and for our friends. We are so excited about our work in the past year we want to be  able to preserve  and share it with  you.

This is totally doable, and we are doing it.

Risks & Challenges

We are doing this, the studio is booked,  and we will get to Tennessee one way or the other. Your support will make this venture manageable for us (this is  not a luxurious budget).  It will allow us to press the recording to vinyl and CD, cover the costs of printing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a donation, please share the campaign and our posts on FB  and IG, come to one of our gigs, and join us at our album send  off party on December 8, at the Prairie Whale in Great Barrington, MA.

story:
Overview

The Gunn Choir is raising money for our choir trip to New York City in May 2020 to perform in a Choir Festival in Riverside Church, where we will perform along with choirs from around the country. This fundraiser makes it possible for every singer to go on the tour, regardless of means, and we are asking for your help to raise $20,000 to make it happen.

Who We Are

The Gunn High School Choir is 125 students from Palo Alto, CA. Singing in an ensemble is a transformative experience for these young adults, giving them a purpose and a community.

Over the past twenty years, the Gunn Choir has traveled to Europe, Canada, Mexico, New York City and Disneyland, providing hundreds of families with financial support so their children can participate. Students say this experience is life changing - possibly the most incredible experience of their high school years.

Our Need

While some schools send "club" choirs comprised only of those singers who can afford to travel, at Gunn High School we believe that this experience should be available to every singer regardless of their means. This scholarship fund supports those singers.

We are raising $28,000 this year to support more than 20 teen singers who need financial assistance to make the trip to New York City.   The Choir will raise $8,000 selling tickets to our extensive Gunn Student/Staff Musical in the spring and by singing at Senior Centers, Kiwanis, Rotary Clubs over the holidays.  Every member of the choir is behind this Indiegogo campaign to raise an additional $20,000 to ensure that no singer is left behind. Even so, we cannot reach our goal without your help.

We need donations from our choir supporters to make the tour possible for every student. 

Click on the boxes to the right to view different levels of support, from a $25 Audience level contribution to a $2500 Conductors Circle donation (which earns you a performance from the Chamber Choir or a shared dinner with the choir directors). Please give, and consider sharing our message through email or social media with your friends, family, co-workers, and neighbors.

story:
WHO WE ARE
Incase you dont know who we are and how we got here, we're Black Coast, a heavy metal band from Stoke-On-Trent who are embarking on our biggest and most exciting chapter yet.


Since our inception in 2015 we have had the opportunity to travel the world playing music and meeting some incredible people. Our music has been backed by the likes of Daniel P Carter @ BBC Radio 1, Alex Baker @ Kerrang Radio, Editors at Kerrang!, Metal Hammer, Rock Sound Magazine and more.

WHAT WE'RE DOING

A debut album is no mean feat, especially for an unsigned band without any financial backing from a record label.  We enter the studio on the 9th November to start putting together an album that we have been building towards and writing for more than 18 months.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise £10,000 which is a fraction of the overall cost of this record and the campaign that will follow. We're going to be working with some of the best people in the business to put our name in the forefront of the heavy music scene:
- Lower Lane Studios for all Recording
- Hold Tight PR for UK Press
- Atom Splitter PR for USA Press
- Collision Course PR for Australian Press
- TKO Bookings for all Live Performances
- Capital Artist Management for all Management and Campaign Management
- Blood Blast Distribution for Digital Distribution
With our team in place we are fully confident that we will be able to take our music to the next level and produce a record that we can be proud of.

WHAT IF?

Even if we dont reach our goal of £10,000, the funds raised will be invested into the following:
- Recording of our Album
- Mixing of our Album
- Mastering of our Album
- Artwork Production of our Album
- Press Agents and Campaigns worldwide
- Reproduction of our Album on CD & Vinyl in Physical Format
- Online Digital Marketing
- Online Advertising
- Music Video Production

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We've put together a huge list of perks that are available now and will help us reach our goal. Every CD or Vinyl will come signed by us as an additional way of saying thankyou for believing in us and this album campaign as a whole.
 
Without fans music wouldn't exist, we wouldn't exist. Join us and become a part of the Black Coast Family.
